detailedDescription:
An incredible opportunity to acquire this detached home in the heart of Kew Village. The property has been intelligently re-modelled and refurbished to create a contemporary living space suitable for the needs of modern living. Currently arranged as two separate dwellings, a three bedroom house over three floors and a two bedroom apartment to the top floor, the property could be perfect for families looking for ancillary accommodation for family or staff. The ground floor offers a superb open plan reception room complete with bespoke kitchen and bi-fold doors leading onto a large private rear garden. The bedrooms are laid out over two floors, a double bedroom with en-suite shower room on the ground floor, the master bedroom with en-suite shower room and a further double bedroom with Jack and Jill style bathroom. The top floors comprises a further two double bedrooms with one benefiting from an en-suite shower, a main family bathroom and a large open plan kitchen/living room with fully integrated kitchen. Additional benefits include a wine cellar with barrel bar to the basement, utility room and off street parking for two cars.

Situated in Kew Village where you will find an array of restaurants, cafes and village shops as well as Kew Gardens station. The Royal Botanic Gardens Kew, home to the world's most diverse collection of living plants is within walking distance. Richmond town centre offers a larger selection of retail outlets, restaurants and bars as well as Richmond Park, the largest of London’s Royal Parks. Richmond Station (Mainline & District Line) provides superb links into the City

detailedDescription:
A stunning apartment on Church Road with a beautiful communal garden

Location

The apartment occupies a convenient position within just a few hundred metres of the shops at Friars Stile Road, that cater superbly for day to day requirements and provide a charming village atmosphere. Whilst slightly further afield Richmond town offers a wonderful and sophisticated array of shops and restaurants, as well as the much acclaimed Richmond Theatre - situated on picturesque and historic Richmond Green. Richmond Park is also within a short and pleasant stroll and has 2300 acres of stunning deer inhabited woodland.

Richmond train station is accessed at the bottom of Church Road and provides a rapid and direct overland service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Line tube and overland to Stratford, via north London.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are amongst the best in the country.

Description

A wonderfully spacious Victorian apartment which occupies the entire first floor of this imposing building moments from 'Richmond Hill Village' and Richmond Park on Church Road.

The apartment offers an abundance of light and incredible volume with wonderfully high ceilings. The modern fully fitted kitchen and separate reception room sit parallel to each other, both benefitting from large sash windows ensuring an abundance of natural light fills the flat.

The space is flexible and is currently set up with two double bedrooms and two reception rooms but it could easily provide three double bedrooms. There is a family bathroom and one bedroom with an en-suite shower room.

This property also comes with the added benefit of access to wonderful communal gardens which are beautifully maintained.

detailedDescription:
This impressive property provides a magnificent opportunity for an incoming purchaser to completely develop the existing house into a stunning family home. Houses like this are rare to the market, particularly detached ones on corner plots, with a double garage and private off street parking.

The property is arranged over three floors and offers close to 4,000 sq ft of accommodation, and enjoys a number of charming and original period features such as high ceilings, feature fireplaces and large windows allowing plenty of natural light.

The overall accommodation is impressive, with an excellent balance between reception rooms and bedrooms. There are four reception rooms over the ground floor and eight bedrooms over the first and second floors, with four bathrooms, which provide prospective purchasers the significant scope to what could be created once any redevelopment is complete. There is a spacious rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn.

Kings Road is located on Richmond Hill within reach of the vibrant and excellent facilities of Richmond Town. Nearby places of interest include Kew Gardens, the 2,500 acres of royal parkland at Richmond Park, Twickenham Stadium and Ham House.

Schools in the area include King's House School, Old Vicarage School, Marshgate Primary School and The Vineyard School.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes) and is well placed for the A316/M3, M4 and M25 giving access to the airports at Heathrow and Gatwick, as well as the south coast and the west country.

detailedDescription:
Description

The house has been completely refurbished by the current owner to a high specification with wonderful open flexible spaces.

To the front elevation is a study/bedroom four with an engineered oak wood floor. An internal courtyard sits between the reception and the kitchen with bi-fold doors on two sides which open up to form a spectacular space. The kitchen is fitted with Miele and Siemens appliances with an induction hob. There is also a utility room and ground floor cloakroom. The limestone floor has zoned underfloor heating.

Two double bedrooms and a bathroom with duravit fittings and book matched limestone form the second floor with a master suite occupying the whole of the top floor, with a wall of fitted wardrobes, and an ensuite shower room.

The house also benefits from Cat 5 and 6 wiring, CCTV, full LED lighting and an alarm.

Contemporary houses are rarely available within Little Chelsea, with this home a particularly attractive example. Westfields Avenue is a pretty road of predominantly terraced Victorian properties, perfectly placed to enjoy the relaxed yet vibrant Little Chelsea and White Hart Lane community, with its excellent schools, transport links and restaurants, the latter including Rick Stein's first London venture, overlooking the river from Tideway Yard.

detailedDescription:
Doorsteps are very pleased to be able to offer to the market this newly refurbished, rarely available, quiet purpose built 2-bed ground floor flat, located opposite the river with river views. The flat has been renovated to a high standard with traditional decor but with a modern on-trend twist. There is residents parking to the rear of the property and there is the possibility of purchasing a private garage separately. Outside is a secure storage area, great for bikes and general storage.

The flat is perfectly located close to Hampton Village and it's cafes, pubs and local shops as well as Hampton Train station being less than a 10 minute walk away. The flat also benefits from being on a bus route for quick access to Kingston and Hampton pool is within a short walk. Directly opposite the flat by the river is a lovely seated area and is a great location to access the river for those who might have a paddle board or kayak or just fancy jumping in for a swim as some local residents do. Bushy park is also within close walking distance as well as the river walks.

The block itself is due full refurbishment in the next 2 years both outside and in communal areas, adding increased kerb appeal to an already very attractive flat.

The current owners have also extended the lease for a further 90 years with a period of 177 years remaining. There is an annual service charge, which is currently £323p.a. With a peppercorn ground rent.

detailedDescription:
Located moments from a selection of excellent schools, with a beautifully presented rear garden, we have this two double bedroom extended end of terrace property, boasting an abundance of off street parking.

Accommodation briefly comprises a convenient front porch providing a handy space for shoes and coats. Leading through we have the front reception room which has plenty space for all of the family. Centrally we have the dining room which has side aspect and two storage cupboards. To rear we have the kitchen extension. This is a fantastic space with plenty of sitted units, a gas hob and a vaulted ceiling giving it a fantastic feeling of space. Furthermore we have another storage cupboard and a ground floor w/c. Leading up to the first floor both the master and second are very comfortable double bedrooms. Each with fitted wardrobes as well. The family bathroom is a particular feature as it has recently been updated with a white suite, a huge walk in shower and floor to ceiling tiling.

Externally the rear garden is a great size. Mostly laid to lawn, with upgraded fences and a large decked area ideal for those who like to entertain. To the end we also have a large summer house, currently being used a home gym but could very well work as a home office, playroom or simply for some additional storage. With a potential complete onward chain already, early internal inspection is highly recommended!

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A superbly located contemporary detached family home with a fabulous garden

Location

Strawberry Hill Road is a very sought after residential road and part of a leafy conservation area located between Teddington and Twickenham, in the charming village of Strawberry Hill. The house is only moments away from Strawberry Hill Station providing a regular and direct service into London Waterloo. The property is also located close to many first class schools, both state and private, and is one of the reasons many potential buyers migrate to this area. The local schools include Newlands House, Radnor House, Waldegrave Girls, St Catherine's, St James's, The Mall, Teddington School, Hampton Boys and Lady Eleanor Holles.

The area is well suited for family life with extensive recreational facilities close by including Royal parks (Bushy Park and Richmond Park), the river and golf courses at Strawberry Hill and Fulwell. Twickenham and Teddington also have excellent amenities, including sophisticated shops, bars and restaurants.

Description

Built by the current owners this thoughtfully planned property is arranged over four floors with spacious and naturally light accommodation that provides superbly for both family life and more formal entertaining. The ground floor has a reception room to the front with a large east facing bay window, a further reception room to the middle and a fabulous and generously proportioned kitchen/family room to the rear, which opens onto the wonderful raised terrace and garden beyond. There is also a guest cloakroom as well as a store room and utility room on this level. The lower ground level provides a large studio/games room which includes a shower room and fitted galley kitchen. This floor (which also has its own independent access) benefits from plenty of natural light via a roof light and sliding/folding doors which open into a paved lightwell. The first floor contains 4 double bedrooms (2 with ensuite bathrooms) and a family bathroom. The high ceilinged second floor houses a generous principal suite with a walk in dressing room and ensuite bathroom, and an additional double bedroom to the front. Externally the property has gated off street forecourt parking for 3 cars and a large west facing rear garden including a raised terrace, extending to just over 95 feet.

Square Footage: 3400 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Description

A simply luxurious two bedroom apartment situated within this iconic, Grade II listed development, Star & Garter House.

This Grade II listed building, originally designed by Sir Edwin Cooper, occupies a privileged position next to Richmond Park Gate. The building dates back to 1924 and was sympathetically converted by award winning developers, London Square. The development has tremendous facilities including a fully equipped leisure suite containing the pool and jacuzzi, gym and sun room, with views of the gardens as a glorious backdrop, a private in-house cinema which residents can book to watch their choice of movie or sporting event with friends, 24 hour Harrods concierge and underground parking. Residents also benefit from a 'town car' chauffeur service into Richmond town centre.

The South Terrace is the centrepiece, with its cherub-ringed fountain and star motif in the paving. A central pathway leads to an area where residents can sit, stroll, or get together and enjoy filtered views through the woodland across Petersham Meadows and the River Thames.

Entering this third floor apartment you are welcomed by a spacious entrance hall with a fabulous triple aspect reception room with dining area and a stylish kitchen/breakfast room with high specification Miele appliances. The principal bedroom benefits from a full range of fitted wardrobes and marbled en-suite bathroom complete with double vanity sink. A large second bedroom with en-suite shower is also on offer as well as a guest cloakroom. Additionally the property benefits from an allocated underground parking space.

Situated adjacent to Richmond Park, (considered by many as the 'jewel in the crown' of London Parks!) spanning over 2,500 acres and overlooking the Thames, The Star & Garter offers residents a truly special place to call home. Historic Richmond is a hub for shopping and socialising, and contains a great number of chain stores, bars and restaurants, in addition to many treasured independents tucked away in its pretty Georgian lanes. Add to this excellent transport links (30% of locals don't own a car), a thriving sports and cultural scene served by two theatres, galleries, cinemas and numerous local societies and sports clubs, and you truly have a riverside town for all seasons.

Viewings strictly by appointment via Property Partnership, Richmond.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning apartment comprises the entire first floor of a beautiful detached Victorian villa including a share of freehold, two off-street parking spaces and a landscaped communal garden to the rear. It features a light, open-plan living space with double fronted bay windows, French doors leading to a balcony (not demised) and solid oak flooring throughout. There are two double bedrooms both have ensuite bathrooms, a separate WC and bespoke handmade built in storage, wardrobes and bookshelves throughout. This unique property was refurbished to a high quality contemporary finish and includes a 4K home cinema system.

Superbly situated a moment from the 2,500 acre Richmond Park and Richmond Hill village with Richmond Station and town centre close by.

Richmond Hill is a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, with the world famous Richmond Park on its doorstep. Featuring a variety of homes from large period properties to an eclectic mix of conversion and purpose-built apartments, the village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few.

You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.
Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

A stunning two bedroom Victorian cottage located in a quiet, pretty and secluded cul-de-sac location. There is also a landscaped garden and a large loft room which is carpeted and offers great storage and has flexible usage. The living space comprises front door to the double reception room with two original fireplaces, a beautiful refitted kitchen with side door to the garden. Open stairs lead up to the the first floor. There is a large master bedroom with built in wardrobes and loft access, a further double bedroom also offering built in wardrobes, modern refitted shower room with customised laundry area/storage. The loft access is designed with a larger loft hatch and pull down ladder for easy access up to a large carpeted loft room/area which has plentiful storage and a 'velux' skylight. There is a front garden area and a side passage leading to the front door and the rear garden which has Yorkstone paving and trellis fencing. detailedDescription:
This exceptional detached property has been beautifully refurbished with Art Deco influences and offers flexible family accommodation arranged over two floors and extending to 2836 sq.ft. (including Studio)

The reception hall is light and bright and leads onto spacious and adaptable ground floor accommodation including a large reception room with fireplace, study to the fore, additional family room and charming ensuite guest bedroom with views over the garden. At the rear, the kitchen/breakfast room has full height glazed doors and large glass atrium flooding the room with natural light. The hand-made Parapan kitchen has an extensive range of cabinets, a central island with a white stone worktop, five ring gas burner, electric oven, integrated fridge/freezer and two-zone wine fridge. Off the kitchen, a useful utility room provides space for washing machine and dryer and includes laundry sink, ample storage and adjacent cloakroom. The majority of the ground floor also benefits from underfloor heating with four zones. The first floor provides an impressive Master Suite with lovely views over the garden and a luxurious ensuite with double-sized shower and ornate mosaic tiling. There are three further double bedrooms to this floor, one served by an ensuite and there is also a family bathroom with a mood/colour lighting system.

To the rear of the property is a wide and secluded garden with a large lawn, paved patio and extensive mature planting and also benefits from a garden office. To the fore of the house is off street parking for two cars and a small garage.

Conveniently placed in a cul-de-sac between Twickenham and Teddington town centres with their popular restaurants, bars, shops and amenities. The nearest station is Strawberry Hill and some excellent schools, are nearby. By car the A316 is within a short drive in turn giving swift access to the M3, M25, Heathrow airport and city centre.

detailedDescription:
This very elegant 6 bedroom (plus study), Victorian semi-detached family home with 100ft garden is located on Castelnau, a short walk to Barnes Village.

On entering, you are welcomed by an entrance hall with tessellated flooring and high ceilings.

The classically proportioned double reception room features two fire places displaying intricate carvings and gesso floral scrolls and urns, one with a modern cast iron grate the other is copper.
The double reception room leads to the spacious westerly aspect conservatory with fully glazed roof, blinds and ceiling fan, the conservatory opens to the garden and the kitchen/breakfast room, which comprises integrated appliances, an aga, and additional space for informal dining also opens to the garden.

There is also a cloakroom and laundry room on the ground floor, with access to the garage and the cellar provides further storage.

To the upper floors there are six/seven bedrooms, the smallest of which is used as a study and a fully boarded loft providing capacious storage.

The fabulous and well cared for westerly aspect 100 ft garden, provides wonderful outside entertaining space, laid to lawn with mature borders, fruit trees and seating areas.

To the front of the house off street parking allows for 2 to 3 cars, with access to the garage.

Barnes is a wonderful family area and is most famous for the Village atmosphere and open spaces, The Wetland Wildlife Nature Reserve, cafes, restaurants and Olympic Cinema are all within walking distance of this property.

The excellent schools in the area include and are not limited to, The Harrodian, St Paul's, The Swedish School, and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's, Lowther and Barnes Primary.

Transport links include two Southern Region overland train stations, Barnes and Barnes Bridge.

Over the River Thames, Hammersmith provides an additional comprehensive range of shopping facilities and access to the District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City and Circle line tube stations.
Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities from football, athletics to beach volley ball and the River Thames is also within walking distance.
Freehold.

detailedDescription:
An end of terrace house over 3 floors in an idylic enclave in historic petersham.

Forge Lane is a bijou development of just 5 houses on the site of the former Old Forge. Although early 21st century, with all attendant modern advantages including underfloor heating, the exterior blends seamlessly into its historic surroundings with traditional header and stretcher stock brick topped by an elegant Dutch gable. The courtyard off street parking is entered via a scenic archway and to the right is the listed 18th Century Village Lock Up and Watchman's Hut. Forge Lane won the Daily Mail 4 Star Award for Best Development in Surrey in 2006.

Bright open plan style entrance floor with reception hall, dining and kitchen areas and a lounge area with fireplace and French doors out to a lovely secluded rear garden, walled to the rear and flank, and benefitting from a useful side access gate.

The lower ground has a generous double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobes, a rear office/guest facility, main bathroom and double doors to both a storage cupboard and a utility cupboard.

The top floor has a charming double bedroom with inbuilt wardrobe cupboard and ensuite with both bath and walk in shower.

The house is approached through the gated front garden leading to the covered front door and into the entrance hall.

The hall leads to a spacious living room, the study, a cloakroon and cloaks cupboards.

There is an inner lobby leading to a further living room, the utility room and on into the extended family room and fully fitted kitchen with air-conditioning. The family room futher benefits from bifolding doors leading to the garden.

On the first floor there is a principal bedroom with en-suite bathroom and dressing room, a guest bedroom with ensuite bathroom, two further bedooms and a family bathroom.

To the rear you have the secluded garden with lawn, terrace and herbacious boarders and to the side you have off street parking and a garage.

Location:
Situated in the quiet Waterside area of Barnes, close the River Thames and access to Central London and Heathrow via the A4 and M4.

Barnes is famous for its Village atmosphere, restaurants, cafes, pond, opens spaces, Wetland Wildlife Nature Reserve.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is St Paul's Junior School, St Osmund's, Lowther School and Barnes Primary School.

There are two Southern Region overland train stations in the area, Barnes and Barnes Bridge.

Over the River Thames, Hammersmith provides an additional comprehensive range of shopping facilities and access to the District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City and Circle line tube stations.

For the sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated close by, The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

For those who enjoy rowing, there is a club at Dukes Meadow and for the walker and the garden enthusiast the open spaces of Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are within easy reach.

Onslow Avenue Mansions is well located for the amenities on Richmond Hill, with Richmond Park, Terrace Gardens, Richmond Riverside and Richmond town centre all being close by. Richmond train station offers access to and from London by tube or rail via the District line, South West trains and the London Overground service.

Richmond Hill has a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, balancing city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links with Richmond Station offering direct routes to London Waterloo and Victoria and the City (District Line). An ideal location for families, Richmond has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend. Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

address: Lion Gate Gardens, Richmond, Surrey TW9
detailedDescription:
A magnificently proportioned detached family home with a delightful south facing garden

Location

The house is enviably positioned within this highly regarded road, just a few hundred meters from both the sophisticated shops and restaurants of Richmond town centre and the charming village that is Kew Gardens. Whilst even closer at hand (The Lion Gate is within approximately 100 metres of the house) the world renowned Royal Botanical Gardens of Kew are breathtaking and provide an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life. The Village has a lovely atmosphere with a good selection of independent shops and cafes, as well as a monthly farmers market and the Michelin starred 'Glasshouse' restaurant. Richmond also boasts a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames, a much acclaimed Theatre, three cinemas and of course Royal Richmond Park, with its 2300 acres of deer inhabited woodland.

Richmond train station provides a rapid overland service into London Waterloo (in under 20 minutes) as well as the District Line tube and overland to Stratford.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

This architecturally striking detached Victorian home is beautifully proportioned and practically configured over three floors. There is a wonderful flow to the accommodation with the generous ceiling heights and excellent flow of natural light further emphasising the gracious room proportions. The house has great period integrity with a number of notable features, including some lovely fireplaces, large sash hung windows and ceiling cornices. Also of particular note is the fabulous Mark Wilkinson kitchen.

Whilst our clients have lovingly nurtured the house over many years there is excellent scope for any incoming purchasers to stamp their own identity and extend underneath if so required, subject to the usual local authority planning consent and building regulation requirements.

To the rear of house there is a delightful south facing garden, that is predominantly laid to lawn with established boarders and a large patio for alfresco dining. Whilst to the front there is secure off street parking.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful opportunity to purchase this first floor, riverside apartment in the popular Riverview Gardens with great views over the river Thames. The property would benefit from modernisation and improvements (subject to the necessary permissions). Currently configured with tow balconies, four bedrooms, a shower room, reception room and a spacious kitchen / dining room, both with river views.

Riverview Gardens is one of the finest mansion blocks in Barnes and has a resident porter and beautifully kept communal gardens. It is located just off Castelnau, offering a balance of village-style living and boasts a parade of amenities and independent eateries, whilst nearby Barnes Village is home to the well-known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. The Village offers an array of boutiques, cafés and High Street favourites.

There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

Hammersmith Station is the closest transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

The property is in Conservation area CA25 Castelnau.

Presented to a very good standard having been meticulously cared for by the current owners for approximately 35 years, benefiting from spacious room proportions and pleasant open aspects along the avenue and over adjoining conservation grounds and tennis club. Outside there is a wide parking forecourt, integral garage and side pedestrian access leading to the garden. Located within easy reach of Kew Gardens underground station and the local village shopping amenities.

A 3 double bedroom home, with a driveway, private garden, and secret communal garden! The beautiful and modern kitchen dining room overlooking the private garden is for sure the heart of the home. The bedrooms, kitchen and living room all have full-width windows which are a great feature.

On the ground floor, the current owner has remodelled the home, brought the kitchen down from the first floor and created an open plan kitchen diner, with room for a sofa. This is my favourite part of the home with 2 ovens, an induction hob, an integrated dishwasher and integrated freezer along with floor-to-ceiling sliding doors overlooking the mature garden. There is a downstairs WC as well as a utility room with a sink and room for a washing machine and tumble dryer.

The first floor has a really bright reception room with windows spanning the width of the home bringing in lots of natural light. The master bedroom is also on the first floor, overlooking the rear, and has an en-suite bathroom and walk-in closet.

Two further double bedrooms are found on the second floor, one with a private balcony, along with the family bathroom.

Located just a few minutes walk to local shops and under a mile walk to the high street, Teddington Train Station and Bushy Park.

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to buy a spectacular five bedroom semi-detached family house set back from the road with off street parking and wiring in place for an electric car charger.

Daniele Petteno is an international award winning architect and interior designer.

Having been totally refurbished and extended, this double fronted house should be viewed at your earliest opportunity, so as not to be disappointed.

The ground floor has a wide entrance hall, reception room, study, utility room, guest cloakroom, open planned kitchen and dining area, with full width glass wall across the back aspect, overlooking the rear landscaped garden.

The Warendorf kitchen benefits from an excellent range of units and cupboards incorporating striking stone work surfaces, fully integrated Miele appliances and a large central island/breakfast bar.

On the first floor is the principal bedroom with walk in wardrobe and ensuite bathroom . There are two further bedrooms and a family bathroom.

The second floor has two further bedrooms with air-conditioning, a shower room and ample storage areas.

The bedrooms on the first and second floor benefit from air conditioning units.

The rear garden offers decking a large lawn and a path leading to the spacious garden house.

Location:
Situated in one of the most sought after locations in Barnes, close the River Thames and access to Central London and Heathrow via the A4 and M4.

Barnes is famous for its Village atmosphere, restaurants, cafes, pond, opens spaces, Wetland Wildlife Nature Reserve.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's, Lowther and Barnes Primary.

There are two Southern Region overland train stations in the area, Barnes and Barnes Bridge.

Over the River Thames, Hammersmith provides an additional comprehensive range of shopping facilities and access to the District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City and Circle line tube stations.

For the sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated close by, The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

For those who enjoy rowing, there is a club at Dukes Meadow and for the walker and the garden enthusiast the open spaces of Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase this bright and spacious three bedroom end of terrace house within the prestigious Broom Park riverside development, which boasts exclusive use of stunning landscaped gardens, incorporating a Japanese water garden, which sweeps down to the banks of the River Thames.
As you enter there is an immediate feeling of space and light. The front lounge is exceptionally wide and opens through to a good size dining room, flooding the space with natural light through dual aspect windows to the fore and rear which overlook the beautiful garden. The good size kitchen can be accessed by both the lounge and the dining room and has sliding doors onto the sunny rear garden. The kitchen itself has an array of white cupboards, electric double oven, four ring induction hob, washing machine, dryer, fridge freezer and dishwasher.
The ground floor further benefits from a downstairs W.C. And under stairs storage.
The first floor provides three double bedrooms, all with fitted wardrobes and generous windows. The master to the fore has an en-suite bathroom with a white suite and shower over the bath. The two bedrooms to the rear are served by a family bathroom, complete with a shower over the bath, vanity sink and skylight.
Externally, the sliding doors are dressed with wisteria and lead to a beautiful secluded south-facing garden, tastefully paved with planted borders, a wonderful crockery surrounded pond, timber shed, that all important rear access and a raised patio adorned with a vine covered pergola, giving a perfect setting for al-fresco dining on a warm summer evening overlooking a quiet oasis.
Further benefits include a garage with an electric door.
The beautifully tended communal gardens stretch down to the River Thames, where there is a ramp to make getting kayaks, paddle-boards and boats in and out very easy for those who are keen to make the most of the river.

detailedDescription:
An impressive five bedroom architect designed family house in the heart of Barnes village.

Location

Westmoreland Road is one of the most sought after roads in the heart of Barnes Village which offers an eclectic mix of independent retailers, pubs and highly regarded restaurants, and the Olympic Cinema. Barnes Pond and the surrounding green adjoining Barnes Common is close by, along with The Wildfowl & Wetlands Trust's 100 acre Wetlands Centre. There are pleasant towpath walks along the River Thames.

For those who commute Barnes Bridge station and Barnes Station provide a frequent service into Waterloo. There is also a regular bus service to Hammersmith, giving access to the underground and bus networks.

The schools in the area include – St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils – St Paul's Juniors, St Osmunds' (rc) and Barnes Primary School.

Description

This superb semi-detached five bedroom house has been architect designed by Daniele Petteno, an international multi award winning architect and interior designer.

The house is set back from the road with a driveway with off street parking for two vehicles and an electric car battery charger.

The house opens into a deep, wide entrance hall creating a sense of light and space. The property has been recently refurbished throughout to a high standard creating a contemporary family home.

To the front is a generous bay fronted reception room with a marble fireplace, attractive herringbone parquet flooring which extends across living space, bespoke cabinetry and display shelving. Internal Crittall doors flow into a spectacular kitchen/dining/family room offering a wonderful multi-purpose open plan living space. Glass doors at the back and a cleverly designed ceiling window allow an abundance of natural light and extend the entertaining space further on to a large decked terrace overlooking a large private landscaped garden designed for both entertaining and family living. There is a contemporary garden studio/home office at the rear of the garden.

The Warendorf kitchen benefits from an excellent range of units and cupboards incorporating striking stone work surfaces, fully integrated Miele appliances and a large central island/breakfast bar. There is also a spacious study to the front of the house, as well as a utility room and downstairs cloakroom.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is the principal bedroom suite which benefits from a large square bay window, a dressing room and a luxurious en suite bathroom with an egg shaped bathtub and a separate glass rain shower. There are two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom on this floor. On the top floor, there are two additional bedrooms and a further bathroom.

The bedrooms on the first and second floor benefit from air conditioning units. There is also underfloor heating throughout the house.

Square Footage: 3197 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Property Ref: 9425

99Home are very pleased to be able to offer to the market this newly refurbished, rarely available, quiet purpose built 2-bed ground floor flat, located opposite the river with river views. The flat has been renovated to a high standard with traditional decor but with a modern on-trend twist. There is residents parking to the rear of the property and there is the possibility of purchasing a private garage separately. Outside is a secure storage area, great for bikes and general storage.

The flat is perfectly located close to Hampton Village and it's cafes, pubs and local shops as well as Hampton Train station being less than a 10 minute walk away. The flat also benefits from being on a bus route for quick access to Kingston and Hampton pool is within a short walk. Directly opposite the flat down by the river is a lovely seated area and is a great location to access the river for those who might have a paddle board or kayak or just fancy jumping in for a swim as some local residents do. Bushy park is also within close walking distance as well as the river walks.

The block itself is due full refurbishment in the next 2 years both outside and in communal areas, adding increased kerb appeal to an already very attractive flat.

The current owners have also extended the lease for a further 90 years with a period of 177 years remaining...

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

Viewings by appointment on Friday 9 July...The Property Partnership are delighted to offer this beautifully presented semi-detached house overlooking Barnes pond, offering flexible four/five bedroom accommodation, a spacious patio garden, garage and off-street-parking.

Accommodation to the ground floor comprises an entrance hall, eat-in kitchen and a spacious reception opening out onto a patio garden with plenty of space for entertaining. A luxurious master suite with adjoining shower room and dressing area is situated on the first floor, in addition to a double bedroom and study/nursery. Two further double bedrooms are located on the second floor, served by a family bathroom. The garage is accessed via the garden, with further off-street-parking available in front of the garage.

This stunning property would suit anyone looking for a 'turn-key' property in the very heart of Barnes village, with the extremely rare addition of off-street-parking. The house is just moments from the weekly farmers market, and restaurants and boutiques of Barnes High Street.

Barnes nestles within a loop in the Thames between Richmond and Putney, and is just a short hop over Hammersmith Bridge for those north-of-the-river types. Geographically contained by the river on three sides and by Barnes Common to the south, leafy Barnes retains a decidedly countrified air and is known for the strength of its schools including St. Paul's and the Harrodian. At
the heart of the village lies Barnes Pond and Green, and an attractive High Street lined with many independent restaurants, pubs and shops. The areas proximity to open spaces, including the Wetlands Centre and Richmond Park, make Barnes the ideal home for those wishing to combine swift access to London with the qualities of village life. Barnes maintains a cornucopia of local clubs and societies and has benefited from significant investment in recent years, not least the renovation of the old Olympic Studios on Church Road to create a fabulous cinema,
The Olympic.

detailedDescription:
Spacious, split level apartment offered with no chain. Extremely spacious split level first floor apartment located upon popular Whitton High Street. The town is well known within the area for it's successful high street, sense of community and transport links. The property is a moments walk from the bus stops and train station. The apartment has lounge, fitted kitchen, 3 bedrooms and bathroom w/c. Other benefits include communal roof terrace. EPC Grade D.

Situation
The property is situated close to Whitton town centre and is close to a wide range of shops for your convenience and Whitton Mainline Station which serves London Waterloo on the fast services in less than 30 minutes. Other benefits are local bus routes including the H22,281,110 and 481. Whitton also benefits from several parks and open spaces including Crane Park, Murray Park and Powder Mill Lane recreation park.

detailedDescription:
Arranged over three floors and presented to the market in excellent condition throughout, a four bedroom two bathroom family house with the added advantage of off street parking for two cars.

The property is situated within a short walk of Kew village and overlooking Kew gardens. It is situated in a small cul-de-sac, just off a cherry tree lined road and is ideal for local schools, restaurants, cafes, bars and the many amenities that Kew has to offer.

The ground floor comprises open plan living space to include a fully integrated kitchen/ dining room/ reception room with floor to ceiling glass doors opening on to an easy to maintain rear garden. The first floor offers two double bedrooms and a shower room, and the second floor also has two double bedrooms and a family bathroom with overhead shower.

These modern townhouses are rarely available and viewing is highly recommended. EPC = C

detailedDescription:
This well-presented, two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment, is situated on the ground-floor of this Victorian building at the Richmond Hill end of Kings Road. The property comprises; a large reception-room with feature fireplace, alcove storage and a bay window, two-bedrooms and two bathrooms including an ensuite shower room to the main bedroom and a modern fitted kitchen.

This property is located in the heart of Richmond Hill village, a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, with the world famous Richmond Park on its doorstep. The village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few.

You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.

Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

address: Lower Teddington Road, Hampton Wick, Surrey KT1
detailedDescription:
An enchanting two storey Victorian boathouse

Location

The Elms Boathouse forms part of this prime conservation area within just a few hundred metres of Hampton Wick mainline station, providing a direct train service into London Waterloo.

Hampton Wick also offers a quaint array of local shops for day to day requirements whilst just over Kingston Bridge (within approximately half a mile) the more extensive shopping amenities are available with many of the major retail outlets evident.

Local schools, both private and state, enjoy an excellent reputation, as do the many and varied local sport clubs, including the much acclaimed Lensbury.

The commuter is further served by access onto the A308 (within approximately three quarters of a mile) which in turn adjoins the A3, thereby providing access into central London and the City. The A316 is also within easy reach and adjoins the M3 at Sunbury or Central London in the other direction, via the A4. The M3 in turn adjoins the M25 Motorway, connecting Gatwick and Heathrow international airports.

Description

Perched on a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames The Elms Boathouse is an enchanting Victorian boathouse that is approached via a long gated driveway in between 32 and 34 Lower Teddington Road.

The property has been sympathetically and creatively extended by our clients to provide charming riverside accommodation over two levels with 1050 square feet of accommodation and 410 square feet of boathouse.

Square Footage: 1050 sq ft

agency_name: Chase Buchanan, Twickenham Sales and Lettings
detailedDescription:
This well presented town house with versatile living spaces over three levels is in the heart of Strawberry Hill.

With an internal space of over 1400 sq ft, the ground floor provides a modern kitchen with plenty of storage units and integrated appliances, dining room, living room and shower room. The garage has been split to create a guest room or further living room.

The first floor provides two double bedrooms, an office and a bright and spacious reception room and to the top floor a further three bedrooms and bathroom.

Outside is a secluded garden to the side and rear with a water feature and decked patio area plus off street parking and integral garage/storage to the front.

Strawberry Hill Road is ideally located to take advantage of all that Strawberry Hill and Twickenham has to offer, from the delightful Radnor Gardens on the river to the ambient restaurants and charming riverside pubs and walks. Situated within easy access of both Richmond and Kingston with comprehensive amenities. Commuter links are excellent with two stations providing good links to London Waterloo, frequent bus routes and easy access to the M3 and M25 motorways and Heathrow Airport. The local area is well served for schools, both private and state-run.

Properties of this size are rarely available and this one certainly comes highly recommended.

address: Avondale House, Mortlake High Street, London SW14
detailedDescription:
A very well presented three bedroom split level flat close to the river and Barnes Bridge station. Situated on the second and third floors of this small purpose built development this flat is light and spacious and has views of the river opposite.

The ground floor has a large living room with a lovely outlook over a small green and a contemporary fully fitted kitchen with space for dining and integrated appliances.
On the first floor are three bedrooms and a smart and spacious family bathroom. Two of the bedrooms are doubles and have built-in wardrobes and the rooms display a feeling of calm and light with views out over the surrounding roads.

There is further storage under the stairs and double glazing throughout the property. Plus there is the bonus of a separate secure and private storage shed in the grounds of the building.

The location is particularly sought after as it offers excellent transport links, a family-friendly/community feel and the River Thames towpath is situated immediately opposite. Barnes Bridge and Mortlake Stations are a short walk away, both providing fast access into London Waterloo, and bus routes on the doorstep go to Barnes and Richmond. Richmond Park is also within walking distance as are local shops and outstanding-rated primary schools.

address: Eastbank Road, Hampton Hill, Hampton TW12
detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented end of terrace house with three bedrooms, a wealth of character and charm and a southeast facing private rear garden. This location gives good access to sought-after local schools and green spaces with both the gates to Royal Bushy Park and Holly Road Rec close by. The amenities of Hampton Hill high street, local bus services, Fulwell railway station and Hampton open air swimming pool are all nearby.

An entrance hallway with two built-in understairs storage cupboards, and built-in shoe rack, leads to the front aspect sitting reception room. There is a multi-paned sash bay window and a character feature fireplace. The kitchen dining reception room has a range of modern fitted solid wood units with under unit lighting and solid oak worksurfaces. There is space for an oven, a fitted extractor fan, and space for a fridge freezer. Open plan access leads to the dining reception area with ample space for a dining table and chairs. Multi-paned internal doors lead to the family reception / home office / utility room. Light floods in through two double glazed Velux windows with integrated blinds and double-glazed windows and double-glazed French style doors to the garden. There is a built-in storage cupboard, tiled flooring, worksurfaces, space and plumbing for a washing machine, and space for a dishwasher and tumble dryer. The modern fitted gas central heating combination boiler is concealed, and wall mounted.

Stairs lead to the first-floor landing with access to part boarded loft space with light, via a pull-down ladder, and stripped wood doors lead to all rooms. The master bedroom is front aspect and has two multi-paned sash windows. The second double bedroom is rear aspect and there is a front aspect single third bedroom. The fully tiled family bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted white suite with a bath with a wall mounted shower attachment and shower screen. There is a pedestal wash hand basin, chrome heated towel rail and a frosted sash window. Additional features include high ceilings with cornicing, sash windows, wood flooring and gas central heating.

Outside there is a pebbled front garden with a dwarf wall and lighting. The southeast facing private patio rear garden has a tree and shrubs that sit on a raised bed, shed, tap and pedestrian rear access.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

This elegant Grade II Regency-style Castelnau house has a carriage drive, 110' garden and direct views over the Wetlands.

Sweeping stairs lead you up to the front door opening into the hall and the inter connecting reception rooms with two working fireplaces, built in shelving and shutters. There are 2 pairs of french doors onto the wrought iron balcony with stairs to the garden.

The lower ground floor offers a second entrance into a boot room/utility room beautifully fitted out with Plain English cabinetry. The boot room forms part of the original Coach House, the upper parts are demised to the adjacent Coach house. Steps lead down to the spacious Kitchen by Plain English with integrated Gaggenau appliances and the dining room to the rear of the property with a gas fire and french doors out to the terrace and garden beyond. There is also a downstairs cloakroom.

The first floor consists of two double bedrooms, and two bathrooms (one ensuite). On the top floor are three bedrooms, a family bathroom and a separate toilet.

The walled garden extends to 110' with mature shrubs and trees with an artificial lawn.

The current owners have refurbished the house to make a wonderful home suitable for family life and entertaining. As part of the works they moved the staircase into the garden to one side to allow for the ground floor to be extended. Planning permission was granted but never implemented.

address: Hall Barn, Hall Farm Drive, Methwold, Thetford, Norfolk IP26
detailedDescription:
For sale by auction on Wednesday, 28 Jul 2021 at 11:00

Venue: Livestream Auction

Substantial Grade II Listed Barn Conversion
Accommodation extending to around 3,439 sq/ft

Hall Barn is approached along a 300m shared private shingled driveway, positioned in a rural position overlooking farmland within the popular village of Methwold. The property is a Grade II listed barn, part of a complex of three barns, The current owners have undertaken the conversion, which was sympathetically altered, whilst retaining much of the original structure and period features where possible.

The internal space has been well designed and presented to a high standard, incorporating both traditional barn qualities and modern day living.

A real feature of the home is the large family room featuring elegant high vaulted ceilings with beautiful wooden beams, along with a stone surround fireplace and full height windows, allowing an abundance of natural light to flood the room, exposing beautiful field views.

The property enjoys modern qualities, such as underfloor heating, Cat 5 data network, CCTV and security system. Broadband and cable TV connected.

Ground Floor
Utility and wc, large modern open plan kitchen / dining / breakfast area, study, large sitting / family room

First Floor
Landing, four bedrooms two of which are en-suite, bathroom

Outside
The front garden is laid to lawn with post and rail fencing and a large shingled driveway providing ample off-road parking. The rear garden is laid to lawn with a large paved patio, mature trees define the plot, which is enclosed by post and rail fencing, along with a brick wall. Plot size around a third of an acre (stms)

Methwold is a rural village on the edge of the Norfolk Fens and Thetford Forest located around 15 miles north west of Thetford. It has a post office, secondary and primary schooling and other amenities. The market town of Downham Market is around 12 miles away and offers a wide range of services and amenities including a main line railway station with a 90 minute service to London Kings Cross.

Viewings
Individual appointments can be arranged on Friday 9 and Tuesday 13 July - please call the Norwich office to book a slot on the next viewing day

EPC Rating: C

Additional Fees
Administration Charge - 0.3% inc VAT of the purchase price, subject to a minimum of £1140 inc VAT, payable on exchange of contracts.

Please see the legal pack for any disbursements listed that may become payable by the purchaser on completion.

Price Information
* Guides are provided as an indication of each seller's minimum expectation. They are not necessarily figures which a property will sell for and may change at any time prior to the auction. Each property will be offered subject to a Reserve (a figure below which the Auctioneer cannot sell the property during the auction) which we expect will be set within the Guide Range or no more than 10% above a single figure Guide.

Additional Fees Information
Please be aware there may be additional fees payable on top of the final sale price. This includes and are not limited to administration charges and buyer's premium fees payable on exchange, and disbursements payable on completion. Please ensure you check the property information page for a list of any relevant additional fees as well as reading the legal pack for any disbursements.

An early appointment to view is highly recommended by the vendors' Sole agents Chase Buchanan.

address: High Street, Hampton Hill, Hampton TW12
detailedDescription:
A two-bedroom first floor apartment with a wonderful private garden and garden room, long lease with 106 years unexpired, and offered for sale with no chain. The property is located in the heart of Hampton Hill and only moments from the amenities of the high street. The gates of Royal Bushy Park, Fulwell railway station and local bus services are all close by.

An entrance hallway with space for cloaks storage leads to the L-shaped through reception room with space for separate sitting and dining reception areas. The sitting reception room is front aspect and open plan access leads to the kitchen with a range of modern fitted units. There is an integrated oven, hob, and extractor, space and plumbing for a washing machine, and space for fridge freezer and dishwasher. There is a dining / family reception area with a double-glazed skylight and an airing cupboard which houses the hot water cylinder. The master bedroom is a spacious double room, and the second bedroom is a good-sized single room with a double-glazed skylight. The fully tiled family bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted white suite with a bath with two overhead shower attachments and a shower screen. There is a wall mounted sink unit, side and rear aspect double glazed windows and a radiator. Additional features include character doors, wood flooring, double glazing, and electric heating.

Outside there is a wonderful private garden, with patio, lawned and raised decked areas, tree, and shrub borders, shed, tap and lighting. The garden room has double glazed French style doors, and a further double-glazed door.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented 57 ft. X 11 ft. Widebeam canal boat situated on a residential annually renewable mooring at Harts boatyard. The boat provides an open-plan kitchen/reception room with a breakfast bar and modern appliances. The bedroom has built-in cupboards and there is a modern shower room which was refitted in 2019. The vessel benefits from a central heating system, with the added advantage of a wood burner, this was all newly fitted in 2019. Harts Boatyard is set in a truly stunning location nestled between Kingston Upon Thames and Surbiton, and opposite Hampton Court Park. There is an abundance of lovely walks nearby and the views of Home Park are totally unspoilt. It benefits from direct rail access from Surbiton into London Waterloo in under 20 minutes. Surbiton offers a great selection of pubs and restaurants and Kingston town centre is just a 15 minute walk away alongside river Thames, or take a boat and moor up outside John Lewis for easy access to the shops. Harts boatyard itself has an on-site pub with stylish bar and restaurant that offers exclusive riverside dining.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented apartment with two double bedrooms, lovely communal gardens, residents off street parking and a garage. Hampton village with its railway station, amenities, and village green are all nearby. An external staircase leads to the second-floor private entrance.

The entrance hallway has space for cloaks storage leads to the stunning kitchen. There is a range of modern fitted units with solid wood worksurfaces. An extensive range of integrated appliances include Bosch oven, four ring gas hob and extractor fan, washing machine and fridge freezer. Additional features include beautiful parquet wood block flooring, double glazing and gas central heating.

Outside there are well maintained lawned communal gardens with tree, flower and shrub borders and trees on raised beds. detailedDescription:
A well presented Victorian house divided into four flats, located in a cul-de-sac off Castelnau.

Rental investment property with an outstanding % yield.

The property is within walking distance of the River Thames and excellent transport links.

The accommodation represents four ideal pied-à-terre.

While being sold as a whole, the property represents an excellent investment with a substantial income.

The property also has the potential to be returned to a house (subject to the necessary planning permissions), should that be prefered.

Location:
Situated on a quiet, leafy cul-de-sac in Barnes and conveniently close to riverside pathways for walking and cycling, as well as riverside pubs and restaurants.

There is easy access to Central London and Heathrow via the A4 and M4.

Barnes is famous for its Village atmosphere, restaurants, cafes, pond, opens spaces, Wetland Wildlife Nature Reserve.

Over the River Thames via Hammersmith Bridge when opened, provides an additional comprehensive range of shopping facilities, plus access to the Underground Station which provides the District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City and Circle line tube stations.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

There are two Southern Region overland train stations in the area, Barnes and Barnes Bridge. A regular and comprehensive bus service is a few minutes away.

For the sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated close by, The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

For those who enjoy rowing, there is a club at Dukes Meadow and for the walker and the garden enthusiast the open spaces of Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
A bright and airy two double bedroom Duplex apartment offering over 900sq.ft. With its own private entrance and garage within the highly regarded Harrowdene Gardens development opposite Royal Bushy Park.
The property is arranged over two floors with both front and rear aspect views overlooking the award winning gardens and courtyard.
The private entrance gives way to an entrance hall with a fantastic alcove space for storage. The spacious lounge opens into the open plan kitchen/diner and is flooded with light through dual aspect enormous windows. The kitchen itself hosts an array of white cupboards, four ring gas hob and electric fan oven.

The top floor hosts a full width master bedroom and a further good size double bedroom, both with fitted wardrobes and large windows with beautiful views over the gardens. The bedrooms are served by a family shower room, with a white suite and walk-in shower. A floor to ceiling storage cupboard can be found on the top floor landing.
Outside the beautifully maintained landscaped gardens and grounds are a delight and give a true sense of calm. The property also features a garage in a block, with up and over door and generous on street parking.

Harrowdene Gardens is a popular development close to Teddington High Street and an eight minute walk to Teddington station which offers direct access into London Waterloo. The Royal Bushy park is a stone's throw away and can be accessed via the Shaef Gate pedestrian entrance. Kingston town centre is within walking distance and offers many restaurants and shops, plus beautiful riverside walks along the Thames.

Realistically priced to allow for some updating and for an early sale. Early viewings are advised by the vendors sole agents.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A five bedroom modern townhouse with stunning river views

Location

Enviably positioned between picturesque Kew Green and a beautiful stretch of the River Thames, the house is within just a few hundred metres of Kew Village and the world renowned Royal Botanical Gardens. The Village has a charming atmosphere with a good selection of independent shops and cafes, a monthly market and the Michelin starred 'Glasshouse' restaurant.

Kew Gardens train station is located in the village and is on the District Line tube as well as the overland train to Stratford, via north London. A direct train service to London Waterloo runs from Kew Bridge Station, a few hundred metres away on the other side of Kew Bridge. The M4 motorway can also be accessed just over the bridge.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

Sitting pride of place within this exclusive gated development (of just a handful of properties that were built around 1980) the house is generously proportioned over three floors, providing well planned and practically configured accommodation of over 2300 square feet, that is ideal for both everyday family life and more formal entertaining. The exceptional river views can be enjoyed internally from all of the principal rooms, as well as externally from the two large balconies that come off the main (top floor) bedroom and the first floor living room. There is an excellent flow of natural natural light, afforded by the beautiful open aspects and the large windows.

Other features of particular note include a communal tennis court and gymnasium for the exclusive use of the residents, a resident caretaker and off street parking. As well as the private garden there are beautifully tended communal gardens, that are well established and mainly laid to lawn.

Square Footage: 2301 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This stunning Victorian period house, situated in the heart of Hampton Wick, is offered in excellent decorative order, having been thoughtfully renovated throughout.

There is a spacious double reception room, featuring a beautiful living area with marble fireplace and raised bay window, and a large formal dining area to the rear. This bright and airy room opens into a stunning kitchen/breakfast room with a shaker-style kitchen featuring a large breakfast bar, integrated appliances, plentiful storage and underfloor heating. A glass roof floods light into this excellent, flexible entertaining space.

Upstairs there is a large master bedroom with fully fitted wardrobes and two large windows providing plenty of natural light. There are a further two double bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is also a large loft space which is ideal for converting into a fourth bedroom and bathroom, subject to planning permission.

To the back of the property is a beautiful landscaped, private, walled garden which has the added benefit of rear access and an outbuilding with power. The property also qualifies for resident and visitor parking.

The High Street in Hampton Wick is the perfect spot with excellent railway links directly accessing London Waterloo and plentiful local amenities. Kingston Bridge and town centre are easily accessible along with The River Thames, Bushy Park and Home Park for beautiful parkland and riverside walks.

detailedDescription:
This spectacular five bedroom property is arranged over four floors and has been finished to an exacting standard throughout. The modern and contemporary accommodation provides a mix of formal entertaining space and open plan family rooms, perfect for entertaining friends and family.

The house opens into an impressive entrance hall. To the front is an elegant drawing room with attractive oak herringbone flooring with underfloor heating and a Gel fireplace. To the rear is a wonderful kitchen/dining room offering a superb multi-purpose living space. The bespoke kitchen has beautifully fitted oak units with Carrera marble worktops, a porcelain tiled floor incorporating underfloor heating, fully integrated appliances and a large central island and air conditioning. Full height glass sliding doors open onto a south facing patio overlooking a beautifully landscaped private rear garden.

The lower ground floor provides a spectacular area, with high ceilings, wood floors and underfloor heating. This area is currently set up as a large games and media room, study or 5th bedroom with en suite shower room. To complete this floor there is also a fully fitted utility room and plant room.

Upstairs, on the first floor there is a luxurious principal bedroom suite with full height windows and a walk-in dressing room with en suite bathroom. The principal bedroom also benefits from air conditioning. An additional bedroom is located to the front and also features a walk-in wardrobe and an en suite shower room.

On the top floor there are a two further large bedrooms and a beautiful bathroom.

Queen's Ride is part of an exclusive collection of houses situated opposite Barnes Common and close to Putney Common. Barnes Village, East Sheen, Putney and Richmond are nearby providing an eclectic mix of shops and restaurants.

Barnes station is nearby and offers a regular service into London Waterloo. There are also good bus services to Putney and Richmond, which offer underground connections, as well as to Barnes and East Sheen. Heathrow airport is easily accessible.

The schools in the area include: St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils, St Paul's Juniors, St Osmunds' (rc) and Barnes Primary School.

detailedDescription:
Offered to the market is this four double bedroom, semi-detached Victorian villa full of immense charm and character, with a sunny south-facing garden.

This property benefits from a through reception/dining room with original wood flooring, high ceilings, plantation shutters, original sash windows and an electric fireplace. The kitchen to the rear is full of natural light and has been tastefully renovated, offering integrated Siemens appliances, a pantry cupboard, space for a dining table, underfloor heating and bi-folding doors leading out to the rear garden. Downstairs there is also a W.C under the stairs with useful space for a washing machine and dryer.

To the first floor, there are three bright and spacious double bedrooms, two of which have built in wardrobe space, a useful study
ursery and a family bathroom. The recently converted loft on the second floor features a beautifully designed master suite, with plenty of storage space, sash windows, Velux window and an en-suite bathroom with low-lighting.

Externally, the south-facing garden is landscaped with a terracotta patio area and artificial grass. The property has side access and there is potential to extend out on the side return (STPP).

address: Park Road, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT1
detailedDescription:
A charming Georgian house dating back to 1800 directly opposite Bushy Park

Location

The property is enviably located and is within just a few hundred meters of both Bushy Park and the charming shops and village atmosphere of Hampton Wick, where there is also a mainline train station - with a direct service into London Waterloo. Whilst marginally further afield and just the other side of Kingston Bridge one can find the comprehensive network of social, recreational and shopping facilities that Kingston has to offer, including a great selection of riverside restaurants and a John Lewis department store.

Local schools, both private and state, enjoy a truly excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

The 1,100 acres of wonderful deer inhabited spaces of nearby Bushy Park (and the grounds of the world renowned Hampton Court Palace) an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life.

Description

A Georgian family home built between 1832 to 1837 in a delightful, sheltered position only moments from Bushy Park. The property was originally part of Park House which served as a school until 1870 and then divided in 1923. This property is a combination of the original Park House, the coach house and stable block and was transformed in 1999 by the current owners into a single family dwelling.

The accommodation is arranged over two floors only and extends to 4313 square feet. The ground floor has high ceilings throughout and is dominated by a breath taking 40' kitchen/conservatory which opens onto the rear garden. There are two original reception rooms, the larger formerly used as a refectory and school room, both benefit from exceptionally tall windows. Crossing over into the stable side of the building there is a further entrance and staircase, spacious bathroom, utility room and integral double garage which still retains the original herringbone flooring and wood panelling from the days it was used as stables.

The staircase for the main house up to the first floor is dominated by a double height tower giving light, volume and access to a family bathroom and four bedrooms, two of which are double. Accessed via a separate staircase, there are three further bedrooms, a bathroom and a galley kitchen.

The house is well screened by a wide front garden and has delightful mature rear garden of appropriate proportions to the house. In addition to the double garage there is further off street parking for several cars.
features: ['Georgian Family House', '4313 Square Feet On Two Floors Only', 'Garage And Off Street Parking', 'Mature Gardens Both Front and Rear', 'Excellent access to Bushy Park and Kingston Town Centre']
title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A superbly located and beautifully renovated family home

Location

Ellerker Gardens is located within easy access to both Richmond Park and Richmond town centre, which offers a wide selection of shops, the renowned Richmond Theatre, two cinemas and a selection of restaurants and bars.

Fast access to the City and West End can be achieved from Richmond mail line (London Waterloo) and underground station, located within just a few hundred metres of the house.

The major road networks nearby include the A316/M3 allowing access to Central London or out to the South West of England, the A4/M4 approximately 5kms (3 miles) from the house providing easy access to London Heathrow Airport and the West Country but also into the West End and City.

The London Borough of Richmond-upon Thames has some of the finest state and independent schools in the country with the borough often featuring high in national league tables for the quality of education.

Description

A recently refurbished and extended bay fronted Victorian family house skillfully enhanced and modernised to a superb standard offering a clever combination of modern and original fittings. Arranged over three floors the house offers ideal family orientated accommodation, with high ceilings and generous room proportions throughout. The five double bedrooms are served by four beautifully appointed bathrooms, in addition to the top floor and ground floor cloakrooms.

The spacious entrance hall retains the original restored Victorian tiled flooring and the living areas, guest cloakroom and cellar are accessed from it. The bay fronted reception room has gracious proportions, authentic sourced period radiators, a bespoke marble fireplace and makes an excellent formal entertaining space. Across the rear is a stunning open plan Balthaup kitchen that was designed by the award winning Kitchen Architecture. This space includes a dining and family area with exposed brick feature walls, access to the utility room and a Crittall glass wall with doors into the south east facing landscaped rear garden. Just off the dining area there is also a gorgeous snug area, featuring a Chesneys solid fuel burner.

The first floor provides for the master bedroom suite with beautifully appointed Poliform wardrobes and luxurious shower room, a further, particularly spacious double bedroom and stylish family bathroom with steam shower, double basin with vanity unit and extensive storage. Across the top floor there are three further bedrooms, a family bathroom and ensuite wet room.

The rear patio garden was inspired by the renowned garden designer Luciano Giubbilei. It has been designed to allow for easy flow from the house and has been planted to give privacy whilst maximising size. The stone patio and grassed areas are screened by mature pleached trees. There is accessed, via a locked gate, to a discreet rear path which leads to Montague Road for added convenience. There was also planning permission for a fabulous garden pod room, which has recently lapsed but could be re submitted.

Square Footage: 2742 sq ft

Centrally situated Lichfield Court is ideally located for Richmond's array of shopping and leisure amenities including Richmond Park and the River Thames. Richmond train station offers access to and from London by tube or rail via the District line, South Western trains and the London Overground service.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Open house Saturday 10th July - by appointment only

This three bedroom townhouse comes to the market offering off street parking and no chain.

Recently refurbished, the house offers some exclusive features over three floors of accommodation and comprises of: Reception, kitchen, three double bedrooms (one with an ensuite) and a further family bathroom.

Beautifully modernised over the last 18 months. The property has been stripped back to brick and the steel frame. With the introduction of insulation and an efficient pressurised system, the house is quiet with an all round ambient temperature fed by the multi zone underfloor heating. Parador flooring runs through the property to achieve the clean lines to the glass balustrades. This brings light through the property with the introduction of a large three panel bifold door.

Within the kitchen, there’s a water softener that feeds the plumbing system and also direct mains to the kitchen island. The kitchen is fully equipped with Franke surface equipment and Neff appliances and even includes a wine cooler. The utility room houses the softener and automist system, with space for a washing machine and dryer.

The double bedroom on the first floor has an ensuite, with Grohe built in smart systems, which can also be found in the family bathroom on the second floor. Two further doubles on the second floor with the access ladder to the fully insulated and boarded loft, in the corridor.

A new block paving driveway and garage doors to the front and a new patio and paving via the bifold doors to the rear of the property.

The property is conveniently located for 'Garrick's Temple', the River Thames and Hurst Park, with Hampton Court Palace and Bushy Park being close by. There are transport links to Richmond, Kingston and Heathrow, or Hampton train station offering access to Waterloo Station.
