detailedDescription:
A wonderful four bedroom, end of terrace house at the village end of this popular road in Barnes. This wonderful period property is well presented and offers potential to extend into the loft and side return (subject to planning permission). Currently configured with a bright double reception room, extended kitchen, ground floor cloakroom, four double bedrooms and two bathrooms. There is a slightly larger than average, west facing garden.

Elm Grove Road is nestled behind Church Road which offers a wealth of amenities and independent retailers, as well as The Olympic Cinema, and leads to Barnes High Street and the Pond.

Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations are nearby for over ground rail services into central London and buses are available for access to underground links at Hammersmith via pedestrian access over Hammersmith Bridge. The open spaces of Barn Elms and Barnes Common are close by as well as the river Thames for several well trodden paths.

Schools in the area include St Osmund's Primary, The Harrodian, The Swedish School, St Paul's and, the outstanding (Ofsted), Barnes Primary School.

Offering delightful views of the River Thames from a private balcony, this elegantly presented and well-proportioned two bedroom flat benefits from a prime location moments from the heart of Richmond town centre.

The property has been beautifully refurbished throughout, comprising a bright and spacious reception room with bi-folding doors which lead onto private west facing balcony and an adjoining stylish fitted kitchen. Stairs lead down to a generous landing with built in storage which leads onto two double bedrooms, with fitted wardrobes and a modern family bathroom. The property benefits from an undergound allocated parking space. Additionally there are numerous visitors parking bays with the benefit of an additional permit.

The flat is prestigiously located on Richmond Hill adjacent to Terrace Gardens moments from the shops and riverside restaurants of Richmond town centre. Transport links include Richmond Station and the nearby A316.

detailedDescription:
An attractive period property forming part of an admired terrace, set in sought-after Orleans Road. This delightful lane leads to picturesque Marble Hill Park in the heart of Twickenham's peaceful Riverside conservation area. This is a particularly prized location within a few minutes’ walk of charming St Margarets village with excellent local pubs and some of the areas Ofsted rated outstanding schools. EPC=D.

An attractive period property forming part of an admired terrace, reportedly built for the Duke of Orleans' workmen circa 1840, set in sought-after Orleans Road.
This delightful lane leads to picturesque Marble Hill Park in the heart of Twickenham's peaceful Riverside conservation area. These exquisite cottages have unusually long front gardens which means they are set well back from this already quiet lane and also have lovely rear courtyard style gardens.
The ground floor accommodation comprises through reception room to the front with a pretty French window, complete with original exterior shutters and painted wood block flooring which extends through to the rest of the ground floor. The open-plan kitchen is a freestanding shaker style with range oven with doors leading to the charming courtyard garden with the added benefit of an outhouse suitable for utilities, additional storage or potentially a great workshop/office space.
On the first floor, the principal bedroom is to the rear of the cottage and offers built in wardrobes whilst two further bedrooms have vaulted ceilings with exposed timber beams and a family bathroom.
This is a particularly prized location as you are within a hundred yards of the park and river and within a few minutes’ walk of charming St Margarets village, excellent local pubs and some of the areas Ofsted rated outstanding schools including Orleans Primary and Orleans Park secondary schools.
Richmond and Twickenham are also within walking distance (about 1 mile) where there are a large selection of shops, restaurants and leisure facilities and mainline stations with fast and frequent services to London Waterloo and Richmond is also on the District line tube and Overground line serving North London.
EPC=D.<br /><br />
title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
*** property video attached ***

This stunning split-level maisonette located in a popular residential location is spread over the top two floors of this attractive 19th century building and offers over 1000 square feet of capacious living space incorporating plenty of Victorian charm. This is an ideal property to call home.

The first-floor accommodation comprises a large living room with sash windows that create an abundance of natural light throughout, a bright and airy double bedroom, contemporary family bathroom and a large kitchen/breakfast room that is well-equipped with an array of quality units and appliances.

To the second floor is a stunning, spacious master bedroom incorporating a Juliette balcony and useful eaves storage.

To the rear is a private 40' approx. Rear garden with patio area; plants & shrubs, an idyllic and secluded haven to unwind and enjoy al-fresco dining.

Heathfield South offers easy access to Twickenham stations 'fast' commuter service into Waterloo as well as being close to many excellent schools. There are areas of natural greenery close by and Twickenham town centre offers a wide range of shops, bars and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Summary

A stylish apartment, in Richmond upon Thames, with a glorious South-West facing sun-terrace.

This super second floor flat is situated in the highly desirable Courtlands Estate, in Richmond upon Thames and is offered with vacant possession. Reaching circa 850 sq.ft, with two large double bedrooms, a generously proportioned reception room and a 14ft kitchen, this stylish property is finished in a neutral palate and benefits from plenty of storage space and on-site residents parking. Both bedrooms feature built-in wardrobes, whilst the very modern, re-fitted kitchen boasts ample food preparation areas and new integrated appliances.

The reception room leads to the balcony where you'll certainly enjoy far-reaching leafy views across the playing fields below, far and wide. This covered balcony is the perfect place to enjoy the setting sun, early evening, a really nice spot to enjoy supper or a glass of wine, perhaps?

A share of the freehold is a great benefit, as is a lift service and the wonderfully manicured communal grounds the development is nestled in, are quite lovely.

The location of this apartment is well suited to the commuter or a buyer who enjoys the wonderful scenery Richmond Park brings, whilst the plethora of amenities, excellent transport links, shops, eateries and leisure facilities in the immediate area are all within close proximity.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
An outstanding new build four double bedroom family house located between Barnes and Putney.

Location

Queen's Ride is part of an exclusive collection of houses situated opposite Barnes Common and close to Putney Common. Barnes Village, East Sheen, Putney and Richmond are nearby providing an eclectic mix of shops and restaurants.

Barnes station is nearby and offers a regular service into London Waterloo. There are also good bus services to Putney and Richmond, which offer underground connections, as well as to Barnes and East Sheen. Heathrow airport is easily accessible.

The schools in the area include: St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils, St Paul's Juniors, St Osmunds' (rc) and Barnes Primary School.

Description

This spectacular four bedroom property has been finished to an exacting standard and offers over 3,400 sq ft of living space across four floors. The house is set back from the road behind electric gates with turntable parking.

The house opens into an impressive entrance hall. To the front is an elegant reception room with attractive oak herringbone flooring with underfloor heating and a contemporary Gel fireplace. To the rear is a wonderful kitchen/dining room offering a superb multi-purpose living space. The bespoke kitchen has beautifully fitted oak units with Carrera marble worktops, a porcelain tiled floor incorporating underfloor heating, fully integrated appliances and a large central island and air conditioning. Full height glass sliding doors open onto a south facing patio overlooking a beautifully landscaped private rear garden.

The lower ground floor offers good head height and flexible accommodation and comprises a generous space that allows for mixed use. There is a media room with French doors to a patio at the rear and an office to the front, which leads out onto a separate patio area and benefits from an en suite bathroom. There is also a fully fitted utility room and plant room.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is a luxurious principal bedroom suite with full height windows to pretty Juliette balconies. There is a walk-in dressing room and principal en suite with a free standing bath, a double walk in rainfall shower and Italian double vanity units with a glass top. The principal bedroom benefits from an air conditioning and heating system. An additional double bedroom is located to the front and also features a walk-in wardrobe and an en suite shower room.

On the top floor are a further two double bedrooms. The rear bedroom has French windows to a Juliette balcony and the front bedroom has two large picture windows overlooking Barnes Common. A contemporary family bathroom is also on this floor with a bath tub, separate glass shower and underfloor heating.

Square Footage: 3491 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This modern & substantial semi-detached family house is in a premier residential road very close to leh and Hampton Schools. It is impeccably well-presented and offers balanced accommodation throughout arranged over three floors and wonderful living space. The ground floor comprises of a very generous 17 by 15ft main reception room to the front with a square bay window, working gas fire with stylish surround and double doors onto the broad hallway entrance.

Rear of the property, you will find a bright spacious kitchen offering ample wall and base mounted cabinetry with Granite worktops and a central breakfast island. From the kitchen a galleried split-level staircase leads down to an open plan dining and family area with natural light from a unique sloping large glass room and French doors providing direct garden access to a patio courtyard laid with composite decking and boasts feature lighting. Steps lead from here up to the rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn and bordered by an array of trees and shrubs, and there is also a useful summer house. The rear garden can also be accessed around the side of the property. A guest cloakroom completes the ground floor accommodation.

On the first floor you will find three double bedrooms, one with an ensuite, and a family bathroom. An additional bedroom and ensuite shower room can be found on the second floor. Externally the property has a driveway to the front providing two off-street parking spaces.

Outstanding location conveniently located near Hampton Hill High Street and Bushy Park. Nearest station is Hampton which provides regular and direct trains into London Waterloo from 42 minutes. Access to the nearby A316 arterial road linking the area to M3 and also A4 providing a link to M4. Selection of bus routes operate nearby offering services to Richmond, Twickenham and Kingston. Heathrow airport is within easy reach by car. The London Borough of Richmond offers an excellent range of state and private schools.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

An extended four bedroom modern end of terrace townhouse, situated within a quiet cul-de-sac location just a short walk from Teddington High Street on a larger than average corner plot.

To the first floor is the main bedroom with en-suite, two further double bedrooms, single bedroom and family bathroom. There is a utility and garage on the lower ground floor.

Externally is a mature rear garden, side access and off-street parking to the front. No forward chain.

Situation
Birch Close is conveniently located within just a few hundred yards of Teddington High Street with its comprehensive and charming selection of shops, restaurants and bars. The mainline train station offers a regular and direct service into London Waterloo. A particularly scenic stretch of the river Thames is also within a few hundred yards. Local schools, both private and state, enjoy an excellent reputation.

detailedDescription:
A charming three bedroom Little Chelsea cottage.

Location

Thorne Street is very well located in the heart of sought after Little Chelsea, off White Hart Lane and close to the River Thames. Little Chelsea has an eclectic range of shops, restaurants and pubs as well as a Sainsbury's Local.

Barnes village, just a few minutes' walk away, also offers a large selection of pubs, shops and restaurants, as well as Barnes Green, the duck pond and the Olympic Cinema.

For the commuter, Barnes Bridge station is just a short walk away, and provides a fast and regular service to Waterloo.

The popular schools in the area include the Ofsted outstanding Barnes Primary School, as well as Thompson House and St Osmund's (rc), and independent schools including St Paul's, Ibstock Place and The Harrodian.

Description

This wonderful three bedroom cottage is set back from the road and opens into a generous open plan kitchen/dining room benefitting from good natural light due to its' southerly aspect.

The contemporary shaker style kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted cupboards and units with fully integrated appliances and stone work surfaces. There is a separate pantry/utility room conveniently located behind the kitchen. To the rear is an elegant sitting room with French doors to a private landscaped garden with raised flower beds.

Upstairs, on the first floor are two double bedrooms and a large family bathroom. The principal bedroom is located on the top floor, with a pretty Juliette balcony to the rear and accessible eaves storage to the front. A stylish shower room is found to the rear.

Square Footage: 1274 sq ft

The stylish integrated kitchen is fitted with Chrome duo Grohe taps and Miele appliances including a wine cooler. A double bedroom with beautiful en-suite shower room completes the ground floor.

Additionally the apartment benefits from an allocated underground parking space, private patio garden, underfloor heating, multi-room audio system and air conditioning.

Star & Garter House is a Grade II listed building originally designed by Sir Edwin Cooper. Set next to Richmond Park Gate the building dates back to 1924 and was sympathetically converted by award winning developers London Square. The development has tremendous facilities including an incredible fitness suite swimming pool communal gardens with views across Richmond Park 24 hour concierge and underground parking. Residents also benefit from a ‘town car’ service into Richmond town centre.

Situated adjacent to Richmond Park London’s largest park spanning over 2500 acres and overlooking the Thames The Star & Garter offers residents a truly special place to call home. Location

There are many excellent schools in the general vicinity including Sheen Mount Primary School, St Paul's, Tower House, Ibstock Place School, The German and Swedish Schools and Colet Court.

The area also boasts numerous leisure and sporting facilities including The Roehampton Club, Sheen Tennis and Squash Club and a host of golf courses, including The Royal Mid Surrey Golf Club and Richmond Golf Club. There is also a downstairs cloakroom and a utility/boot room with separate outside access.

On the first floor there are five bedrooms, two with en suite bathrooms and a family shower room.

To the second floor is a large double bedroom and bathroom, and access to extensive eaves storage.

The house also benefits from off-street parking for two/three cars and a secluded west-facing garden with a heated swimming pool.

Situation
Kings Road runs from the top of Richmond Hill down to Sheen Road close to Richmond's town centre. The immediate area is populated with other similarly large houses and the architectural styles vary from classical Victorian villas, large Edwardian houses and large detached residences from later periods.
Access to Richmond Park, with its 2500 acres
of deer-inhabited national nature reserve
parkland, is available just 0.6 mile away
via the pedestrian only ‘Cambrian Gate’ and the
main ‘Richmond Gate’ is a little further up
at the top of Queens Road. Central Richmond
is the same distance away in the opposite direction and the Royal Botanical Gardens at Kew are about one mile away via the most direct walking route to
Kew’s Lion Gate.
Schools in the area cater for all ages and there
is a mixture of very good state and independent
choices including Kings House (which is more or less adjacent), The Old Vicarage, The Vineyard School, Marshgate Primary School, Kew College and Sheen Mount Primary to name a few. International schools close by include The German School located in Petersham, The Swedish School
in Barnes and the International School London
(isl) in Ealing.

detailedDescription:
A superb five bedroom family house in the heart of Barnes village.

Location

Cleveland Gardens is in the heart of Barnes village, which offers an eclectic range of shops, art galleries, boutiques and award winning restaurants and bars. The well-known duck pond, green and common and River Thames towpath are within a few minutes' walk from this property.

Barnes Bridge and Barnes stations offering a frequent service into Waterloo. There are also good bus services serving Putney and Richmond, all of which offer underground connections. Heathrow airport is easily accessible.

The schools in the area include: St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils, St Paul's Juniors, St Osmunds' (rc) and Barnes Primary School.

Description

A superb five bedroom family house decorated in soft neutral tones offering well balanced living and entertaining space across three floors.

To the front is a generous bay fronted double reception room with an attractive fireplace and wood flooring. The rear reception space has built-in storage and shelving with steps down to a spacious kitchen/dining/family room. This wonderful multipurpose living space has been extended and is flooded with natural light. Bi-folding doors leading out to a paved terrace overlooking a mature, private landscaped garden with rear garden access.

The contemporary shaker style kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards with stone work surfaces, a large central island unit and fully integrated appliances. There is also a cloakroom and access down to the cellar on the ground floor offering excellent storage space.

Upstairs, on the first floor there are three double bedrooms all with well-designed fitted wardrobe space and a contemporary family bathroom. There is also a further bedroom/study.

The principal suite is found on the top floor with a stylish en suite shower room, excellent fitted cupboard space and useful eaves storage.

Square Footage: 2164 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A beautifully refurbished semi-detached family house in the heart of Barnes village.

Location

Nassau Road is situated in the heart of Barnes Village offering an eclectic range of shops, the Olympic cinema, excellent local restaurants and the pretty duck pond.

Barnes Bridge and Barnes stations provide a frequent service into Waterloo. There are also good bus services to Putney, Richmond and Hammersmith all of which offer underground connections. Heathrow airport is easily accessible.

Description

This substantial four double bedroom house is set back from the road behind a landscaped front garden with well stocked raised flower beds. The property has been recently refurbished throughout creating a stylish contemporary family home. The house is decorated in fresh neutral tones and offers well-balanced living and entertaining space split over three floors.

The property opens into a deep wide hallway with an internal Crittall style window and door creating a sense of light and space. To the front is a generous bay fronted reception room which benefits from good natural light. To the rear is a fantastic open plan kitchen/dining/living room offering a wonderful multi-purpose living space. Back doors open to a beautifully landscaped private garden with useful side access. The stunning contemporary kitchen offers an excellent range of units and cupboards with stone surfaces, integrated appliances and a large central island/breakfast bar. There is also a fully fitted utility room and downstairs cloakroom.

Upstairs, on the first floor to the front is the luxurious principal suite which includes a fully fitted dressing room and a spectacular en suite bathroom with a separate glass rain shower, twin basins and bath tub. To the rear is a guest suite with a stylish en suite shower room.

On the top floor there are two additional double bedrooms both benefitting from en suite shower rooms. There is also excellent accessible eaves storage.

The house benefits from air conditioning throughout.

detailedDescription:

Kew has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site.

Kew has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Kew village market is held monthly and, in summer, Kew Green hosts the Kew Village Fete and cricket.

Kew is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Kews' exceptional transport links with both overground and underground lines running from the centrally located Kew Gardens station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

A wonderful Victorian conversion apartment with two double bedrooms, a wealth of character and charm and offered for sale with no chain.

The property is located on the first floor of this stunning Victorian property and gives good access to local amenities and sought-after local schools. Green spaces, local bus services and Hampton village with its amenities and railway station are all close by.

There is space and pluming for a washing machine, space for an upright fridge freezer and space for a dishwasher. There are two bedrooms and both rooms are good sized double rooms. The bathroom and W.C have a modern fitted white suite with a bath with a wall mounted shower attachment, shower screen and two frosted sash windows.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

The Property Partnership are delighted to offer this truly impressive and classically proportioned four-bedroomed, two reception roomed apartment with direct access to a large peaceful, mature garden adjacent to Richmond Bridge.

Located on the west bank of the Thames at the foot of London's oldest river crossing, this endearing first-floor apartment offers classically proportioned naturally brightly lit rooms with elaborately detailed high ceilings and perfectly restored period features including, not one, but six beautifully maintained original fireplaces.

Accessed via a sunlight-filled grand entrance hall, the property provides 1620 sqft of lateral living space centred around a large dining hall, a stunning bay windowed reception room, three large double bedrooms with ensuite to the principal bedroom and a further single bedroom/study. The kitchen/ breakfast room overlooks the garden and views across the river to the site of the original Royal Palace through a pair of huge sash windows. Stairs lead down into the well-stocked and beautifully kept communal garden with a lockable bicycle store and direct access to the Thames riverside walk. Cambridge Gardens is accessible from the front of the building which includes tennis courts, a playground ground and a café- very popular with local families in the know and a great place to enjoy the riverside whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the livelier Richmond crowd.

Built in 1901 Balmoral Mansions is one of seven elaborate Edwardian buildings located on the boundary of the former and magnificent Cambridge House, creating high quality homes for discerning Edwardian families keen to enjoy the fresh air and greenery of what is still, London's greenest borough, now considered landmark buildings and the embodiment of the splendours and glamourous lifestyles of Richmond's Edwardian era. Enticed by the magnificence of Turner's Painting of the Thames from Richmond Hill, the west side of Richmond Bridge became home to some of Europe's leading families.

Nowadays, blessed with a wonderful sense of community, the area plays host to some excellent schools in both the private and state sector and offers incredible leisure and outdoor facilities. Just over the bridge, historic Richmond is a hub for shopping and socialising, and contains a great number of chain stores, bars and restaurants, in addition to many treasured independents tucked away in its pretty Georgian lanes. Add to this excellent transport links (30% of locals don't own a car), a thriving sports and cultural scene served by two theatres, galleries, cinemas and numerous local societies and sports clubs, and you truly have a riverside town for all seasons.

detailedDescription:
An impressive detached five bedroom family home within Barnes Waterside development.

Location

Barnes Waterside is a prestigious development in Barnes just south of Hammersmith bridge, bordered by the river. It is a quiet enclave of houses and apartments and provides a peaceful environment.

Devereux Lane is close to both St Paul's School for Boys and The Harrodian. It is within easy access of the M4, M3 and Heathrow Airport. Knightsbridge is just under 4 miles away.

Barnes Village is well known for its Farmer's Market on Saturdays and for a selection of individual specialist food shops. There is also an independent 2 screen cinema at the Olympic Studios and there is a variety of restaurants and pubs.

There are many green open spaces for running and cycling as well as the towpath along the river. Richmond Park is 3 miles away with its 2,500 acres of deer park, golf course and walking and cycle paths.

Description

This unique double fronted detached property was originally built by Berkeley Homes and has been extended in recent years. The property is set back behind electric gates and benefits from a garage with loft storage and a studio with separate access.

This superb five bedroom house opens into an impressive entrance hall creating a sense of light and space. To the front is a study/home office and a contemporary kitchen with an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards, stone work surfaces and fully integrated appliances. The rear of the ground floor comprises a double reception/family room with an attractive fireplace, a generous dining/reception space with bi-folding doors onto a large paved terrace overlooking a superb landscaped garden, perfect for outside living. There is also a fully fitted utility room and guest cloakroom.

Upstairs, on the first floor the principal bedroom features a dressing room, and a luxurious en suite shower room. There is guest suite with fitted wardrobes and a generous en suite bathroom. An additional bedroom is located to the front and there is a contemporary family bathroom with a bath tub and a separate glass shower on the first floor.

On the top floor are two additional double bedrooms alongside is a stylish shower room and excellent eaves storage.

Square Footage: 3590 sq ft

address: Richard Burbidge Mansions, Harrods Village, 1 Brasenose Drive, Barnes, London SW13
detailedDescription:
Outstanding 3 bedroom penthouse apartment in Harrods Village development.

Location

Richard Burbidge Mansions is part of the exclusive, gated Harrods Village development in Barnes.

For those who commute there are good bus services to Richmond and Putney as well as Barnes and Barnes Bridge stations which provide a good service into Waterloo. Hammersmith Underground is nearby and there are plans for a ferry crossing across the river, to be confirmed, while Hammersmith Bridge is closed. There is also easy access out of London and to Heathrow via the M4.

Barnes Village is nearby, with its pretty pond, eclectic mix of excellent independent retailers including butcher, fishmonger, greengrocer, cheese shop and wine merchant, and several wonderful pubs and highly regarded restaurants. Barnes also has the very popular Olympic Cinema, a Marks & Spencer Food Hall and the renowned weekly Barnes Farmers Market. There are also local shops and restaurants close to the apartment.

The picturesque Wildfowl & Wetlands Trust's 100 acre Wetlands Centre is within easy access of the apartment and there are very pleasant towpath walks along the River Thames. Across Barnes Bridge by foot leads to Chiswick Riverside Health & Racquets Club; Richmond Park and Kew Botanical Gardens are also nearby.

The schools in the area include St Paul's School, St Paul's Juniors, The Harrodian and the Swedish School.

Description

Richard Burbidge Mansions was one of the original Harrods Depository buildings and Is now part of the exclusive 'Harrods Village' development in Barnes. Apartments of this size and location are rarely available in this secure and exclusive development by the Thames. Therefore, we are delighted to offer this outstanding and particularly spacious fourth floor apartment, which provides views over the development towards Barnes and of the River Thames.

The communal door at front of Richard Burbidge Mansions is accessed from Brasenose Drive and is secured by an entry-phone system. The communal hall of the building leads to the lift and stairs to the fourth floor, where the property is located.

The main front door of the apartment opens to the entrance hall; to one side is a guest cloakroom with shower, and to the other are fitted cupboards.

The entrance hall leads to the superb dual-aspect reception room, which features high ceilings and provides ample living and dining space. Also off the main hall is a separate kitchen/dining room fitted with wall and base units incorporating a double sink unit, in-built oven and hob, dishwasher and fridge/freezer. There is a utility room off the kitchen, which is fitted with a sink unit and a washing machine.

A corridor from the hall leads to three double bedrooms, each of which has fitted wardrobes; two of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms.

Square Footage: 1849 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 999 years remaining

The communal entrance door and hallway are well presented with stairs and a lift to the upper floors.
As you enter the apartment into the large entrance hall there is an immediate feeling of space and light with two built-in floor to ceiling cupboards providing an abundance of storage, as well as fitted shelves.
Your eye line flows naturally through to the spacious living room, approached via double doors and is elegantly finished with ornate coving and uplighters. Flooded with natural light through dual aspect and French doors that lead onto a south-west facing balcony, perfect for unwinding on those warm summer evenings, overlooking a quiet oasis.
The generous kitchen has an array of cabinets and space for appliances and includes a Smeg induction hob and electric self-cleaning double oven.
The Master Bedroom is beautifully illuminated through a wide double glazed window overlooking the delightful communal gardens with fabulous floor to ceiling built-in wardrobes, cleverly designed with sliding doors giving plenty of space for a king size bed.
Serviced by a good size bathroom fitted with a modern white Laufen suite and Grohe fittings, comprising of a shower over a wide steel bath with a folding glass shower screen, Keuco mirrored cabinet and stainless steel dual-fuel towel rail.
The lovely and vast communal gardens surround the development with an array of mature trees. There is an allocated private parking space as well as visitors parking available.
Location: The River Thames and Hampton Wick Station are close by, as are the many open acres of Parkland nearby at Langdon Park, Home Park and Royal Bushy Park.

Rarely available modern townhouse enviably positioned within a unique development named 'Hester Terrace'.

This freehold terraced family home offers well proportioned accommodation beautifully balanced across 3 levels attractively and conveniently allowing for flexible living options to meet ones individual needs.

Private and rather alluring garden and off street parking for 2 cars.

No onward chain.

Kew has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site.

Kew has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Kew village market is held monthly and, in summer, Kew Green hosts the Kew Village Fete and cricket.

Kew is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector.

Another bonus is Kew's exceptional transport links with both over ground and underground lines running from the centrally located Kew Gardens station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

detailedDescription:
A bright and airy two bedroom, ground floor, garden flat on one of the most desirable roads in Teddington.
Enter via a private entrance into a spacious hallway with two large storage cupboards and wooden floor which flows all the way through to a fabulous living/dining room, which is beautifully illuminated through a large window overlooking an attractive garden to the fore.
The master and second bedrooms are equally bright, with the master bedroom boasting built in storage and views over the pretty, private rear garden. Both served by a modern bathroom with a large walk in monsoon shower and vanity sink.
The sleek kitchen is flooded with light through dual aspect and hosts an array of white high gloss cupboards, four ring gas hob, electric fan oven, fridge/freezer, integrated dishwasher and elegantly finished with white tiles, a breakfast bar and a door leading directly out to the West facing garden.
To the rear of the property the good size, sunny rear garden benefits from side access and a timber shed. Elegantly paved with mature borders, providing a perfect oasis for al fresco dining on those warm summer days.
There is also a garage to the rear which is accessed via a service road perfect for storage or parking.
The Grove is one of the most sought after roads in Teddington, with the beautiful central green space of Grove Gardens, complete with bowling green and cedar shingle clad pavilions.
This quiet cul-de-sac is located off Cambridge Road, just a short walk to Teddington High Street with its local bars, shops, restaurants and is 0.4 miles from Teddington mainline station.
Viewings are highly recommended by the vendors' sole agent, Chase Buchanan.

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
One of two brand new five bedroom semi-detached family homes located on Queens Ride, Barnes. This gorgeous family home has been finished to an exceptional standard and boasts over 3400sq ft of internal living space. On the ground floor there is a front reception room complete with oak herringbone flooring and a stylish gel fireplace. To the rear of the property is a contemporary bespoke kitchen with oak units, Carrera marble worktops and a range of integrated appliances along with sliding doors leading to a south facing rear garden. The lower ground floor offers a flexible space with access to a patio garden which could be utilised as a games room, gymnasium, cinema or perhaps even a play room. There is also a large double bedroom with en-suite bathroom and access to a private patio garden.

On the first floor there is an incredible principal bedroom with a walk-in dressing room, luxurious en-suite bathroom and a Juliette balcony. A second double bedroom also benefits from a walk-in wardrobe and modern en-suite shower room. The second floor hosts two further double bedrooms as well as a modern family bathroom. Additionally the property benefits from gated off-street parking for two cars, utility/plant room, underfloor heating, air conditioning and solar panels.

Queens Ride is located next to the beautiful open spaces of Barnes Common as well as being ideally positioned for the wonderful amenities on offer in Barnes Village. Residents can also enjoy Richmond Park, London’s largest park spanning over 2500 acres as well as a number of health clubs located in the vicinity. Transport links including Barnes Station (0.1 miles) and Barnes Bridge Station (0.7 miles). Barnes offers an enviable selection of schooling options including Paddock School, Barnes Primary School, The Harrodian, St Paul’s and The Swedish School

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

The Property Partnership are delighted to present this expansive, semi-detached period house with off-street-parking and a fabulous ninety foot west-facing garden, ideally located within this coveted cul-de-sac just the shortest of strolls from Barnes village and the shops and restaurants of Church Road.

Characterised by an abundance of natural light and superb lateral space, equally characterful and flexible accommodation is balanced over three floors. Approached via a pretty front garden with off-street-parking, the ground floor comprises a generous entrance hall, two spacious receptions, a third reception with WC suitable for use as occasional ground level accommodation, a kitchen and a large conservatory with doors leading out onto a wonderful rear garden. The fabulous garden is of particular note, exceeding ninety feet in length, with a mature borders and trees and an open westerly aspect. The first floor offers a bay-fronted double bedroom with built-in wardrobes, three further bedrooms, a study and a family bathroom. A near 400 square foot master bedroom with Juliette balcony is to be found on the second floor, in addition to a further bedroom, shower room and access to ample eaves storage.

Berkeley Road is a pretty street of large family houses, many of which have been in the same ownership for decades. 'Berkeley Bottom' is the favoured cul-de-sac end of the road, where this property is located. Opportunities of this type are rare in Barnes, which nestles within a loop in the Thames between Richmond and Putney.

Leafy Barnes retains a decidedly countrified air and is known for the strength of its schools including St. Paul's and the Harrodian. At the heart of the village lies Barnes Pond and Green, and an attractive High Street lined with many independent restaurants, pubs and shops. There is also a weekly farmers market. The areas proximity to open spaces, including the Wetlands Centre and Richmond Park, make Barnes and its near neighbour Mortlake the ideal home for those wishing to combine swift access to London with the qualities of village life. Barnes maintains a cornucopia of local clubs and societies and has benefitted from significant investment in recent years, not least the renovation of the old Olympic Studios on Church Road to create a fabulous cinema, The Olympic.

title: 7 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful period home has five bedrooms, a study or further bedroom and three bath/shower rooms; it has been superbly designed by award winning architects Granit, and finished to a remarkable standard.
It has a fabulous double reception room with solid oak flooring, a sealed wood burner, bespoke shelving and banquette seating in the defined dining area; this leads into a Roundhouse kitchen. The Miele hob & oven and Liebherr freezer & fridge are finished with counters and splashbacks in Caesarstone quartz with bespoke walnut drawers and cabinetry. The separate dedicated bar, sparkling water tap and additional Liebherr wine fridge are perfectly positioned for the garden.
The garden has been carefully remodelled, level with the kitchen it allows a perfect alignment of indoor/outdoor living and maximising natural light with Maxlight sliding doors. With two seating areas, a Renson louver that opens in sunshine and automatically closes with rain and a superb gas-mains fire pit, this stunning garden is completed ancient olive tree and barbeque area.
Upstairs the large master bedroom suite has a walk through dressing room with bespoke cabinetry, again by Roundhouse and a swish limestone bathroom with double shower and double sink. On the half landing is a dedicated study that could be used as a further bedroom. The second floor has a family bathroom and two bedrooms, one with amazing bespoke quadruple bunk beds, great for siblings and friends and on the third floor is another double bedroom with a bespoke built in study area and plenty of under eaves storage.
On the lower floor there is a further reception/media room, with remarkable ceiling heights of over 2.5 metres – great as a family snug or for entertaining, . There is also a further bedroom en-suite that is perfect for au pair accommodation or used as a guest suite and benefits from sliding glass doors onto a lightwell.
The house also benefits from underfloor heating to the ground and lower ground floor. And there are two sheds in front of the house which provide storage for 3 adult bikes and for two wheelie bins. Available chain free. EPC Current C/Potential C
The house is within a 5 minute walk of Richmond train and tube station with fast mainline links into London Waterloo (17 minutes) and underground links into London Victoria (26 minutes). The nearby town centre has an array of shops, boutiques and restaurants; Richmond Green and the river are also close by, whilst the wonderful Royal Park and Richmond Terrace are within a 20 minute walk. The local primary schools include, Kings House, The Old Vicarage, The Vineyard, Marshgate, Holy Trinity and St Elizabeth’s Roman Catholic School.

A wonderful three double bedroom house presented in excellent condition, measuring approx. 1369 sq ft and with the benefit of an attractive south facing garden. This property has been extended and renovated to a high standard with potential off street parking to the front.

On the ground floor there is a bright, double reception room which leads to a fully fitted, modern kitchen and dining area and further through doors onto the rear garden. There is a cloakroom under the stairs. On the first floor there are two good double bedrooms and a lovely bathroom whilst the top floor boasts a generous, dual aspect main bedroom with stylish en-suite shower room, Juliette balcony, good fitted wardrobe space and eaves storage.

Nearby Barnes Village is home to the well known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. The Village offers an array of boutiques, cafés and High Street favourites.

address: Portland Terrace, The Green, Richmond, Surrey TW9
detailedDescription:
A stunning, newly refurbished town house with wonderful views over Richmond Green.

Location

Portland Terrace is a modern terrace overlooking Richmond Green - once a jousting ground to Henry vii's former Tudor Palace and today a quintessential and picturesque village green that is home to more gentle pursuits, such as Sunday afternoon cricket. Richmond town centre is immediately to hand and has a sophisticated array of shops, boutiques and restaurants - whilst managing to retain a charming village atmosphere. A particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames can be found within just a few hundred yards, providing an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life. Richmond train station offers a rapid and direct service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Line Underground and Overground to Stratford, via North London.

Description

A stunning three floored modern town house centrally positioned within an architecturally interesting terrace of houses with direct views over Richmond Green, excellent outside space and a double garage.

Presented in superb condition throughout, with Lutron lighting system and partial air-conditioning, the house has undergone a thoughtful and comprehensive refurbishment to an exacting standard. With an option to access the house from front or rear via secure gates, the house offers a flexible ground floor with the onus on either bedroom or reception space depending on requirements. For added versatility there is a utility area and shower room too.

The first floor offers exceptional ceiling heights and a stunning modern kitchen with island, dining and sitting areas and a terrace and breath-taking views across Richmond Green. The top floor benefits from three double bedrooms including a vaulted master bedroom with stylish ensuite shower room and a well appointed family bathroom.

Other features of particular note include a Quooker boiling water tap, underfloor heating, cat 5 wiring, a Sonos system
and built in speakers in all rooms (speakers are also in the external patio area).

The south west facing walled front garden is private and secluded and links via bi-fold doors with huge expanse of the the ground floor room. To the rear there is a patio area and a well built garden room, ideal as a therapy or work from home space.

The double garage is accessed via private road from Portland Terrace, soon to be gated. Additionally there is further parking in front of the garages and, subject to availability, guest parking available.

Square Footage: 2285 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Rarely available two double bedroom ground floor purpose built maisonette occupying a spacious corner plot with magnificent private garden and separate detached garden studio.

The property internally is presented to a very high standard having been successfully upgraded and refurbished in recent times. Benefiting from a most attractive modern finish offering extremely well proportioned and bright accommodation whilst outside the garden measures approximately 50' x 47' with a south facing aspect, rear pedestrian access and a garage. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This very well presented three bedroom period house is arranged over two floors and extends to a total of approximately 1,521 sq ft. There is also the opportunity for someone to extend into the loft to create extra bedroom space which a number of the neighbouring houses have done, subject to the necessary permissions.

The property has many appealing features including high ceilings, feature fireplaces, sash windows and traditional cornicing.

On entering the house there is an attractive hallway which leads to a charming reception room that looks onto Halford Road, followed by a further reception room which has double doors leading to the garden.

To the rear of the house is a spacious fitted kitchen and dining area.

The kitchen provides direct access to the private garden which has exotic trees and catches the sun beautifully during summer. The back wall faces south west and is ideal for plant growing, with the current owners growing apples, potatoes, tomatoes, peas and herbs during 2021.

Further benefits include a downstairs cloakroom and access to a convenient cellar that provides space for storing wine or for general storage.
The first floor of the house provides a spacious and well-proportioned principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes and windows offering ample light. Two further bedrooms and a family bathroom complete this floor.

The Location
The property is in a quiet residential road and yet is very close to Richmond town centre. It is within a very short walk to Richmond's shops, cinemas and theatres. Richmond Green, Richmond Station, Richmond Park and The Thames Towpath are all close by as are other attractions including Ham House and Garden and Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew.

The house is in an area renowned for its exceptional schools. Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' schools include Deer Park School (0.36 mile), The Vineyard School (0.37 mile), Marshgate School (0.52 mile), Orleans Park School (0.94 mile), Grey Court School (1.52 miles) and Radnor House (1.88 miles).

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow airport is only 7.1 miles away and a direct bus (490) to the airport runs from the nearby bus station.
*All times and distances are approximate

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented ground floor Victorian conversion apartment, with two double bedrooms, and a wealth of character and charm. The property owns a share of the freehold and there is a long lease with over 110 years unexpired. Formally the village butchers’ shop, this charming home is steeped in history, and is located moments from the River Thames. Hampton open air swimming pool, local amenities, Hampton railway station and Hampton Village green are all close by.

A private ground floor entrance with a timber front door leads to the entrance hallway with space for cloaks storage and doors to all rooms. The spacious sitting reception room has a built-in storage cupboard and shelving into the alcove, and French style doors. A further door leads to the kitchen breakfast room with a range of modern fitted units with solid wood worksurfaces. An extensive range of integrated appliances include oven, four ring gas hob, extractor fan, fridge freezer, washing machine and dishwasher. There is a breakfast bar and space for a bar stool, and a concealed gas central heating combination boiler.

The spacious master bedroom has a large secondary glazed sash window. There is a good sized second double bedroom with two large double-glazed sash windows. The fully tiled family bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted white suite with a bath with a wall mounted shower attachment. There is a shower screen, vanity sink unit, chrome heated towel rail and a double-glazed frosted window. A large understairs storage cupboard has been turned into a study area with a fitted desk and space for storage. Additional features include modern décor throughout the home, double glazing, gas central heating and modern fitted carpets.

Outside there is space for refuge storage and a resident’s bicycle storage shed.

detailedDescription:
A unique five bedroom Victorian house ideally located in sought after Little Chelsea

Location

The house is located in the heart of sought-after Little Chelsea, off White Hart Lane and close to the River Thames.

Little Chelsea has an eclectic range of shops, restaurants and pubs as well as a Sainsbury's Local. Barnes village, just a few minutes' walk away, also boasts a large selection of pubs, shops and restaurants, as well as Barnes Green and duck pond and the Olympic Cinema.

Barnes Bridge station, within walking distance of the house, provides a regular service into London Waterloo. There is also a good bus services to Richmond and Putney. Hammersmith Underground is also nearby.

There are several excellent schools in the area include St Paul's, The Harrodian and the Swedish School in North Barnes. For younger pupils there is St Osmund's (rc) and Barnes Primary School which is which is very close to the property.

Description

This wonderful five bedroom family house has been beautifully refurbished and extended by the current owners and is arranged across three floors, offering well balanced living and entertaining space.

The ground floor offers a generous double reception room with a mounted contemporary fireplace within an exposed brick effect wall and large sash windows to the front. A glass door to the rear of the reception space leads to a recently re-done contemporary southerly facing patio garden with useful rear access.

To the rear is a contemporary galley kitchen with bespoke units, stone work surfaces and integrated appliances with direct access to the garden. Stairs lead down to a large lower ground floor with excellent head height and comprises two bedrooms with light wells allowing good natural light. There is also a stylish shower room.

Upstairs, on the first floor there is the principal bedroom with a dressing room, two further bedrooms and a generous family bathroom with twin basins and a bathtub with a shower unit. There is also a large unconverted loft space above.

The house also benefits from new windows throughout.

Square Footage: 1611 sq ft

address: Phelps House, St Margarets, Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
A stunning one bedroom apartment with access to a 22' wide private roof terrace enjoying spectacular Westerly views and sunsets. Offered for sale as an immediate rental investment (tenant-in-situ), or for personal occupation, this is the first time the property has been available since it was purchased from new in 2015. Presented in immaculate condition, the property has been further enhanced since it was purchased with the addition of Miele and Bosch appliances, a marble worktop and a separate drinking water tap. Other benefits include an allocated parking space in the covered garage, bike storage and a long lease. The vendor is happy to include many items of furniture and a selection of fittings, if required.

Phelps House is an exceptional development of thirteen luxury one and two bedroom apartments set within a beautifully restored landmark building providing the perfect balance of past and present in an historic setting. Of particular note is the communal foyer with its impressive Victorian carved wooden staircase.

The design brief placed a high emphasis on low running costs and each of the apartments have low energy LED lighting, an EcoDan air source heat pump system which delivers effective, low carbon heating and hot water from a clean, energy efficient source. Thermostatic radiator valves have been installed so they can be individually controlled and bathrooms have electric under floor heating. Additionally Whole House Ventilation Systems have also been installed to provide fresh air into the habitable rooms and extract air from the kitchens and bathrooms.

St. Margarets is a charming village with a mainline station to Waterloo and two shopping parades located along Crown Road and St. Margarets Road, where an extensive selection of cafés, boutiques, restaurants and pubs can be found. Phelps House is enviably situated in the heart of the village, moments from everything.

Richmond town centre is also close by (within half a mile) and provides an even greater selection of facilities, including; two theatres, three cinemas and an underground station.

Recreational facilities include rowing and boating on The Thames, walking, cycling and running in the numerous public parks, horse riding in Richmond and Bushy parks and golf on the many public and private courses. There is also a polo club in nearby Ham. Sports clubs are plentiful and include Cedars on Richmond Hill, a David Lloyd club in Hampton, a Virgin Active Classic Health Club within Twickenham Stadium and also the Lensbury Club.

There are several highly regarded state schools within the area, to include St Stephen’s Church of England Primary School, Waldegrave School for Girls, Orleans Primary and Orleans Park Secondary School.

Connections are superb, as being adjacent to the A316, easy access is provided to Central London as well as the M3, M4 and M25 with further connections to Heathrow Airport (8 miles), Gatwick and the West Country. There is a mainline station providing a railway service, via Richmond, to London Waterloo in approximately 30 minutes.

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This characterful two-bedroom apartment in Shelley Court forms part of the Grade ii-listed Parkleys Estate, built by renowned development architects Span in the 1950s. Parkleys was the first development by Span co-founders Eric Lyons and Geoff Townsend and is one of London’s finest residential modernist estates. It is set among beautiful communal gardens planted with flowering trees, and expansive stretches of lawn that are much loved by residents. The estate is located in leafy Ham, a pretty suburb with a lovely high street, which sits between Richmond Park and the River Thames in south London.

The Architect

Span are perhaps the most celebrated of all 20th-century British residential developers. Many of the developments that they worked on throughout the south of England are now listed, and they are renowned for their outstanding, yet simple, modern architectural style and their considered landscaping.

The Tour

This apartment is situated on the first floor of Shelley Court and enjoys views across the communal gardens, which are laden with white birch trees, shrubs and wildflowers. The current owner has thoughtfully preserved the Span-designed elements while introducing careful modern touches.

Inside, a neat hallway leads to dual-aspect living and kitchen spaces. A series of original Crittall windows overlook the gardens below and allow copious amounts of natural light into the living area. The kitchen adjoins the living space via an original glass divider and reeded door, both of which aid the flow of natural light in a design quite typical of Span developments. The mid-century kitchen has been incredibly well preserved and retains its original taps and fittings.

Two bedrooms and a bathroom lie off the hallway. Both bedrooms retain their original cabinetry, which provides plenty of storage space, and overlook the gardens below. The bathroom has been recently restored by the current owners and is lined with modern, dove-grey tiles and fitted with chrome sanitary ware, resulting in a calm, light-filled space.

The communal areas and landing are of particular note in this estate; they have been impeccably executed with decorative brick, glass and bespoke Span details that have been lovingly maintained. Each apartment has a private external store and there are communal drying and bike storage rooms.

The Area

Ham is a picturesque district in southwest London located between Richmond upon Thames and Kingston upon Thames. It unfurls around a large, open common and is renowned for the quality of its period architecture, the most notable example of which is Ham House, described by the National Trust as “the most complete survival of 17th-century fashion and power”. There is a parade of shops in Ham, including a monthly farmers’ market plus wider shopping and dining opportunities in Richmond and Kingston.

Richmond and Kingston both have fast train connections into central London.

Tenure: Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 960 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £2,400 per annum
Parking: There is unallocated residents parking in the estate
Council Tax Band: D

detailedDescription:
Sale agreed by Chase Buchanan….Fabulous semi-detached five bedroom Edwardian family home on a prime Road in Teddington.

An elegant bright double reception room boasts, a large sash box bay window, copious storage and a wood burner.

To the rear the kitchen/dining room provides ample space for family entertaining and is flooded with natural light leading to a well-designed modern conservatory with two Velux windows and doors leading onto the garden. Fitted with array of cupboards, fully integrated appliances and a Range cooker with five ring gas hob, as well as a large space for dining in front of the French doors giving stunning views of the marvelous sunny garden.

Adjacent to the kitchen is utility with a shower room with space for your washing machine, tumble dryer and side access.

The first floor hosts three double bedrooms, the majestic master bedroom to the fore spans the full width of the house and is elegantly illuminated through a double glazed, sash bay window, feature fireplace and fitted wardrobes.

This floor is served by a luxury tiled family bathroom with roll top stone bath, heated towel rail and large vanity sink.

The loft has been converted to create a further two double bedrooms, complete with a bright modern en-suite shower room with top to bottom stylish tiling.

The artistically landscaped, sunny private garden offers beautifully planted borders and wonderful blooms as well as a Laurel Bay Tree and an Apple tree. An attractive patio provides a fabulous 'entertaining terrace' which is perfect for al-fresco dining on those balmy summer evenings. To the rear of the garden an insulated timber studio with power and light provides opportunity for crafts and hobbies or a perfect place for all your gardening tools.

Claremont Road is situated off Waldegrave Road, located within close proximity to Teddington High Street, Station and catchments for excellent primary and secondary schools.

detailedDescription:
Description

The Property Partnership are delighted to offer this wonderful two bedroom apartment with lovely views, offering a share of freehold and a lush communal garden (our client have cultivated a small veggie patch which they would love to pass on!), located just moments from the river, local shops and within the catchment for the outstanding Orleans and Deer Park schools.

Situated on the third floor of this beautifully maintained mansion block, this characterful property is modern and bright, with a noticeable air of tranquillity and has been thoughtfully renovated and maintained by the current owners. The welcoming entrance hall leads into the lovely reception room with a centre piece feature fireplace, a newly fitted modern kitchen with integrated appliances and large principal bedroom. The second double bedroom features a floor to ceiling glass door onto a small balcony, providing the perfect guest room/ work form home space with lovely roof top views across to the Twickenham Film Studios and beyond. The bathroom is of particular note, beautifully designed, making clever use of every nook and cranny! Outside, the large communal garden is a well-stocked secluded space to enjoy warm afternoons. There is also a large bike store with ample space for all the residents.

Ravensbourne House is one of three 1930s blocks on Arlington Road in East Twickenham, originally built as luxurious Monday- Friday serviced apartments for the city gentry. Nowadays, these desirable sought after apartments provide exceptional space and character in this very special part of TW1, quietly tucked away within a prime residential enclave yet moments St. Margaret's mainline station and the independent shops and restaurants of St. Margaret's village. Richmond is just a short stroll along Ducks Walk and over the bridge, offering a wider range of amenities as well as access to the underground network.

From Richmond Bridge, St. Margaret's is just a short amble down the St. Margaret's Road. This most endearing village has a strong sense of community, and is served by a wonderful selection of independent shops and restaurants along Crown Road and around the mainline station. The river and glorious expanses of Marble Hill Park mark the easterly boundary, while on the other side of the A316 St. Margaret's stretches as far as Talbot Road. With Moormead Park (home to the annual St. Margaret's Fair), riverside walks into Richmond and its outstanding local schools and thriving independent amenities, 'St. Mags' really is every inch the urban village.

detailedDescription:
A very spacious split level, end of terrace period property, offering bay windows in the living room, two double bedrooms, high ceilings and direct access to a secluded garden, that has been modernised throughout with an impressive 1,114 sq ft of living space.

This beautiful home is split level and arranged over three floors with the main door entrance on the ground floor leading up to the bright living room with high ceilings, featuring custom built-in shelving and cabinets with white plantation shutters at the front side of the house, which then leads into a spacious and fully fitted separate eat-in kitchen. The second bedroom with built-in cupboards as well as a modern family bathroom is also situated on the first floor along with a stairwell leading directly out onto a cosy but lush secluded garden to the rear, which is a fantastic space for outdoor entertaining and al fresco dining. The kitchen has been finished to a high standard with integrated appliances and a fabulous range cooker with plenty of storage space. The family bathroom offers a bath with an overhead shower, along with a large utility cupboard housing the washer/dryer along with additional storage and shelving. The upper floor of the house consists of the main bedroom that has also been fitted with a range of built-in storage and has great views along with an en-suite bathroom featuring a walk-in shower. One of the major advantages of being situated at the end of the terrace is the garden has side gate access allowing ease of access for bikes, bins and garden waste via the secure communal gate.

The location of this property offers convenient transport links with Barnes Bridge Station and Mortlake Station both less than half a mile away along with plenty of convenient bus routes. The property is surrounded by a great selection of local amenities and various attractions including the beautiful Thames Riverside and Richmond Park which are both within easy reach along with the world-famous Kew Gardens all within the nearby vicinity and a variety of excellent local pubs and restaurants to enjoy.

This property is presented in immaculate turnkey condition with excellent features throughout and is situated in a vibrant and popular part of South West London with the added benefit of excellent schools nearby.

title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented end of terrace modern townhouse with three double bedrooms, lovely private rear garden and offered for sale with no chain. This location gives good access to sought-after local schools, amenities, Hatherop Park, Twickenham rugby club, bus services and the local nature reserve.

The entrance porch has two brick-built storage cupboards and leads to the entrance hallway with a cloakroom W.C. There is a double-glazed frosted window, vanity sink unit, radiator and limestone tiled floor. The spacious through sitting reception room has a built in understairs storage cupboard and a door leads to the stunning kitchen, dining reception room. The kitchen area has a range of modern fitted units with solid wood worksurfaces and a one and a half bowl ceramic sink unit. There is an integrated stainless-steel double oven, induction hob and a Franke extractor fan. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine, space for dishwasher and upright fridge freezer. The gas central heating combination boiler is modern fitted, and wall mounted, and there is a breakfast bar and space for bar stools. There is ample space for a dining table and chairs, a limestone tiled floor and double-glazed French style doors to the garden.

Stairs lead to the first-floor landing with a side aspect double-glazed window and doors to all rooms. There is a rear aspect double bedroom with a range of floor to ceiling built in wardrobes and double-glazed window with attractive views. There is a front aspect double bedroom with built-in understairs storage cupboard and double-glazed window with attractive views. The family shower room and W.C has a modern fitted shower cubicle with wall mounted and overhead shower attachments. There is a vanity sink unit, chrome heated towel rail, range of mirror fronted built-in storage cupboards, double-glazed frosted window and tiled flooring.

Stairs lead to the second-floor landing with double-glazed skylight and door to the third double bedroom. There is a front aspect double glazed window, built-in storage cupboard and built into the eave’s storage cupboard. Additional features include beautifully presented décor throughout the home, attractive outlook, and views from the first and second floors, double glazing and gas central heating.

Outside there is a paved front garden with flower and shrubs borders, space for bin storage and an outside tap. Pedestrian rear access leads to the lovely private rear garden with artificial lawned and patio areas, and flowers and shrub sit on raised beds. There is a bicycle shed, and outside power, light and a tap.

A substantial six bedroom semi-detached family home on a sought after road in St Margarets. Originally built by an Italian Architect for his own use, the home dates back to circa 1880 and boasts 3198sq ft of internal living space which is arranged over four floors. The ground floor offers a formal reception room with feature fireplace, a large dining room with beautiful wood panelling and a large conservatory offering direct access to a landscaped rear garden. The lower ground floor consists of a fully fitted kitchen/breakfast room with a Mark Wilkinson kitchen, an original dumbwaiter lift along with an additional reception room.

The principal bedroom complete with built-in wardrobes and en-suite bathroom can be found on the first floor along with two further double bedrooms and a modern shower room. On the second floor there are three further double bedrooms as well as a large modern bathroom with separate shower. Additionally the property benefits from a separate utility room, ample storage space throughout, a wealth of period features, off-street parking for multiple vehicles and a large garage.

Heathcote Road is a sought after road in St Margarets and is moments from the local amenities on offer in St Margarets Village. Nearby Richmond offers more extensive shopping options with a vast selection of bars, restaurants and shopping outlets. Transport links including St Margarets Station (0.2 miles), Twickenham Station (0.7 miles) and Richmond Station (0.8 miles). The area also benefits from some superb schooling options including Deer Park School, Orleans Primary School and Orleans Park School

detailedDescription:
Striking 3 bedroom/3 bathroom apartment located on the 5th floor of this lift serviced riverside building built by St George Plc in recent times.

Affording generous accommodation of spacious proportions (approx. 1200 sq.ft.) and appointed to an extremely high standard, the property features magnificent elevated views over beautifully tended residents' grounds and towards the River Thames. Benefiting also from private balconies to both front and rear, 2 off street parking spaces and concierge service. The property is also one of only two apartments within the development that has the advantage of an additional storage facility of approximately 180 sq.ft. Situated moments from the walkways and vistas along the River Thames tow path and within easy reach of Kew Gardens underground station and local shopping amenities.
title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A four double bedroom 1930s detached house extended double storey to the left rear and upgraded throughout with a mix of period features and high end contemporary improvements.

Traditional hall with panelled walls.
Two elegant reception rooms each with period style fireplaces.
Super extended double aspect kitchen/diner/family room with wood units and granite worktops, automated veluxes with uv filter and folding doors across the rear width.
Former garage converted into a study/home office with one way privacy glass.
Ground floor cloakroom. 2 impressive refurbished 1st floor tiled bathrooms, with both underfloor heating and radiators (one with rain shower).
Four genuine double bedrooms including a vaulted extended rear bedroom with ensuite bathroom.

Superior double glazing throughout with fitted uni-blinds, tilt and turn options and exterior self cleaning glass.

Underfloor heating throughout from a wet system with Viessmann boiler and water softener installed in 2020
& a hot water store in a bespoke boiler room. Granite flooring to the bathrooms and extended kitchen/diner with quality solid French oak wood flooring throughout all other areas. Floors have been insulated. Zonal thermostats throughout the house plus automation from exterior temperature sensor.

Cat6 internet wiring throughout.

Central vacuum system, water filtered with no bag, sockets round the house and automated disposal via the boiler room.

No maintenance factory enamelled aluminium gutters and soffits.

Double gates to front off street parking : Lovely rear family garden with deck, lawn, and Japanese style pergola seating area.

Rear conservatory plans approved and foundations completed and signed off.

Located in a prestigious residential road within reach of nearby Ofsted Outstanding Grey Court School, the Russell School and the German School and also Ham Polo Club, Richmond Golf Club, Thames riverside and Richmond Park.

detailedDescription:
A three bedroom Edwardian family home on one of Twickenham's most desirable roads, next to Sir Richard Reynolds School.

The ground floor has a through reception over 30 ft in length with bay window and feature fireplace. There is a separate kitchen with dining area and door to garden and a walk-in cupboard.

Upstairs there are three generous bedrooms and a bathroom. Outside there is a large mature garden laid with lawn.

Copthall Gardens is on the same road as Sir Richard Reynolds School, less than a mile to Orleans Park, and just over a mile to Waldegrave School. It is also less than half a mile to Twickenham station and high street.
