title: 3 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A fine period family home located in a favoured position, extremely close to central Richmond, the River Thames and excellent schools. Proportions of the house are generous and the wide hallway as you enter is a noticeable feature. The layout is well suited to family living with five bedrooms and two bathrooms on the upper floors. There are many features of the period of build around the house including ornate fireplaces. The house features a loft conversion completed under the current owners' tenure with a delightful west facing balcony, plus there is further potential* to extend and re-model the ground floor - the seller's architect has produced draft drawings. (*subject to obtaining the usual permissions)

Externally the house offers a newly refurbished front garden with tessellated tiled path and a concealed bicycle store. The rear garden is beautifully lush and tranquil, faces west and enjoys a relatively private outlook. The outdoor dining area is a lovely space to enjoy on summer evenings.

Situation
Cambridge Road forms part of a very desirable residential area of attractive family houses, located very close to Richmond Bridge and the River Thames, yet feeling relatively quiet and free of traffic.

The comprehensive and sophisticated facilities of Richmond town centre are close at hand as is Richmond Station with its fast direct services to London Waterloo, the London Overground and the Underground (District Line). On Richmond Road there are a range of restaurants, local shops and a brand new supermarket. Deer Park Primary School, rated Outstanding by Ofsted is located on Richmond Road approximately 200m away. Other in-demand schools close by include Orleans Park School, Orleans Primary School, The Vineyard and Waldegrave. The banks of the River Thames are accessible just 200m away, as is Cambridge Gardens with its café, playground and tennis courts. The Riverside provides endless walks, water activities and, at Richmond, boat trips towards central London and Hampton Court. Marble Hill House and park, a firm favourite with families, is reachable along the river via a pleasant walking route.

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

The Property Partnership are pleased to offer this beautifully presented three double bedroom period house with additional office/nursery, ideally situated within a peaceful enclave just moments from the shops and restaurants of eclectic White Hart Lane, as well as the outstanding Barnes and East Sheen primary schools.

Approached via a front garden with secure bicycle storage, accommodation to the wooden-floored ground floor comprises an elegant sitting room with fireplace and bespoke shelving, and a lovely kitchen-diner with French doors opening out onto a walled south-west facing rear garden. The first floor offers a generous, full-width bedroom, and additional double bedroom with built-in storage and a spacious family bathroom. A stunning double bedroom suite is located on the second floor, complete with a large shower room. There is the additional benefit of a small office/nursery.

This is a most attractive character property set within a quiet tree-lined enclave, perfectly placed to enjoy the relaxed yet vibrant Little Chelsea and White Hart Lane community, with its outstanding schools, transport links and restaurants, the latter including Rick Stein's first London venture, overlooking the river from Tideway Yard.

address: Lewin Road, East Sheen, London SW14
detailedDescription:
An attractive and light three bedroom house with good size rooms and a private garden. This charming period house is on a popular residential street just off East Sheen's high street offering great shops and transport access.

The house provides a spacious, clean and contemporary feel on every level. The ground floor offers an entrance hall, a front sitting room with period fireplace and large windows letting in plenty of light, through to a dining room and fitted kitchen with a secluded private West facing garden. The first floor provides two double bedrooms and a large bathroom. The third floor benefits from a loft extension consisting with a spacious light bedroom.

Lewin Road is popular with families and those looking to be in the heart of East Sheen near good transport. East Sheen Primary School is within close walking distance as are the open spaces of Palewell Common and Richmond Park.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This fine Victorian house is arranged over four floors and measures 2,081 sq ft approximately. There is private off street parking to the front and to the rear of the house which is very rare indeed for this part of Richmond Hill.

A number of impressive period features are evident in this charming house, including the bay fronted reception room with large sash windows and feature fireplace, and high ceilings which enable a tremendous amount of natural light and a feeling of volume and space.

The rear of the house has been modernised to create a large kitchen/dining area with a range of fitted appliances, a kitchen island, and French doors which open to the rear patio garden. The garden has been landscaped to a high standard and provides additional entertaining space in the warmer months.

The first floor provides a very large bedroom, with fitted wardrobes and a separate bathroom. Another double bedroom follows with an en suite bathroom.

The second floor has two further rooms, one of these currently used as a double bedroom and the smaller room used as a gym/yoga space. There is a further room in the loft space which could be used as an additional bedroom, storage or an office.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Cardigan road is located only moments from the delightful Terrace Gardens and the views of The River Thames, and is within easy reach of of the vibrant and excellent facilities of Richmond Town.

The area is abundant with a range of attractions and leisure opportunities for families to enjoy. Richmond Park is one of London's eight Royal Parks and covers 2,500 acres. Nearby Richmond Green has been described as "one of the most beautiful urban greens surviving anywhere in England." The world-leading Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew is a unesco World Heritage site and is home to over 50,000 living plants. The property is only a short distance from The River Thames which also makes this a very special place to live.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes) and is well placed for the A316/M3, M4 and M25 giving access to the airports at Heathrow and Gatwick, as well as the south coast and the west country.

*All times and distance used in this brochure are approximate.

title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
An outstanding four-bedroom period home situated in an enviable central Teddington location close to the station, and just moments to Bushy Park, with a generous double size rear garden, the rear section of which houses an impressive detached 'brick-built' garden studio of some 38.5 sqms / 414 sqft.

The current owners undertook major works in 2019 which involved comprehensive renovations (inc. Kitchen, bathrooms, lighting, shutters, decor and flooring) as well as structural alterations to the ground floor involving re-modelling of internal areas to create superb natural light, and an amazing open plan kitchen / dining / family room opening to the garden. The fresh and modern interior is beautifully stylised with many interesting design features, built with quality fittings through out and lots of bespoke storage. The delightful interior is complemented by lovely character features (influenced by the art-deco period in places) to include high ceilings, bay windows, and wall panelling to principle rooms.

The ground floor consists of a pretty front entrance porch with leaded windows complete with matching hard-wood front door and side windows. The hallway is tiled and provides built-in under-stairs shoe storage and further coats cupboard. Opposite is a guest cloakroom with W.C., finished with a stone sink, and high-level cistern on gallow brackets with traditional 'pull-chain'. The main front reception room is warm and inviting, and features a five-pane circular bay window, attractive wall panelling, and an ornamental cast-iron fireplace.

The kitchen / breakfast room is a great space, fitted with solid wood shaker kitchen including large island unit, which in turn, opens to a family room with twin Velux windows to a vaulted ceiling as well as quality Schuco bi-fold doors giving way to ‘same-level’ garden terrace. The family room is laid with walnut herringbone parquet flooring, whilst the kitchen area is tiled, the whole area enjoys under floor heating, as well as 21 LED spotlights on dimmer switches. To complete the ground floor there is a useful utility room with side door access.

Upstairs, the first floor provides double aspect master bedroom (replicating the main reception below) again with distinctive wall panelling. There's a tastefully fitted ensuite shower room with brass fittings, and it also includes a solid marble wash basin. A further double bedroom (rear aspect) has fitted wardrobes and adjacent to this a good single bedroom with corner cupboard. Completing the first floor is the main family bathroom with roll top bath. Upstairs at second floor level is a generous double bedroom with good storage provision and access to its own ensuite shower room. There is scope to further develop the loft, with the possibility to create two double bedrooms (STPP).

Externally the front garden is enclosed by an attractive red-brick stock wall and is planted with established plants, trees and shrubs to provide a lovely natural screen and allowing privacy to the front of the house. The rear garden consists of two areas; the main garden with patio adjacent to the house, as well as a bonus rear section of garden laid with easy-care lawn to provide a safe play area. A standout feature is a sizeable summer house / garden room, constructed with brick and pitched slate roof, including its own power supply and highly useful ensuite shower room. Importantly, it can be accessed independently from the house, which provides many opportunities for alternative uses, e.g. Flexible workspace, yoga or pilates studio, au-pair or dependent relative, or perhaps Airbnb to provide an additional income source.

Location: Coleshill Road is a quiet 'tree-lined' no-through-road with easy access to the superb amenities and restaurants in Broad Street, Church Road and the High Street, whilst the station is under 10 minutes' walk (5 trains an hour). The park is less than five minutes' away with a pedestrian access from Stanton Avenue, via Coleshill Road.

detailedDescription:
This four bedroom house has uninterrupted views of the River Thames and is well presented throughout. The property is laid out over four floors and offers fantastic proportions throughout as well as off street parking and a garage. The ground floor is made up of a double garage, a workshop with fantastic storage and a guest cloakroom. The first-floor benefits from an incredible, spacious eat-in kitchen and dining area. The reception room is open-plan and leads out to the private patio south-facing garden, which has direct access to the River Thames. The second floor has versatile bedroom accommodation, currently comprising two large double bedrooms, a family bathroom and a study, which is sizable to offer the fourth bedroom. The third floor has the master bedroom, separate dressing area and en suite bathroom as well as access to a roof terrace that has a hot-tub and sensational views of the River Thames.
Chiswick Quay is moments from the wide array of shops, restaurants and fantastic schools as well as the pubs and eateries along the River Thames that Grove Park has to offer. There are also excellent transport links from Chiswick overland service and road links to Heathrow Airport.

address: Elm Bank Mansions, The Terrace, London SW13
detailedDescription:
Dean Moriarty in association with Agent&Homes is pleased to offer this bright top floor one bedroom apartment in a highly regarded and desirable Edwardian mansion block situated close to the River Thames and in the heart of Barnes Village.

The apartment comprises a good-sized reception room with hard wood floors and a large bay window which fills the room with light. The property further boasts good ceiling height throughout, a modern kitchen with space for a small dining table, and a good-sized main bedroom with built-in wardrobes that offer plenty of storage space.

The large contemporary shower room is just off a wide entrance hall which has the added benefit of additional storage space. The apartment further benefits from wonderful south west facing roof top views, an onsite caretaker, and a share of the freehold.

Elm Bank Mansions is situated on The Terrace facing the River Thames in Barnes and benefits from well-tended gardens, secure bicycle storage facilities and is within a short walk to the heart of Barnes Village, Mortlake and East Sheen which offers a wide range of shops and restaurants, an independent cinema and the much-loved duck pond on the green. White Hart Lane is also close by and offers an array of boutique cafés and shops.

Additionally, Barnes Bridge station is only a short walk away and offers a regular service into London Waterloo.

description
This fantastic opportunity to purchase this attractive ground floor apartment positioned in a great location in SW14. The apartment boasts two generous sized bedrooms, a modern family bathroom, a separate kitchen and a wonderfully light reception room with doors onto the stunning private rear garden. address: Kingston Hill Place, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
A spacious two double bedroom first floor apartment with a lift located in a beautifully maintained gated development with a share of the freehold and parking.

Location

Kingston Hill Place is a secure gated community set in nine acres of beautifully landscaped gardens off Kingston Hill with views of Richmond Park.

Richmond Park offers 2368 acres of open space perfect for walks, riding and cycling. The area also offers a number of golf courses between Coombe, Wimbledon and Richmond.

There are many good restaurants, shopping facilities, cinemas and theatres in Wimbledon and Kingston. Kingston town centre offers excellent shopping facilities at the Bentalls shopping centre.

Train servces from Kingston provide easy access into Waterloo via Clapham Junction. Frequent bus services run into both Kingston or Putney. There are many popular schools in both the private and public sector including Rokeby for boys, Coombe Hill Girls School, Wimbledon High, Holy Cross for girls, Kings College School for boys and Marymount International School.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

A superb first floor apartment located within a beautiful mansion building set within stunning and extensive grounds in this highly sought after Kingston Hill Place development. There is both private parking and visitor parking available.

The development benefits from a mews like atmosphere and excellent communal facilities; a swimming pool, well equipped gym, sauna and solarium with changing facilities. There is direct lift access to the swimming pool complex.

The apartment offers wonderful lateral living space and opens into a central hallway. To the front is generous reception room with an attractive fireplace and wonderful green views of the landscaped gardens. Alongside is a contemporary kitchen with a good range of fitted units and cupboards with stone work surfaces and integrated appliances. The principal bedroom overlooks the gardens to the front with a stylish en suite bathroom and well designed fitted wardrobes. There is a second double bedroom with a walk in wardrobe and a guest bathroom.

Chain free.

Square Footage: 1280 sq ft

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A beautifully refurbished and extended five bedroom town house with a garage and wonderful views towards the River Thames.

Location

Glentham Gardens is a popular cul-de-sac situated just North of Lonsdale Road. There is access to the M4 motorway providing a link to Heathrow and the West whilst the A3 provides a link to the M25 orbital network.

There are many popular schools in the area including St Paul's, St Paul's Junior, The Harrodian and Swedish Schools all of which are short walk from the property.

Castelnau Parade offers a good range of local shops including Tesco Metro, historic riverside pubs and a wide variety of restaurants. Barnes Village offers an eclectic range of shops, restaurants, pretty duck pond and green which is located within a short drive.

The Riverside Health Club is situated at Dukes Meadow in Chiswick and there is also a rowing club on the North banks of the Thames. The award winning Wetlands and Wildfowl Centre provides a natural oasis of lakes and walkways and is situated behind Castelnau.

Description

A beautifully refurbished five bedroom family house arranged across four floors offering flexible accommodation with a garage.

On the ground floor is a generous open plan kitchen/dining area offering a wonderful multi-purpose living space. Glass sliding doors extend the entertaining space further out to a landscaped private, paved garden. The stunning kitchen offers an excellent range of contemporary units and cupboards with stone work surfaces and integrated appliances. To the front is a fully fitted utility room and downstairs cloakroom.

Upstairs on the first floor to the rear is a large reception room with full height glass sliding doors with a glass frameless Juliet balcony allowing superb green views towards the river. To the front is a double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, which is currently used as an office, and a modern bathroom alongside. There are three double bedrooms and a family bathroom arranged across the second floor. On the top floor is the principal suite with well-designed wardrobe space and a stylish en suite shower room with twin basins.

Square Footage: 2062 sq ft

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Presented to the market in fantastic condition throughout we have this extremely versatile property boasting a deceptive amount of space and the most wonderfully landscaped 155ft secluded rear garden.

To the front of the property we have a large entrance porch leading through to the central hallway. To the left we have an open plan through lounge diner with a lovely bay window and a feature place, adding a nice touch of character. To the rear the property has been quite significantly extended to allow a huge bright and airy kitchen diner. Fitted in contemporary white with integral appliance and a huge central breakfast bar to create an excellent entertaining space. Furthermore we have a separate utility room which houses the brand new boiler and a ground floor shower room, with a white three piece suite and chrome fixtures and fittings.

Where the property becomes truly unique is the adaptable space. The current master bedroom is located to the rear on the ground floor with patio doors out to the decking. This space could well be used as an additional reception room, playroom or even an annex if required. To the front we have another bedroom which again could have many uses, such as a home office.

Leading up to the first floor we have two very comfortable double bedrooms, and a spacious single third bedroom. We also have the family bathroom which has been recently updated with contemporary grey tiles and a shower above the bath.

Externally the rear garden is spectacular and truly needs to be seen to be appreciated. We have a large wrap around deck, which steps down to a patio leading onto the lawn, which is surrounded by mature planting. At the end we have a hidden area with another patio, wildflower planting, a storage shed with power and lighting, and a backdrop imposing tall trees.

Further benefits include new double glazed windows and porch door to the front, an electric car charging point and space for two vehicles on the driveway. Located in a quiet cul-de-sac with no through traffic, moments from David Lloyds Health Club & Hampton Hill High Street, with its eclectic mix of shops, bars and restaurants. The A316 is just a few minutes away along with a great selection of local parks including the Royal Bushy Park within walking distance.

With so many wonderful features, early internal inspection is highly recommended.

This exceptional home has been skilfully remodelled and updated whilst still offering the potential to extend (STPP).

A turned staircase leads to a front bedroom with built in wardrobes and a spacious bathroom is held to the rear of the home.

Richmond has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site. Richmond has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Richmond is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Richmond's exceptional transport links with both overground and underground lines running from the centrally located Richmond station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
One of old Hampton’s most recognisable buildings and listed as a property of Townscape Merit. Arranged over three floors this wonderful three bedroom semi detached home was converted from a chapel in 2014 and was originally built in 1861. There is a nice blend of modern and period features and a feeling of grandeur as you enter through the front door. Located in the heart of the conservation area, the chapel is situated opposite Royal Bushy Park and moments from the River Thames. It is also within a short walk from Hampton Court Palace and close to the local amenities of Hampton and Teddington.

On the ground floor there is a large living/dining room with high ceilings and neo-gothic stone windows, wood flooring with underfloor heating and modern kitchen area. There are also bespoke double doors leading onto the private patio garden which is ideal for dining al fresco during the summer months. The first floor has a large bedroom at the front with en suite, which could also serve as a second reception room and comes with a walk in wardrobe area. The original Gothic window was kept intact, with a recess gap creating a double height volume. On the same floor there is a second double bedroom and family bathroom with jacuzzi.

The second floor is extremely impressive with far reaching views and has a large bedroom with magnificent features, including en suite and ample storage space which can be accessed via a retractable ladder.

Close by there are many boutique shops, restaurants and Café’s, a David Lloyd leisure centre that offers a number of different facilities for families, Hampton open air pool and Kingston town centre, which offers great shopping and nightlife. Locally there are excellent transport links, with Fulwell train station offering direct access into London Waterloo. There is also easy access to the M3 and M25 motorways.

On the upper floors are four double bedrooms, with a main bedroom suite including excellent fitted wardrobes and modern bathroom. Fielding Mews is well located off Castelnau, close to the River Thames. There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

Nearby mainline stations are Barnes and Barnes Bridge for regular routes into Vauxhall, Clapham Junction & London Waterloo stations.

address: South End House, 30 Montpelier Row, Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
An utterly exquisite early Georgian Grade II* Listed landmark home occupying an incredible setting overlooking Marble Hill Park

Location

The house occupies an enviable position overlooking the stunning open acres of Marble Hill park, that in turn adjoins a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames - providing a wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle of daily life. With this semi rural backdrop it is difficult to believe that you are within approximately 10 miles of Hyde Park Corner and just a pleasant riverside stroll (of under a mile) away from Richmond town, with its sophisticated yet charming selection of shops, boutiques and restaurants.

Richmond train station (within about one mile) provides a rapid and direct service into London Waterloo, as well as the District line tube and overland to Stratford, via North London. Whilst even closer at hand the delightful village of St Margarets also has a train station with a direct overland service to London Waterloo.

The A316 is within approximately half a mile and adjoins the M3 at Sunbury, providing easy access to the south west or central London in the other direction. The M3 in turn adjoins the M25 orbital motorway and thereby offers convenient access to Gatwick and Heathrow international airports.

Local schools enjoy an enviable reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

This exquisite and important early Georgian family home was built circa 1721 by Captain John Gray, who was responsible for the construction the whole of Montpelier Row and we believe resided at South End House. The house is located at the far end of Montpelier Row, one of the finest examples of Georgian streets in greater London. It is a landmark property and an architectural masterpiece of the utmost period integrity. Discretely set behind wrought iron gates and brick pillars the house has a striking facade, featuring beautifully regimented fenestration with distinctive soldier coursing and an enchanting pilastered entrance.

The house has uninterrupted and spectacular views of picturesque Marble Hill Park, and glimpses of the River Thames beyond. The open aspects and noticeably generous windows allow an excellent flow of natural light and the accommodation is practically yet flexibly configured over four floors, providing superbly for both formal entertaining and everyday family life.

Whilst the house has been lovingly nurtured by our clients over several decades it could certainly benefit from updating and therefore offers an incredible opportunity for the next owners to create a home to their exact specification and style. There is also a further opportunity to develop the garage and gazebo to provide staff/ancillary accommodation and relocate the garage block (lapsed planning approval details for which are available upon request).

As grand as it is the house maintains a homely and magical atmosphere and further features of particular note include an exceptional galleried reception hall (with a beautiful painted mural and a fine detailed mahogany staircase), gorgeous fireplaces, operational box window shutters, elegant panelled rooms and tall corniced ceilings.

The house is currently arranged to provide seven bedrooms, including a wonderful principal suite with a private lounge. On the ground floor, in addition to the drawing room, there is a stunning Gothic sitting room (that is part of a later addition), as well as a formal dining room, study, breakfast room and a family kitchen. The lower ground floor is predominantly recreational with a large games room, a bar, an office, two further entertaining rooms and a catering kitchen.

The house is set within stunning walled gardens that are well established and provide excellent privacy. In addition to the garage there is further gated parking for numerous cars.

South End House was once home to the legendary poet, Walter de la Mare. De la Mare resigned from the Anglo-American Oil company in 1908 to become a full time writer and a major influence on twentieth century children's literature. He became a tenant of the Sedgwick's at South End House on the upper floor in 1940, until his death in 1956. During World War II he was officially reprimanded for failing to observe the blackout. On one occasion the police even rowed across the river to complain that his upper windows were beaconing to the far bank. He liked to watch the river and people passing in the park. He received friends here such as Joyce Grenfell, Leonard Clark, Richard Church and many another, with whom he partook liberally of tea and conversation. Sadly he was often confined indoors through illness during his final two years but positioned a mirror opposite his bed, so that he could still enjoy the fine view of Marble Hill Park.

Square Footage: 8299 sq ft

title: 7 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Under offer-a beautiful and centrally located four bedroom semi-detached family home offered to the market for the first time in over 60 years needing modernisation.On the ground floor you have three reception rooms, one with feature fireplaces, one with access at the back to a conservatory overlooking a lovely garden.

There is a further separate kitchen with access to the side of the property with outside store-rooms.

On the first you have the traditional bay fronted master bedroom and three further good-sized bedrooms all consisting of feature fireplaces, a further bathroom and separate W/C.

Further benefits include being offered to the market with no onward chain and a large double garage to the side. This house is ideal for the growing family, with planning permission already in place to add a single storey wrap around kitchen/family area with utility and a loft conversion to make it four bedrooms and three bathrooms (two being En-Suite) which will only add to what is already a beautiful home offering over 1770 sqft of living space and a garden that is over 100 ft.

Victoria Road is a popular central Teddington residential road that enables you to take in the benefits of being a stones throw from Teddington high Street, Mainline station and Royal Bushy Park with its lovely walks. This is one not to be missed!
title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful garden apartment on the ground floor of an attractive mansion block in North Barnes.

The property underwent refurbishment in 2015 to a high-specification throughout and it benefits from plenty of natural light and a private landscaped garden. There is a generous bay fronted reception room with a gas fire. A modern eat-in kitchen with a limestone floor and direct access to the garden. There are two double bedrooms with fitted and shelved wardrobes, one of which has further French doors to the garden. The bathroom is tiled, has a limestone floor and boasts a separate shower. The garden has a back gate for access for bicycles.

Castelnau Gardens is well-positioned for nearby shops and restaurants on Castelnau and very close to the river Thames.

There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

detailedDescription:
This five bedroom double fronted family home is just under 2500 sq ft and just over 500ft to the River Thames.

The ground floor is has a versatile living space, great for entertaining. There is an entrance hall with downstairs WC, to the left there is an open plan kitchen / living area, to the right there is a through reception leading to the pitched roof rear extension dining room with bi-fold doors.

The first floor has three bedrooms and two bathrooms including the master bedroom, taking up the whole right side with double aspect windows, en-suite bathroom and fitted wardrobes.

On the top floor there are two further bedrooms and a third shower room. There is also a driveway and fully decked garden to the rear, perfect for those summer barbeques and the family.

Riverview Gardens is less than 500ft to Radnor Gardens and the River Thames. It is also 0.2 miles to St Catherines School, just over half a mile to Sir Richard Reynolds College and less than a mile to Orleans Park School and Twickenham Station.

Detailed Description

A spacious and well planned two double bedroom garden flat on a corner plot, offered with its own freehold on bustling White Hart Lane. The property has two double bedrooms, both at the rear of the building, with a large bathroom. At the front of the flat is the reception room with archway onto a dining room which in turn leads onto the fitted kitchen with door out to the 19 foot south west facing garden. The kitchen boasts an impressive loft. To the side of the apartment is a huge covered workshop / storage and to the rear is the original outside loo - perfect for barbecues!

detailedDescription:
63 Sandycombe Road is an exciting new gated development including a selection of studio, one and two bedroom apartments.

Apartment 8 is a first floor two bedroom apartment within the North Building.

The apartments will feature leading technologies and high specification throughout to all fittings and build systems.

Energy Efficiency

Sustainable energy systems including solar
photovoltaic panels providing energy to
the communal areas.
• High level of insulation throughout.
• Individual heat recovery and mechanical
ventilation system to each apartment.
• NeoStat (or similar) heating control that
can be connected to a NeoHub giving control
of the heating via your phone or tablet.
• Energy efficient A rated Ideal Logic Max
35kW combi gas boiler (providing a seasonal
efficiency rating of 94%, awarding it an ErP
a-rating for heat. It also has an a-rating for hot
water too).
• Energy efficient double glazed full height
aluminium windows with improved acoustic
glazing to the railway elevation.

Internal Fit-Out

• Solid core internal oak shaker doors within all
apartments with bronze metal ironmongery.
• Real engineered oak plank flooring to living
areas and hallways.
• Fitted carpets and acoustic underlay to
bedroom areas.
• Underfloor heating to all rooms on individual
controls.
• LED downlighters throughout with bronze
metal switches and sockets.
• Media plate to living area providing TV / FM
aerial, telecom, satellite and power points.
• Sky+ wired to communal satellite dish
(purchaser subscription required).
• TV / FM and telecom point to all bedrooms.
• usb charging points to kitchen, living room
and master bedroom.
• Video Entry door system to each apartment.
• Mains operated smoke detectors

Bathrooms

• Designer sanitary ware throughout including
stylish vanity units and soft closing toilet
seats.
• Contemporary matt black showers and basin /
bath mixers.
• Porcelain non-slip tiling to bathrooms to floors
and wet areas.
• Illuminated LED bathroom mirror with motion
sensor, heated demister and inbuilt shaver
socket.
• Chrome electrically heated ladder towel
radiator
• Minimalist glass shower and bath screens
(8mm toughened safety glass)
• Underfloor heating to all bathrooms and
shower rooms.

Kitchens

Custom designed contemporary handle-less
kitchens with fitted wall and base units
featuring stone worktops and a mixture of oak
stained timber and white matt soft close
hinged doors.
• Integrated Bosch appliances including
fridge freezer, washer/dryer, dishwasher
complimented by Siemens multifunctional
oven, integrated microwave, induction
hobs and feature extractor hoods.
• Under cabinet LED lighting beneath eye level
units.
• Breakfast bar in selected apartments.

Customer Care

• 10 Year Structural Defect Warranty

Location

Kew Gardens station (Zones 3 & 4) is approx.
0.6 miles and provides District Underground
services to Richmond and towards/across the
capital. There are also br services across
west and north London and around to London
Stratford.

Richmond station (Zone 4) is less than a mile away and is the terminus of the District Underground line. There are more comprehensive and mainline br services as well as faster journey times to London Waterloo (fastest c20 mins).
North Sheen station (Zone 3) is approx. 0.3 miles
with services to London Waterloo (25 minutes).

Please note that all images of the proposed development are computer generated and are thus indicative only. The main external image adopted is of the proposed North Building.

The Government's Help to Buy Scheme is available to purchasers of apartments within this development.

Completion anticipated November 2021
EPC - tbc

title: 4 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
A unique opportunity to acquire a super, Victorian, first floor conversion flat, nestled in a particularly desirable road on the mid-slopes of Richmond Hill.

Situated in an imposing and striking building, the property features stylish accommodation throughout.
The kitchen area blends seamlessly into the entertaining/relaxing space where you’ll find a large bay window, bringing in masses of natural light and a particularly high ceiling. The kitchen area features modern appliances and generous food preparation areas. Additionally, a contemporary and very stylish family bathroom adds to the appeal.

This magnificent apartment is situated adjacent to The Hill, its majestic Terrace Gardens and River Thames.
With access to the nearby Royal Richmond Park, so close-by, this really is one of the most desirable places to live, in the borough.

The location of this property is great for access to the station, the town centre and its excellent transport links whilst, in the immediate area, you’ll be spoilt with bakers, independent shops, some quaint bars and eateries.

This wonderful flat comes highly recommended and would certainly suit a first time buyer.

Situated on a popular road and overlooking the picturesque Twickenham Green, this beautiful Victorian cottage comes with two bedrooms, two reception rooms, a modern kitchen and no onward chain.

May Road is close to the picturesque Twickenham Green and is less than a mile to the high street where you can find a vast array of shops, pubs and restaurants. There are also a number of excellent schools nearby.

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Court Way, Twickenham, TW2 7SA

£900,000 freehold

An ideal opportunity to purchase an original 1930's semi detached three bedroom house in a good location, being minutes from Twickenham station giving fast links to central London. It is also close to the Town Centre, bus routes, the main shops and to the A316 linking central London and the M3 and M25. There is ample potential to extend, update and improve this property.

The front door opens into a hallway with a traditional layout of a separate lounge, dining room and kitchen downstairs. The dining room has french doors leading out to the garden. The hallway, lounge and dining room have the original solid wood block floors and the kitchen original terra cotta floor tiles. Upstairs there are two spacious double bedrooms, and a smaller single bedroom. All rooms have attractive barrel ceilings. The bathroom has a bath and walk in shower. The toilet is separate. The house is centrally heated by a gas combi-boiler. The property is graded in band E (see the Environmental Performance Certificate attached).

The south facing rear garden is approximately 15.5 metres in length ( = 50 feet The purchaser should satisfy themselves as to the accurate dimensions). There is a paved patio area with a garden tap.

From the garden there is a side door into the garage. There is a wooden gate onto the shared driveway. The front doors to the garage open onto this driveway. The front garden is gravelled to allow off street parking. Permits for the cps are available from the local authority for parking on the road.

The property is located in a very popular residential road and is in the catchment area for well regarded local schools.
title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription: A semi-detached family home that has been thoughtfully remodelled and extended to offer in excess of 2,000 sqft of accommodation. This immaculately-presented property is located on the favoured west facing side of this desirable road and in close proximity to Sheen Mount primary school. The property is currently arranged over three floors to offer five bedrooms, three bathrooms (one en-suite), a separate reception room, a downstairs w/c and a fully extended kitchen/family room at the rear with underfloor heating and integrated speakers. Folding doors lead out to a low maintenance west facing garden that also has a separate studio with power sockets that is an ideal home workspace or games room. The property has retained many of it's original period features and and has ample storage in many of it's rooms including bespoke built in wardrobes and a large cellar beneath the kitchen. There is also a front porch, discreet bin storage and side access to the rear garden. Viewing is highly recommended.

title: 5 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This exquisite and important early Georgian family home was built circa 1721 by Captain John Gray, who was responsible for the construction of the whole of Montpelier Row and we believe resided at South End House. The house is located at the far end of Montpelier Row, one of the finest examples of Georgian streets in Greater London. It is a landmark property and an architectural masterpiece of the utmost period integrity. Discretely set behind wrought iron gates and brick pillars the house has a striking facade, featuring beautifully regimented fenestration with distinctive soldier coursing and an enchanting pilastered entrance.

The house has uninterrupted and spectacular views of picturesque Marble Hill Park, and glimpses of the River Thames beyond. The open aspects and noticeably generous windows allow an excellent flow of natural light and the accommodation is practically yet flexibly configured over four floors, providing superbly for both formal entertaining and everyday family life.

Whilst the house has been lovingly nurtured by our clients over several decades it could certainly benefit from updating and therefore offers an incredible opportunity for the next owners to create a home to their exact specification and style. There is also a further opportunity to develop the garage and gazebo to provide staff/ancillary accommodation and relocate the garage block (lapsed planning approval details for which are available upon request).

As grand as it is the house maintains a homely and magical atmosphere and further features of particular note include an exceptional galleried reception hall (with a beautiful painted mural and a fine detailed mahogany staircase), gorgeous fireplaces, original box window shutters, elegant panelled rooms and tall corniced ceilings.

The house is currently arranged to provide seven bedrooms, including a wonderful principal suite with a private lounge. On the ground floor, in addition to the drawing room, there is a stunning Gothic sitting room (that is part of a later addition), as well as a formal dining room, study, breakfast room and a family kitchen. The lower ground floor is predominantly recreational with a catering kitchen, large games room, a bar, an office and two further entertaining rooms.

The house is set within stunning walled gardens that are well established and provide excellent privacy. In addition to the garage there is further gated parking for numerous cars.

South End House was once home to the legendary poet, Walter de la Mare. De la Mare resigned from the Anglo-American Oil company in 1908 to become a full time writer and a major influence on twentieth century children's literature. He became a tenant of the Sedgwick's at South End House on the upper floor in 1940, until his death in 1956. During World War II he was officially reprimanded for failing to observe the blackout. On one occasion the police even rowed across the river to complain that his upper windows were beaconing to the far bank. He liked to watch the river and people passing in the park. He received friends here such as Joyce Grenfell, Leonard Clark, Richard Church and many another, with whom he partook liberally of tea and conversation. Sadly he was often confined indoors through illness during his final two years but positioned a mirror opposite his bed, so that he could still enjoy the fine view of Marble Hill Park.

The house occupies an enviable position overlooking the stunning open acres of Marble Hill Park, that in turn adjoins a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames - providing a wonderful retreat from the hustle and bustle of daily life. With this semi rural backdrop it is difficult to believe that you are within approximately 10 miles of Hyde Park Corner and just a pleasant riverside stroll (of under a mile) away from Richmond town, with its sophisticated yet charming selection of shops, boutiques and restaurants.

Local schools enjoy an enviable reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country..

Richmond train station (within about one mile) provides a rapid and direct service into London Waterloo, as well as the District line tube and overland to Stratford, via North London. Whilst even closer at hand the delightful village of St Margarets also has a train station with a direct overland service to London Waterloo.

The A316 is within approximately half a mile and adjoins the M3 at Sunbury, providing easy access to the south west or central London in the other direction. The M3 in turn adjoins the M25 orbital motorway and thereby offers convenient access to Gatwick and Heathrow international airports.

title: 8 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A fabulous family home with views directly over Barns Elms playing fields. Arranged over the three floors this property retains the majority of its original features and is presented in excellent condition throughout.
The ground floor comprises a wonderful double reception room with high ceilings and original fireplaces, a utility room/ cloakroom, cellar and large kitchen / dining room with doors leading to a mature west facing garden. To the upper floors there are four double bedrooms, two family bathrooms as well as a west facing roof terrace.
Rocks Lane is within easy walking distance of Barnes Station and Barnes Common with all local amenities found in Barnes itself and Castlenau.

detailedDescription:
Luxuriously appointed, rarely available mews house situated in this delightful cobbled setting in the heart of Kew village.

The property has a contemporary internal design layout with well-proportioned, bright accommodation arranged over 3 floors.

Cleverly re-modelled by the present owners providing a versatile layout and flexible living options.

Kew has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site. Kew has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Kew village market is held monthly and, in summer, Kew Green hosts the Kew Village Fete and cricket. Kew is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Kew's exceptional transport links with both overground and underground lines running from the centrally located Kew Gardens station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Fieldend in Strawberry Hill, Twickenham, is often considered to be one of the most appealing of Eric Lyons’ Span estates. Built in 1961, this incredibly bright three-bedroom house is positioned at the far end of the five-acre site, overlooking the verdant landscaping for which the estate is so renowned. The house has been extended to introduce a glazed rear section that draws light into the plan, and carefully renovated to preserve the original features. The private, south-facing back garden flows seamlessly from the inside spaces, engendering the quiet sense of retreat from the city that is so loved by Fieldend’s residents. This house also has a garage.

The Architect

Span are perhaps the most celebrated of all 20th-century residential developers and many of their buildings throughout the south of England are now listed. Founded by architect-turned-developer Geoff Townsend and Eric Lyons (thoroughly schooled in the modern movement having worked for Bauhaus designer Walter Gropius from 1936-37), their designs sought to bring the tenants of modernism – light, openness, a sense of order – to suburban areas on a domestic scale. The company built 30 housing estates between 1948 and 1984.

Fieldend’s landscaping is now Grade ii-listed in recognition of its distinctive vision. The estate is largely pedestrianised and the 51 houses that comprise it share access to beautifully maintained communal gardens.

The Tour

This house retains its instantly recognisable Eric Lyons porch, and the façade is replete with floor-to-ceiling windows. Any new additions have been carefully conceived to chime with the architect’s focus on natural light and simple design.

The living room lies at the front of the ground floor plan, a wonderfully calm space with original woodblock flooring underfoot. A well-conceived workspace is tucked to the left, which opens at the rear to the dining room contained within the extension. This space is flooded with light through a glazed, mono-pitched roof that provides a subtle and uplifting division of space, and bi-folding doors that open to the garden.

The kitchen sits to the left of the plan. A single-pane window frames views onto the garden and allows plenty of natural light in, which illuminates the green vinyl floors underfoot and minimal white cabinetry. There is also a new shower room on this level.

There are three bedrooms and a newly refinished bathroom on the first floor. Each bedroom has exposed ceiling beams – a feature throughout Lyons’ Span designs – and the largest bedroom also has original built-in wardrobes.

Outdoor Space

The south-facing garden is framed by the mature trees that enclose Fieldend. It has been lovingly maintained by the current owners and carefully planted with flowering climbers. A gate at the rear leads onto further communal wildflower meadows.

The Area

Fieldend Estate can be found in Strawberry Hill, a popular residential area in the London Borough of Richmond upon Thames. Teddington and Twickenham high streets are both one mile away. Teddington was voted the best place to live in London by The Times in 2021 and has an excellent selection of restaurants, cafés and shops, and a recently launched farmers’ market. Twickenham has a range of shops and pubs including a Waitrose and a farmers’ market on Saturdays.

The larger shopping areas of Kingston and Richmond are within easy reach. Fieldend is a 10-minute walk from the River Thames at Teddington Lock with access to the towpath and walking/cycling routes in both directions. Bushy Royal Park is also close by, next to Hampton Court Palace. Richmond Park is a few miles away.

There are good transports links in the area. Strawberry Hill train station is a 10-minute walk and offers services to London Waterloo with journey times of approximately 30 minutes. There are regular buses into Richmond (where the Underground runs District Line services) and Kingston. It is a short drive to the M3, with good access to the M25 and M4.

Tenure: Freehold
Service Charge: Approx. £130 per month (includes maintenance of communal gardens and grounds)

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Fully immersive, 3D/Virtual tour available.

A beautifully presented, two-bedroom, executive apartment available in central Twickenham.

The Property.

Built in 2016 and located in central Twickenham, this wonderful apartment is offered to the market with no onward chain and will afford the discerning buyer a rare opportunity to acquire a spacious, modern and conveniently located residence, a short stroll from both the River Thames and Twickenham mainline station.

Perfect as a first-time purchase, buy to let investment or pied-a-terre.

Securely accessed via video phone entry, the well-kept communal areas feature bright and spacious corridors and lift access to all floors.

The apartment comprises two well-proportioned double bedrooms, modern bathroom with three-piece suite, reception/dining room and a modern, fitted kitchen with an array of fully integrated appliances and ample cupboard space.

Storage options are excellent, with a large storage cupboard located off the hallway, along with the considerable benefit of a spacious and secure internal private storage area located across the corridor from the entrance to the flat. This storage area is large enough to accommodate both a bicycle and a pushchair.

Parking is available in council bays and a large public car-park close-by.

Why you will like it.

The apartment is a fine home that combines a modern, comfortable living space with a fantastic town centre location, just 17 minutes from Waterloo by rail.

Both bedrooms are spacious doubles with fitted, double wardrobes, the extensive storage a real bonus of this apartment.

Being only five years old, the apartment still has a “new” feel to it and the fixtures, fittings and décor are all at an incredibly high standard. The new owner will benefit from the remainder of a ten-year NHBC guarantee for total peace of mind.

Location

Twickenham is a highly sought-after London suburb town with a rich history that boasts beautiful 18th Century architecture and stunning period mansions and gardens. It is perhaps most famous for being the home of England Rugby as well as being the location for the World Rugby Museum. Other attractive landmarks include historic, bustling Church Street with its bakeries, cafes and restaurants, Strawberry Hill House & Garden, 17th Century National Trust Ham House and Gardens, York House Gardens, Twickenham Stoop which is home to the Harlequins rugby union team and Grade I listed Marble Hill House which is the former home of Henrietta Howard, Countess of Suffolk and mistress of King George II.

Twickenham offers an attractive town centre and has a wonderful sense of community. At the same time, it benefits from superb transport links that guarantee easy access to central London and beyond. Twickenham mainline station is within a few moments’ walk and provides a fast and regular service to London Waterloo whilst local bus routes provide access to Richmond, Kingston, Heathrow and central London. The thriving High Street boasts many independent commercial businesses including an interesting diversity of shops and well-known and treasured brand names. Bushy Park and Richmond Park are oases of peace and tranquillity and both are within easy reach. The nearby River Thames (which is within walking distance of the apartment) has an array of wonderful restaurants and bars along its banks and a most scenic riverside walk that passes through Marble Hill Park towards Richmond.

The apartment’s enviable location in central Twickenham ensures easy access to its diverse selection of shops, cafes, restaurants and entertainment and leisure options.

Lease Information

Lease of 170 years.

Ground rent of £350 per annum.

Service charge of £2260 per annum which includes Cleaning of communal areas, windows, lift maintenance, security system /door entry and buildings insurance.

On the ground floor you have a lovely front reception room ideal for the evening, and at the rear you walk into an extended kitchen/dining room with downstairs W/C and utility room and doors leading out onto a lovely garden.

On the first floor you have the master bedroom with ample storage, two further bedrooms and four piece family bathroom.

On the top floor is the loft converted fourth bedroom which is bright and airy and has access to large amounts of eave storage.

Within the catchment zones of some of the area’s finest schools and being within a stones throw of Teddington High Street and mainline station this is the ideal family home, and one where you can move into immediately and enjoy everything central Teddington has to offer right on your doorstep.

detailedDescription:
A substantial, beautifully presented, and double fronted semi-detached family house with four bedrooms, two bathrooms and a wonderful 85’ south facing private rear garden. The property is situated in a highly regarded road in the Ormond’s area of Hampton and is offered for sale with no chain. This location gives good access to sought-after local schools and Hampton village with its railway station, amenities and village green. The gates of Royal Bushy Park, amenities of Hampton Hill High Street, river Thames and local bus services are all close by.

A double-glazed front door with double-glazed frosted windows to side leads to the entrance hallway. There is a built-in shoe rack, built-in understairs storage cupboard and doors to all rooms. The through reception room has ample space for sitting and dining reception areas. There is a character feature fireplace with a real fire, double-glazed round bay window and double-glazed window and door to the garden. The extended kitchen, dining, family reception room is the hub of the home and benefits from its south facing aspect. Light floods in through four double-glazed Velux skylights with integrated blinds in the pitched ceiling, and double-glazed windows and French style doors to the garden. The kitchen area has a range of modern fitted units with solid wood worksurfaces. An extensive range of integrated appliances include stainless steel Neff double oven, with microwave above, five ring Neff gas hob with extractor fan and Neff dishwasher. There is an integrated wine chiller and space for a fridge freezer. Ample space remains for dining and family reception areas and there is a side aspect double-glazed window and door to the side path. A further door leads to the cloakroom W.C and utility room. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine, side aspect frosted double glazed window and a pedestal wash hand basin. The modern fitted gas central heating combination boiler is wall mounted and a built-in storage cupboard houses the hot water cylinder. A home office / study has a double-glazed window and wall to wall bookshelves.

Stairs lead to the first-floor landing with access to loft space via a pull-down ladder and doors to all rooms. The master bedroom is front aspect and has a double-glazed round bay window and a range of floor to ceiling built-in wardrobes. The second double bedroom is rear aspect and has a range of built-in wardrobes and shelving. There are two further good-sized bedrooms. The family bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted four-piece suite with a bath with a handheld shower attachment. There is a vanity sink unit, chrome heated towel rail, built-in storage cupboard, shaver point, tiled flooring, and double-glazed window. The family shower room and W.C has a shower cubicle with a wall mounted shower attachment, twin vanity sink unit, chrome heated towel rail, tiled flooring and double-glazed frosted bay window. Additional features include wood flooring throughout the whole of the ground floor, double glazing and gas central heating.

Outside the front garden has a paved driveway which provides off street parking and there is a dwarf wall and a raised bed with shrubs and lighting. There is a lawned area with tree and shrub borders. Secure pedestrian side access with lighting, outside tap, space for bin storage and leading to the wonderful 85’ south facing private rear garden. There are large lawned and patio areas and an established range of tree, flower and shrub borders. There is a shed for storage with power, a workshop with power and light, three log stores, two compost heaps and outside lighting and power.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented apartment is situated within an iconic Grade II listed building at the top of Richmond Hill. Designed by Sir Edwin Cooper, Star and Garter House dates from 1924 and has breathtaking views overlooking the River Thames; the only view in England protected by an act of Parliament.

The apartment is located on the 7th and 8th floors, and offer close to 3,000 sq ft of lateral accommodation, and enjoys extraordinary views towards Petersham Meadows and The River.

On entering the property you are instantly impressed with the substantial space the apartment offers. From the hallway you enter into an elegant reception space, with high ceilings and an abundance of natural light. This area leads to an open plan dining space and a luxury fitted kitchen, with an array of fitted appliances, creating an excellent area to entertain friends and family.

In all there are four bedroom suites. The beautifully designed and luxurious principal suite adjoins a bespoke fitted dressing area and an en suite bathroom with double vanity unit. This room has wonderful views of the river. Three further double bedrooms follow, one of them with an array of fitted wardrobes and all are en suite.

The property also benefits from a guest cloakroom, ample storage in the hallway, and is also sold with two off street parking spaces in the underground parking area.

The Star and Garter benefits from a 24 hour concierge, and dramatic communal areas with majestic gardens and terracing. Further notable features include a gym and swimming pool, screening room and underground car parking. Residents will also benefit from a 'town car' with a service to Richmond town centre.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

The Star and Garter is located adjacent to Richmond Park, one of London's eight Royal Parks covering 2,500 acres and is a venue for a range of leisure activities. The property is also situated near to Richmond's vibrant activity and attractive riverside amenities, the famous Richmond Green, numerous shops, bars and restaurants.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include The Vineyard School, Deer Park School, Marshgate Primary School, Orleans Primary School, Orleans Park School, Holy Trinity Church of England Primary School and Windham Nursery School.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is only 6.8 miles away.

*All times and distances are approximate.

detailedDescription:
This beautifully presented two bedroom apartment is situated on the first floor of a striking mansion block. Spanning 1,324 sq ft and forming part of an impressive Edwardian building, the apartment offers lateral and versatile living, and is ideally positioned within easy reach of Richmond Town Centre and The River.

Due to the Edwardian period of the apartment, there are numerous notable period features including high ceilings which allow natural light to flow throughout, original fireplaces and large sash windows. The property also benefits from parquet flooring.

The apartment is accessed via a grand communal hallway, and entry is via an attractive stained-glass front door that opens into a fine entrance hallway which can be used as a dining room or as a reception space, depending on the new owners' requirements.

The kitchen has been recently renovated and the combination of modern high-end appliances, breakfast bar and array of storage options offer an excellent blend of contemporary living and practical space.

The double aspect reception room is located at the rear of the building, and the large bay window is a particular feature here, allowing ample light to filter in to create a lovely room in which to entertain.

There is a spacious principal bedroom and further double bedroom, and both rooms have built-in wardrobes.

To complete the accommodation there is a family bathroom and separate cloakroom.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Cambridge Road is within close proximity to both Richmond town centre (0.5 mile), St Margarets (1.0 mile) and many of the area's superb attractions such as the River Thames (0.1 mile), Richmond Green (0.6 mile) and Richmond Park (0.9 mile). Other places of interest include Kew Gardens (1.6 miles), Twickenham Stadium (1.8 miles) and Marble Hill Park (0.6 mile).

Schools in the area include Orleans Park School (0.8 mile), King's House School (1.0 mile) and The Vineyard School (1.3 miles).

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus frequent trains to central London via South West trains from St. Margarets and Richmond stations and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes) from Richmond station. The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is 8.1 miles away and can be reached easily by road, train or bus.

detailedDescription:
Rarely available semi-detached Victorian family house situated in this most desirable tree-lined avenue in Kew Village within the Borough of Richmond.

The property affords classic family accommodation beautifully proportioned over the original 3 floors totalling approximately 2756 sq.ft. Including the cellar.

The property is well presented throughout with an abundance of character detail still in existence and features a delightful, well thought out extension creating a generous kitchen/family room ideal for entertaining.

Outside to the rear there is an established south facing circa 62 ft. Walled garden and provision for off street parking to the front.

Kew has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site. Kew has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Kew village market is held monthly and, in summer, Kew Green hosts the Kew Village Fete and cricket. Kew is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Kew's exceptional transport links with both London Overground and District lines running from the centrally located Kew Gardens station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

detailedDescription:
This hugely practical and well-located house is set within a gated traffic-free private road close to central Richmond and several of the areas most requested primary schools. Tersha Street features lots of lovely mature trees and planting that gives a fresh, green and vibrant feel to the whole street.

The house has been significantly modernised by the current owners and features well-appointed and stylish bathrooms and a high specification kitchen with a full suite of 'Smeg' appliances plus 'Siemens' washer/dryer and an instant boiling water/filtered drinking water tap. The kitchen and ground floor cloakroom both have modern electric underfloor heating.

The principal bedroom suite on the top floor has its own shower room and custom-made fitted wardrobes/storage plus easily accessible eaves storage. The larger first floor bedroom also has its own shower room.

Living space is generous and features engineered oak flooring throughout plus dual-zone dimmable LED lighting.

The garden faces south-west and is lovely and sunny, plus it has the benefit of secure rear-access.

Situation
Tersha Street is located less than half a mile to the east of central Richmond which can be reached directly on foot via a main walking route. It is also very convenient for several of Richmond's most coveted schools including Marshgate Primary School and Holy Trinity CofE Primary School; both of which are rated as Outstanding by Ofsted. Pre-school age children have the excellent nurseries of Windham and Holy Trinity close by, with Bright Horizons facilities also nearby.

Richmond town centre is home to many well-known retailers and smaller boutique shops that occupy the high street and surrounding roads and lanes, together with mainstream and independent restaurants, cafes and pubs. Richmond station, with fast connections to London Waterloo plus District Line Underground and London Overground services, is in the middle of the town centre, as is Richmond Green and the River Thames. Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are reachable on foot and both under a mile away.

The area hosts a wealth of sporting and leisure facilities, with Pools on The Park providing indoor and outdoor family swimming, plus a gym and various other fitness pursuits. Old Deer Park offers squash, cricket and tennis clubs plus other activities including rugby and archery and the famous Royal Mid Surrey golf Club.

Additional Information

This extremely light and bright property offers a real sense of space. It is an impressive size, at over 1030 sq. Ft.

The communal gardens are sumptuous - The residents enjoy a lake, manicured lawns and mature trees. Courtlands is a lovely place to be.

The property is situated close to the amenities of Sheen Road, with a more extensive range of shops, bars and restaurants within easy reach in the heart of Richmond town center. Notably, the outstanding rated Marshgate Primary School is within 0.2 miles. The nearest stations are North Sheen (National Rail) and Richmond (District line, over ground, & National Rail), whilst motorists have easy access onto the A316 leading in and out of central London.

Viewings are highly recommended.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An exceptional, semi-detached, four-bedroom family home completed to an incredibly high standard over three floors. Erncroft Way is located just a few hundred yards from Twickenham mainline station. Additional benefits include off-street parking to the front of the property. EPC=C.

Centrally located in Twickenham is this exceptional, semi-detached, four-bedroom family home. Erncroft Way is located just a few hundred yards from Twickenham mainline station where there is a fast link to London Waterloo. There are a number of excellent schools in the area, with the high street nearby where you will find a vast array of shops, bars and restaurants. Designed and completed to an incredibly high standard by its current owners, the property is spaciously arranged over three floors. The well-proportioned accommodation consists of a welcoming entrance hallway with a primary reception room to the front with bay windows, complete with wood burner, downstairs W/C, a striking, open-plan kitchen/dining/living area to the rear, complete with utility/ storage room and a pretty private courtyard. The downstairs living beautifully showcases the vast outside space this property boasts, with bi-fold doors which open out on to a large, decked area, leading out to an approximately 84’ ft garden, complete with jacuzzi and access to a downstairs fourth bedroom which could be used as a private office/ gym. On the first floor there is a huge double bedroom, an additional double bedroom, and a spacious family bathroom off the hallway. The top floor consists of an impressive master suite, complete with stunning, original features and en-suite bathroom. Additional benefits include off-street parking to the front of the property, side access, stylishly landscaped front and rear gardens and a blend of period charm and modern living throughout. EPC=C.<br /><br />
title: 4 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A superb three-bedroom house located moments from the delightful Radnor Gardens and the River Thames. Further benefits include direct views over Radnor Gardens and the river as well as potential for further extension to the ground floor and loft - which had previously been granted (STPP). EPC = E.

A superb three bedroom house located moments from the delightful Radnor Gardens and the River Thames. The downstairs comprises a lovely bright double reception room with original stripped flooring, study, shower room, kitchen and a dining room leading onto a wonderful West facing garden. Upstairs there are two double bedrooms (with built in wardrobes), the front bedroom having river views, a small double bedroom and a modern bathroom with separate shower. Further benefits include direct views over Radnor Gardens and the river as well as potential for further extension to the ground floor and loft - which had previously been granted (STPP).
There are excellent transports links in the area, with Strawberry Hill & Twickenham stations a short walk away and regular buses into Richmond (District line tube), Teddington and Kingston. The local area is well served for schools, both private and state-run. EPC = E.<br /><br />

detailedDescription:
Property Ref: 1796

Very desirable massive light and airy first and ground floor Duplex apartment with very big roof garden overlooking Royal Bushy Park. Two very large Double Bedrooms, one with fitted wardrobes..

Very generous Double Size Sitting Room with two extremely large windows. Large kitchen diner overlooking park and roof garden with dishwasher, washing machine, fitted fridge, fitted freezer.
Second kitchenette on the ground floor making the ground floor almost self contained annex with it's own shower room, dining area and south facing patio. First floor second Bathroom with separate shower and bath. Second separate toilet with sink.

Excellent location with private front door directly on to the High street. Gas Fired Central Heating and hot water. Open feature fireplaces. Excellent decoration throughout in neutral colours. Much larger than average well built warm garage. Early viewing recommended due to the desirability of the roof garden and view. Duplex apartment extends to more than 110 square meters (This is the same size of an average 4 bedroom house in UK.)
This unit is larger than the next door flat which has been split into two 2 bed flats.

detailedDescription:
A well positioned 2 bedroom apartment with plenty of natural light and with the additional benefit of a single garage space to the rear behind electric doors. The property underwent refurbishment in 2017 and boasts two double bedrooms, a modern bathroom, an open plan kitchen and reception room with generous cupboard space. The apartment is set within a well maintained small block of flats and is located on the first floor.

The property is located on a parade of shops and independent eateries in North Barnes, whilst nearby Barnes Village is home to the well-known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. The River Thames is close by and has a toe path that leads to Putney and Barnes / Mortlake. Hammersmith Station is the closet transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

Being Sold Chain Free.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Fairlight, Uxbridge Road, Hampton Hill TW12
detailedDescription:
A first-floor modern apartment with two double bedrooms, beautifully presented décor throughout the home and offered for sale with no chain. The property is located moments from the shops, bars and restaurants of Hampton Hill High Street and the gates of Royal Bushy Park. Sought-after local schools, bus services and Fulwell railway station are all close by.

A communal entrance hallway with entry phone system and stairs leads to the first-floor private entrance. An entrance hallway has ample space for cloaks storage, a built-in storage cupboard, and doors leading to all rooms. The through reception room has ample space for sitting and dining reception areas. The kitchen has a range of modern fitted units with an integrated oven, hob and extractor. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine and space for fridge. The gas central heating combination boiler is concealed and wall mounted, and there is an airing cupboard with a hot water tank. The spacious master bedroom has a range of floor to ceiling built-in wardrobes. There is a good sized second double bedroom. The bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted white suite with a bath with a wall mounted shower attachment and shower screen. There is a pedestal wash hand basin, chrome heated towel rail, part tiled walls, tiled flooring and double-glazed frosted window. Additional features include beautifully presented décor, double glazing, gas central heating, and there is a long lease with over 105 years unexpired.

Outside there are well maintained lawned communal gardens and residents off street parking spaces via permits. There is a spacious brick-built storage cupboard on the ground floor, and a drying area located close to the first-floor private entrance
