detailedDescription:
This beautifully renovated two bedroom split level apartment is arranged over three floors and offers an excellent blend of period features and contemporary living, ideal for first-time buyers.

On entering the property there is a wonderfully light double aspect kitchen/reception room with restored floorboards, breakfast bar and a feature fireplace.

On the second floor there is a principal bedroom with built-in wardrobes, a second double bedroom, a beautifully appointed bathroom and a separate utility area.

The property further benefits from access to a decked private roof terrace that offers excellent views over Richmond, and additional storage.

The property is within close proximity to all the local amenities that St. Margarets and Richmond has to offer, in addition to being nearby to many of the area's attractions such as the River Thames, Marble Hill Park and Richmond Park with its 2,500 acres of Royal parkland.

Schools in the area include Lady Eleanor Holles, Hampton School, Orleans Park School, St. Stephen's Primary School, King's House School and The Vineyard School. Other nearby places of interest include the unesco World Heritage Site - The Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew and Hampton Court Palace.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus frequent trains to Central London via South West Trains from St Margarets and Richmond stations. The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is a distance of only 6.3miles from the property.

Thameside Place is an exclusive gated development with stunning communal gardens situated directly on the banks of this particularly scenic stretch of the Thames. Located in Hampton Wick, you will find everyday amenities such as chemists, bakers, dry-cleaning, small supermarket outlets and coffee spots at Hampton Wick High-Street, alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Description

The Property Partnership are delighted to offer this beautifully presented turn-key, four bedroom Victorian house and south-facing garden, ideally located in the heart of Little Chelsea just the shortest of strolls from Barnes Primary School and the independent shops and restaurants of White Hart Lane.

This unusually expansive and high-ceilinged period home provides well-balanced living space over three spacious floors, and is presented in excellent internal order throughout. Accommodation to the ground floor comprises an entrance hall, double-reception with bespoke shelving and wonderfully high ceilings, WC and a contemporary kitchen with bi-fold doors opening out onto a good size part-decked south-facing garden. The first floor offers two double bedrooms, a single bedroom/office/nursery, and a large family bathroom. A wonderfully luxurious master bedroom suite is situated on the second floor, complete with juliette balcony, ample integrated storage and adjoining bathroom.

Houses of these proportions are rarely available within Little Chelsea, with this home a particularly attractive example. Westfields Avenue is a pretty road of predominantly terraced Victorian properties, perfectly placed to enjoy the relaxed yet vibrant Little Chelsea and White Hart Lane community, with its excellent schools, transport links and restaurants, the latter including Rick Stein's first London venture, overlooking the river from Tideway Yard.

detailedDescription:
Family home in private gated development

Location

Situated opposite the River Thames and moments from
Hampton Court Palace and Royal Bushy Park this development
benefits from stunning grounds which surround the property. The house is ideally located for Hampton Station which is about
0.6 miles away and provides regular and direct trains into
London Waterloo in around 45 minutes (faster trains are
available at Hampton Court and Teddington stations which are 1 mile and 1.4 miles respectively). Bridge Road in Hampton Court Village is just over a mile away and offers a wide selection of restaurants, bars, boutiques and shops with more extensive shopping accessible in nearby Kingston-upon-Thames. The M4, M3 and M25 motorways are within easy driving distance and offer excellent road links to Heathrow and Gatwick airports, with central London itself just 12.5 miles away.

Description

Set within an exclusive gated development, this lovely family
home welcomes you via steps leading to the front door. You are welcomed into hall entrance which benefits from useful
storage. Double doors open onto the a double-length reception
room which benefits from attractive flooring, a large bay
window flooding the room with natural light and features a
fireplace providing a delightful focus point. To the rear is the
open plan kitchen/ dining area offering beautiful views to the
garden. The kitchen offers a comprehensive range of high
specification fitted kitchen units and appliances, with a stunning peninsula unit topped with polished granite worktop.

From the hall entrance, stairs lead downstairs where a spacious separate bedroom/TV room is located to the rear of the property. Two sets of doors offer access to a stunning terrace and communal gardens beyond. Completing the accommodation on this floor is a separate WC
and laundry facilities and to the front is the large garage.

On the first floor are three bedrooms. The principal
bedroom comprises an en suite, built-in wardrobes and delightful views towards the gardens. There are two further bedrooms and a modern family bathroom.

Externally to the front, the property offers off-street
parking. To the rear the house benefits from a south-facing
sunny terrace, perfect for outdoor dining, with gates
opening to the large communal garden covering approximately
4.5 acres, with numerous mature trees, shrubs and plants.

Square Footage: 1760 sq ft

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Our sales office and show homes are open for viewings

This beautifully-converted period home features contemporary fixtures and fittings of the highest quality so you'll be able to move in and relax, without the need to make changes - and with a spacious, high-ceilinged drawing room, you won't need to downsize your furniture. Expanses of glazing allow natural daylight to flood into the energy-efficient interiors - and the airy, orangery-style kitchen/dining room will certainly impress friends and family. Private terraces opening off both the drawing room and dining area so you'll be able to choose to sit in the sun or shade at any time of day. The setting, within this historic estate, is superb: You'll have three acres of landscaped gardens and the delightful Ham Common to explore on your daily walks.

If you're finding looking after your older family house and large garden is costly and time-consuming, you will love living in a Beechcroft home that's energy-efficient and easy to maintain. With an Estate Manager to take care of private gardens and the beautifully-landscaped communal gardens you'll be able to sit back, relax and enjoy the outlook.

The fully-maintained communal walled gardens feature sweeping lawns, informal and formal planting, a kitchen garden, fruit trees and mature trees, including a 300-year old Mulberry.

Ham Lands has an abundance of green space for locals and visitors to enjoy, communal riverside meadows which has become a nature reserve, Ham Common has 120 acres of grassland and woodland and offers a sense of rural tranquility. Strawberry Hill House in Twickenham is a Gothic-style castle with fairy-tale turrets set in beautiful gardens.

A good selection of village shops supply all the daily provisions you'll need - along with artisan breads, cakes, pastries, cooked meats, cheeses, fresh fruit and vegetables, fine wines and hand-made chocolates.

There's a stunning parkland course at Richmond Golf Club, less than one mile and just minutes away from Orford Place, adjoining Richmond Park and Ham Common along with a club house.

A home at Orford Place means having everything you need almost 'on the doorstep'. If you choose to travel further afield both Richmond and Kingston-Upon-Thames are just a couple of miles away and Twickenham is just over three miles away.

From Richmond, there are underground and overground rail lines which mean you can be enjoying the 'bright lights' of London in around 19 minutes - and the A3 at Kingston means an easy journey south to Guildford and towards the South Coast.

N.B. The images are of a show home at Orford Place, Ham and are for indicative purposes only.

Beechcroft Customer: “We have been able to keep ourselves occupied by growing vegetables in the raised beds provided for residents’ use. We cultivate all kinds of vegetables including beans, peas, courgettes and rocket. We have been even more spoilt because we have the use of three Victorian greenhouses where we grow tomatoes, peppers and aubergines. There’s a lot of collective gardening experience in this retirement community, as well as plenty of interest and enthusiasm. The grounds at Orford Place are equally beautiful with flowerbeds and an orchard and there are lovely walks on Ham Common.”

detailedDescription:
This stunning Victorian apartment is presented in impeccable condition having been fully refurbished and extended over the years. The property has a particularly high-specification with high-end fixtures and fittings incorporated into a modern design, all within an attractive Victorian façade. The property comprises; a stair-free, ground-floor private entrance, a separate front reception-room with bay-window and bespoke alcove storage, two double-bedrooms and two bathrooms including an ensuite shower and a luxurious bathroom with separate bath and shower. To the rear of the property is a stunning open-plan kitchen/dining room with high-spec kitchen with a large island. Large sliding glass doors lead to a private walled garden which has been fully-landscaped to include a patio with seating area and raised borders with outdoor lighting, perfect for alfresco dining and BBQ’s. Further benefits include a cellar and excellent built-in storage throughout the apartment.

Located on a quiet cul-de-sac just moments from Richmond high-street, this property is superbly located for the town centre, Richmond Hill and Richmond station. With the world famous Richmond Park, Richmond Green and the River Thames, Richmond balances city and country living thanks to its green spaces and easy London Transport links.

From Halford Road you have all the amenities of Richmond town centre on your doorstep. Richmond has a wide range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose. Richmond’s theatres and cinemas are all close by, as are a large selection of restaurants, cafes and pubs.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a wonderful four bedroom end of terrace family home that has been largely extended into the loft and at the rear. Situated on a popular residential road with views over Hatherop Park, this charming property is within a short walk of Hampton Village and in easy reach of the many local amenities that TW12 has to offer. The house has been finished to a high standard throughout and comes with many great features and bespoke fittings.

Internally there is a bright entrance hall with ample storage space and downstairs W.C. Bright living room at the front and extended kitchen family room at the rear. On the first floor there are three bedrooms and a family bathroom, plus floor to ceiling storage cupboards and modern fittings.

On the top floor there is a further bedroom with en suite shower room and more bespoke storage cupboards. Outside there is a large West facing garden that is ideal for entertaining during the summer months, plus 25’ x 10’ block built garage, and brick built studio room at the end of the garden. At the front there is off street parking and secure gates that provide you with side access.

Hatherop road is within walking distance of Carlisle Park, Royal Bushy Park and Hampton open air swimming pool. There is also a variety of local boutique shops, independent cafes and restaurants close to hand, plus a Waitrose and Sainsburys supermarket. Hampton station has a regular train service into London Waterloo and there are also good bus links into Richmond and Kingston town centres. There is also easy access onto the M25 and M3 motorways.

Schools are popular within Hampton and this property is within walking distance of some of the area’s finest education facilities, including Hampton junior and infants, Hampton School for boys and Lady Eleanor Hollies.

title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Mulberry Court is a new development of 34 elegant apartments for independent retirement living, set in beautiful landscaped gardens, which offers buyers the opportunity to downsize to their dream lifestyle. This light and airy two-bedroom, ground floor apartment benefits from a private patio which extends the living space and offers views of the stunning shared gardens. This newly built property is designed for comfort and convenience, arranged over one floor, with generous width doors and corridors. The interior is classic contemporary in style, with engineered oak floors, a fireplace with feature stone surround in the living area and high quality fitted carpet to the bedroom. Through the entrance hall, separate kitchen, dining and living space, the layout has been carefully thought through for flexible living. The kitchen features fully integrated appliances, composite stone worktops and matching full height splashbacks. There is a separate utility closest off the hallway housing the combination washer/dryer. The master bedroom features an en-suite bathroom with level access shower, and the family bathroom a double ended bath. The development has been finished to a very high standard, with incredible design flair by developer Lifestyle Residences, a family-owned business.

Apartment owners enjoy access to Mulberry Court's stylish shared facilities including a deli café, library area, club room, flexible event space and beauty salon. The stunning communal garden, created by a Chelsea Award-winning design team, offers areas for quiet relaxation as well as for socialising and outdoor dining. Owners benefit from the convenience and security of an on-site concierge, and can tailor a range of services from cleaning and housekeeping to support with additional care needs. Every apartment is equipped with video entry phone to the main entrance, and a Tunstall call system linked to the concierge and a 24-hour call centre. The development features private underground parking, accessible by lift, and charging points for electric vehicles.

Mulberry Court is located a stone's throw from the banks of the River Thames, in the heart of Hampton Wick. There is a range of local shops, restaurants and amenities including the Post Office on the doorstep. In addition to the local amenities on offer in Hampton Wick, Kingston Town Centre is only 0.4 miles away and benefits from a wide array of popular high street brands. During the summer months Kingston riverside really comes alive with regular boat trips up and down river to Hampton court, Richmond and beyond. Hampton Wick station is less than a 0.2 mile walk from the development, with six trains an hour offering an easy journey into central London, Richmond, Wimbledon, Clapham Junction and beyond. There are excellent bus connections to the local area including Kew Gardens, Teddington and Twickenham all within a 20 minute ride.

Hampton Wick is blessed with glorious green spaces, including Bushy Park and Home Park, which together with the Thames Path, offer endless options for walking and cycling, in addition to the range of local sports clubs for tennis, golf, swimming and bowls. For culture fans, there are world famous historic sites including Hampton Court Palace nearby, as well as a thriving theatre scene, live music, foodie and horticultural events.

Notice
Please note we have not tested any apparatus, fixtures, fittings, or services. Interested parties must undertake their own investigation into the working order of these items. All measurements are approximate and photographs provided for guidance only.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This sophisticated and luxurious penthouse apartment is situated in the original main building of the Normansfield Court development with its many beautiful and original features. In excess of 2100sq ft, this unique duplex apartment is set over three floors and offers complete privacy as well as stunning views over the beautifully manicured grounds of Normansfield Park and the surrounding area. It is offered with no onward chain.

One enters the apartment directly from the key coded lift which provides secure and private access into the main living space. This vast room has triple aspect windows, a solid oak floor, high ceilings and plenty of living and dining space and leads onto a modern kitchen with island. Off this floor there is a double bedroom and shower room together with access to a separate internal staircase which provides additional utility / storage space. Open plan stairs up from the living room lead to the master bedroom suite. This stunning 23ft long room with pretty arched windows and plenty of fitted storage comes with a large four piece en suite bathroom. From the living room, open plan stairs also lead down to a large hallway space which provides alternate access to the apartment and a further large double bedroom and en suite with storage. This hallway has been fully fitted out as a study for home working.

Outside there is access to the beautiful communal gardens of Normansfield Court, the residents gym, bike store and also the off street residents parking area which includes two owned and dedicated parking spaces.

The property is a short walk to Hampton Wick station with its direct link to Waterloo and is served by bus routes directly opposite the apartment to local amenities such as Kingston, Heathrow and Twickenham. Bushy Park, Kingston shopping centre and Riverside are all close by with a wide variety of shops, restaurants and bars as are the boutique shops and restaurants of Teddington High street

The property, which is of highly attractive appearance, features a double storey turreted bay and offers beautifully proportioned family accommodation over three floors (plus cellar). Benefiting from elegant principal rooms, a generous receiving hall and first floor landing whilst the property has also retained an abundance of fine original detail including fireplaces, wall panelling and high corniced ceilings. title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning home in an incredible setting on Ham Common.

Location

Whilst within just 2 miles from Richmond (with its sophisticated array of shops, restaurants and boutiques) the house is enviably situated by picturesque Ham Common - providing a truly semi-rural feel. Furthermore it is within just a few hundred metres of Richmond Park (with its 2300 deer inhabited acres) and a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames. Richmond train station offers a direct and rapid service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Underground Tube and overland line to Stratford, via North London.

There is a good selection of local shops at Ham Parade, also within just a few hundred metres. Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are amongst the best in the country.

Description

This architecturally beautiful Victorian family home has lovely open aspects to both front and rear, and sits within the wonderful Ham Common Conservation area. It is not Grade listed but locally listed as a building of 'Townscape merit'.

It has been tastefully and thoughtfully renovated, seamlessly blending its period charm and integrity with a contemporary edge. The superbly appointed kitchen family room provides a wonderful light and airy space that will doubtless be the social hub of the house, and features a fabulous polished concrete floor. The four well-proportioned bedrooms are served by two bathrooms, in addition to a cloakroom on the ground floor.

Towards the front of the house there is a super living room that has been cleverly designed to incorporate a library / study area.

The accommodation is practically configured, lending the house as well to every day family life as it does to more formal entertaining.

To the rear of the house there is a stunning garden that is well established and south west facing, thus retaining the late afternoon and early evening sunshine.

detailedDescription:

detailedDescription:
Brunswick House is a wonderful modern built five bedroom family home laid out over three floors with spacious rooms and high ceilings. The property is located on the Avenue with off street parking and easy access to Hampton Village and Hampton Hill High street.

Internally there is a charming entrance hall, large living room with doors opening onto the garden, dining room and 15’x 14’ kitchen breakfast room. On the first floor there are three bedrooms and two bathrooms, one with walk in wardrobe area.

On the second floor there are two further bedrooms, one with a separate study area and two bathrooms. There is fitted wardrobes in many of the bedrooms and also the option to add an extra bedroom should it be required. Outside there is a beautiful landscaped West facing garden at the rear with patio area making it ideal for entertaining during the summer months. There is also two large wooden built sheds at the rear of the garden that are perfect for extra storage. There is also off street parking for two cars at the front of the property.

The Avenue is an extremely popular tree lined road that offers a nice blend of old and new properties. It is ideal for families and is within walking distance of Carlisle Park, Royal Bushy Park and Hampton open air swimming pool. There are also a good variety of local boutique shops, independent cafes and restaurants close to hand, and a Waitrose supermarket.

Hampton station has a regular train service into London Waterloo and there are also good bus links into Richmond and Kingston town centres. There is also easy access onto the M25 and M3 motorways. Schools are popular within Hampton and this property is within walking distance of some of the area’s finest education facilities, including Hampton School for boys and Lady Eleanor Holles.

A double fronted three bedroom semi-detached house with the added benefit of a side extension which provides separate accommodation consisting of its own living room, bedroom and shower room. The house is located in a small cul-de-sac just off Hospital Bridge Road close to Whitton high street, shops and station.

For Sale:

A sizeable family home with adaptable accommodation. In addition to the side annexe the main house consists of the original three bedrooms, bathroom and separate WC upstairs, served by a good size through lounge/diner and kitchen to the ground floor. Whilst the property would benefit from some updating it has been well cared for over the years and offers the incoming purchaser a great opportunity to acquire a good size home with a wide plot and decent size garden.
Outside: To the front there is off street parking for one car and a neat fore garden. The side access leads to the rear and the garden extends to approx 50ft, is well enclosed and mainly laid to lawn with mature trees and bushes supplying a good deal of privacy.

Location:

Crane Park Road is a little known and tucked away cul-de-sac of similar age homes located not far from Whitton high street, shops and station. Crane Park Nature reserve is just a short walk away and Twickenham town is a short drive or an easy cycle away.

The smart, modern kitchen is accessed via double doors from the dining area and is extremely well fitted.

Further accommodation on the ground floor includes a cloakroom/WC and two double bedrooms (one with en suite), whilst on the first floor, there are two double bedrooms (one with en suite), a single bedroom and a family bathroom.

The interior is complemented by a lovely garden which has a small lawned area along with a superb decking area, ideal for entertaining. There is a garage suitable for a car with a parking space located in front and a separate utility room with space for a washing machine, plenty of storage cupboards and a sink.

Popular schools in the area include Meadlands, Grey Court, The Kingston Academy, Tiffin Girls and The German School.

Huge care and thought have been employed in the redecoration and refitting of this home and the result is a credit to our clients. You should be making an appointment immediately to view!

detailedDescription:
Summary

Cash buyers only. Situated on East Twickenham high street, this one bedroom first floor conversion apartment is ideally located between both St Margarets and Richmond mainline stations.

The apartment has a fantastically bright open plan living room with a large kitchen area, a modest double bedroom and further separate bathroom.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Pattinson Auction are working in Partnership with the marketing agent on this online auction sale and are referred to below as 'The Auctioneer'.

Please be aware that any enquiry, bid or viewing of the subject property will require your details being shared between both the marketing agent and The Auctioneer in order that all matters can be dealt with effectively.

This auction lot is being sold either under conditional (Modern) or unconditional (Traditional) auction terms and overseen by the auctioneer in partnership with the marketing agent.

The property is available to be viewed strictly by appointment only via the Marketing Agent or The Auctioneer. Bids can be made via The Auctioneers or the Marketing Agents website.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

Your details may be shared with additional service providers via the marketing agent and/or The Auctioneer.

A Legal Pack associated with this particular property is available to view upon request and contains details relevant to the legal documentation enabling all interested parties to make an informed decision prior to bidding. The Legal Pack will also outline the buyers' obligations and sellers' commitments. It is strongly advised that you seek the counsel of a solicitor prior to proceeding with any property and/or Land Title purchase.

In order to submit a bid upon any property being marketed by The Auctioneer, all bidders/buyers will be required to adhere to a verification of identity process in accordance with Anti Money Laundering procedures.

Auctioneers Additional Comments

In order to secure the property and ensure commitment from the seller, upon agreement of sale, the successful bidder will be expected to pay a non-refundable deposit and or reservation fee of up to 6% inc VAT (subject to a minimum of between 2,400 and 6,000 inc VAT dependant on geographical location and contract type) Full terms and conditions are available on The Auctioneers website.

The Reservation Fee is in addition to the agreed purchase price and consideration should be made by the purchaser in relation to any Stamp Duty Land Tax liability associated with overall purchase costs. The Auctioneer may believe it necessary or beneficial to the customer to pass your details to third party service suppliers, from which a referral fee may be obtained. There is no requirement or obligation to use these recommended suppliers or services.

The apartment is accessed via its own staircase and private entrance and briefly comprises: Entrance hall, impressive reception room boasting high ceilings, original sash windows, shutters and excellent views over the Green. There is a separate modern fitted kitchen, a principal bedroom with en suite shower room and built-in wardrobes, a double bedroom, a third single bedroom/study and a well-appointed family bathroom.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Portland Terrace is positioned within the heart of Richmond and overlooking Richmond Green; once a jousting ground to Henry vii's former Tudor Palace. Today, it is a quintessential and picturesque village green that is home to more gentle pursuits, such as Sunday afternoon cricket.

The property is conveniently located for access to an excellent array of shops, boutiques and restaurants, whilst managing to retain a charming village atmosphere.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include Deer Park School, The Vineyard School, Orleans Primary School, Orleans Park School and Broomfield House School.

address: Portland Terrace, The Green, Richmond TW9
detailedDescription:
This stunning two bedroom apartment is situated on the raised ground floor of a stucco-fronted Grade II listed building, overlooking the historic and desirable Richmond Green.

The apartment has sole use of the original grand double entrance of the house. Upon entering the property, there is an original stained glass window door and a generous hallway featuring a beautiful original staircase.

At the front, there is a large reception room boasting hardwood floors, a feature fireplace, original shutters and excellent views over Richmond Green. Original double doors provide access to a modern fitted kitchen/breakfast room.

At the rear of the property there is a principal bedroom with en-suite shower room and walk-in wardrobe, a further bedroom with built-in wardrobes and a family bathroom.

There is a sizeable, private and walled rear garden which provides the perfect area to entertain family and friends in the warmer spring/summer months. There is potential to build a garden studio at the rear of the walled garden, subject to the usual planning permissions.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Portland Terrace is positioned within the heart of Richmond and overlooking Richmond Green; once a jousting ground to Henry vii's former Tudor Palace Today, it is a quintessential and picturesque village green that is home to more gentle pursuits, such as Sunday afternoon cricket.

The property is conveniently located for access to an excellent array of shops, boutiques and restaurants, whilst managing to retain a charming village atmosphere.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include Deer Park School, The Vineyard School, Orleans Primary School, Orleans Park School and Broomfield House School.

Transport links to Central London are fast and excellent with frequent trains via both overground and London Underground's District Line. The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is approximately 5.8 miles away and can be reached easily by road, train or bus.

Location

Enmore Gardens is situated in one of the most desirable areas in East Sheen, partly due to its close proximity to Richmond Park. The excellent facilities offered by East Sheen are approximately 0.6 miles away where one can find a variety of shops, boutiques and restaurants; the historic town of Richmond is approximately 1.5 miles away.

For transport, Mortlake railway station is approximately 0.8 miles away providing a frequent service to Waterloo and Clapham Junction.

There are many fantastic schools in the general vicinity including Sheen Mount Primary School, St Paul's, Tower House, Ibstock Place School, The German and Swedish Schools, East Sheen Primary School and Thomson House School.

The area also boasts numerous leisure and sporting facilities including The Roehampton Club, Sheen Tennis and Squash Club and a host of golf courses, including The Royal Mid Surrey Golf Club and Richmond Golf Club. The 2,300 acres of Richmond Park also allow many pursuits such as walking, running and riding.

The ground floor comprises a wide entrance hallway, a formal lounge and a spacious kitchen family room overlooking the landscaped garden. There is also a downstairs cloakroom, utility room and a room off the family room which could be used for dining or as a study.

On the first floor is a bedroom suite with an en suite shower room. There are three further bedrooms and a family bathroom.

On the second floor is a sizeable double bedroom with an en suite bathroom and a separate room which could serve as a dressing room.

detailedDescription:
This high-end penthouse oozes luxury with over 1,800 Sq. Ft of living space, all situated upon the top floor of Eminence House. The kitchen has a sleek & stylish design, fit to purpose with a breakfast bar seating 4+ guests as well as integrated appliances including a coffee machine & three ovens maximising space and for convenience.

Further into the penthouse is a master suite with far-reaching walls, soft to touch carpet and its very own ultra modern En-Suite. Finished to the highest standard this shower suite has two washbasins, a walk-in shower and WC.

Accompanied by the master bedroom are three further exceptional bedrooms, all providing ample living space, one of which benefits from having a built-in wardrobe. There is also a family bathroom that holds both a bathtub and a walk-in shower room.

The building itself allows for access to allocated parking secured underground and lift access. Additional benefits for the penthouse include a home automated system as well as air conditioning.

The area itself is extremely sought after, being between Richmond and North Sheen. Transport options consist of Richmond Station (Overground, Underground & South Western Railway) just a 15-minute walk away, North Sheen (0.5 miles) & Kew Garden (Overground, 0.9 Miles). All of which have links into London Waterloo via Putney and Clapham Junction.

Kew Gardens is only a matter of moments from the property, providing fantastic botanical gardens ideal for a family day out. Richmond itself has a number of shops and amenities, cinemas, shopping centres and other essential stores.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Built in the Dutch style in 1850-1852 and originally known as Park Villas West, this landmark row of houses is well known in Richmond for its uniformed design that has been beautifully preserved.
A key feature of these houses and somewhat unique is the set-back position from the road behind gated entrances with parking for several vehicles. Entering the property the scale of the house and its majestic presence is obvious.

Very rarely available and offered exclusively through Hamptons, this outstanding family home is arranged naturally over four floors with the accommodation totalling over 3600sq.ft. And providing five very good sized bedrooms plus a study or sixth bedroom if preferred. As you enter the house you arrive at the impressive reception hall that continues to the vast living space that spans the entire length of the house on the upper ground floor; large windows offer views over the garden and to the front of the property. The lower floor provides abundant family living space with a very sociable kitchen and dining area with reclaimed York Stone flooring with underfloor heating. The kitchen features an aga and elegant bespoke ‘Martin Moore’ fittings. There is also a separate living room which is an ideal family/TV room or potentially a children’s playroom.

The upper floors provide five very well proportioned double bedrooms with four of these being very large doubles. The principal bedroom has en-suite facilities and fitted wardrobes and/or cupboards are installed in all bedrooms.

The gorgeous garden has a westerly aspect and features a lower terrace as well as the lawned main garden, that is reached from the terrace, that is beautifully manicured with established shrubs, trees and well stocked flower beds.

Situation
Queens Road is a very established road, lined with mature trees, that runs roughly north-south between Sheen Road and the very top of Richmond Hill by the junction with the landmark former Royal Star and Garter.

Access to Richmond Park, with its 2500 acres of deer-inhabited national nature reserve parkland is available via the pedestrian-only gate at Cambrian Road, just 250m from the house, bringing the sense of the countryside and myriad leisure pursuits within a couple of minutes’ walk.

Richmond Hill Village is close by and reached within a pleasant walk where you can find popular pubs, cafes and a selection of shops. Terrace Gardens is a little further along Friars Stile Road with the iconic views towards the River Thames, Petersham Meadows and out to the Surrey Hills that were immortalised by the artist J.M W. Turner.

Central Richmond is 0.8 mile (1.2km) and the Royal Botanical Gardens at Kew are 1.5 miles (2.4km) via the most direct walking route to Kew’s Lion Gate.

Schools in the area cater for all ages and there is a mixture of very good state and independent choices including Kings House, The Old Vicarage, The Vineyard School, Marshgate Primary School, Kew College and Sheen Mount Primary to name a few. International schools close by include The German School London in Petersham, The Swedish School in Barnes and the International School London (isl) in Ealing.

address: Ormond House, Ormond Road, Richmond TW10
detailedDescription:
This beautifully light and well proportioned three bedroom apartment is situated in Ormond House, an attractive Grade II listed Georgian building dating back to 1717.

Spanning over 1000 sqft the property is situated on the first floor of this handsome period conversion and briefly comprises; entrance hall, a spacious south-facing reception room boasting views over the communal gardens, a separate kitchen, two generous double bedrooms, a third single bedroom, a family bathroom and separate WC.

The property further benefits from being offered to the market with a share of freehold and access to beautifully manicured communal gardens.

The property is in a prime Richmond location and is only moments from the area's vibrant activity and attractive riverside amenities.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include The Vineyard School, Deer Park School, Marshgate Primary School, Orleans Primary School, Orleans Park School, Holy Trinity Church of England Primary School and Windham Nursery School.

The area is abundant with a range of attractions and leisure opportunities for families to enjoy. Richmond Park is one of London's eight Royal Parks and covers 2,500 acres. Nearby Richmond Green has been described as "one of the most beautiful urban greens surviving anywhere in England." The world-leading Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew is a unesco World Heritage site and is home to over 50,000 living plants. The property is only a short distance from The River Thames which also makes this a very special place to live.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is only 6.8 miles away.

*All times and distances are approximate.

address: Kingston Hill, Kingston Upon Thames, Surrey KT2
detailedDescription:
An historic six bedroom family house with off street parking and a double garage with superb views of Richmond Park to the rear.

Location

Fairlight is located on Kingston Hill and around 480 metres from Richmond Park, being one of London's Royal Parks, offering 2368 acres of open space perfect for walks, riding and cycling.

The area also offers a wide range of recreational activities including boating on the River Thames, a number of golf courses between Coombe, Wimbledon and Richmond, tennis, squash and fitness at the Roehampton Club and David Lloyd Leisure Centre.

There are many good restaurants, shopping, cinemas and theatres in Wimbledon, Kingston and Richmond. There are many popular schools in both the private and public sector including Rokeby for boys, Coombe Hill Girls School, Wimbledon High, Holy Cross for girls, Kings College School for boys and Marymount International School.

Source of distances Google Pedometer
All measurements are approximate.

Description

One of the oldest properties on Kingston Hill with parts of the property dating back to Charles II with additions made in the early/mid19th century.

The house offers a wealth of period features with extensive oak panelling, intricate cornicing, open fireplaces, leaded and stain glass windows, a Minstrel gallery and three metre ceiling heights in the reception rooms.

The private, mature back gardens lead down to the wall of Richmond Park with spectacular views of the Park from all the rear rooms of the house.

The property is accessed from Kingston Hill, a solid oak front door opens to an entrance lobby with a pitched ceiling and a decorative skylight. The lobby leads to an impressive Minstrel galleried entrance hall with wood flooring and exposed beams to a pitched ceiling. There are two original wood panelled walls and an open brick fireplace with a stone hearth and wood burner. Bi folding doors open to a family room to the front with a dual aspect and features wood panelled walls. French windows allow direct access to the gardens. A wood panelled study with a double aspect to the front and the side has built in cupboards and shelving with an attractive fireplace. The drawing room is located to the rear and features intricate ceiling plasterwork, floor to ceiling windows and French windows opening to the rear garden. A paved terrace runs across the width of the drawing room and overlooks a mature, private 131' garden largely laid to lawn with a timber Gazebo. Alongside the drawing room is a formal dining room with half wood painted panelled walls, decorative cornicing, a marble fireplace and a fitted recessed glass cabinet. There is also a guest cloakroom/shower room.

A wonderful kitchen/breakfast room offers an extensive range of painted units with open shelving, solid wood worktops, fully integrated appliances and a free standing American style fridge. The fully fitted utility area is conveniently located off the kitchen.

Upstairs, the principal bedroom offers views to the rear and the side, ornate cornicing, built in wardrobes and shelving complete with an en suite bathroom with a separate glass shower and heated towel rail. There are a further five double bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes/cupboards and a large family bathroom.

Square Footage: 4080 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented three bedroom house in East Twickenham with a private garage.

Location

The house is superbly situated on this quiet cul-de-sac, within the heart of East Twickenham and just a few hundred meters from a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames and the beautiful open acres of Marble Hill Park - providing ideal retreats from the hubbub of daily life.

St Margarets village offers a quaint yet comprehensive array of cafes, boutiques, shops, bars and restaurants. It also has a train station providing a direct service into London Waterloo. The internationally acclaimed and sophisticated town of Richmond is within just one mile.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Access onto the A316 can be found within approximately half a mile, leading to the M3, M25 and thereby allowing easy access to Gatwick and Heathrow airports.

Description

A beautifully refurbished three bedroom house situated in a quiet cul-de-sac in the heart of East Twickenham.

On the ground floor you are welcomed by a spacious reception room with a modern fireplace. This leads onto a large open plan kitchen with plenty of space for a dining table. The kitchen has been tastefully renovated and is fully fitted with modern appliances. Bi-fold doors open onto an immaculate and low maintenance garden. A separate utility room and cloakroom complete the ground floor.

The first floor is comprised of two well-proportioned double bedrooms and a large family bathroom. The second floor offers a beautiful principal bedroom with plenty of built in storage and an en-suite bathroom.

The house further benefits from a secure garage.

Upstairs there are three bedrooms, two with fitted wardrobes and a family bathroom. The property also benefits from off street parking for two cars, an integral garage and is being sold with vacant possession.

There is also potential to extend into the loft and over the garage, subject to planning permission.

Heatham Park backs on to Craneford Playing Fields and is less than half a mile to Twickenham Station and High street with plenty of shops, pubs and restaurants. Orleans Park and St Mary's School are less than a mile away.

detailedDescription:
An exceptional architecturally designed, immaculately presented, wonderfully light new detached house with off street parking.

Location

The house is located in the heart of sought-after Little Chelsea, off White Hart Lane and close to the River Thames. Little Chelsea has an eclectic range of shops, restaurants and pubs as well as a Sainsbury's Local. Barnes village, just a few minutes' walk away, also boasts a large selection of pubs, shops and restaurants, as well as Barnes Green and duck pond and the Olympic Cinema.

For the commuter, Barnes Bridge station is nearby and provides a frequent service into Waterloo. There is also a regular bus service to Hammersmith, giving access to the underground and bus networks.

The schools in the area include - St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils - St Paul's Juniors, St Osmunds' (rc) and Barnes Primary School.

Description

An exceptional architecturally designed new home, immaculately presented and wonderfully light. This detached three bedroom house is in the ever popular Little Chelsea area of Barnes. The property is accessed via a pedestrian gate on Thorne Passage which leads into the enclosed west facing garden with a cobbled path leading to the front door. Doors radiate from the spacious entrance hall giving access to the bedrooms and bathroom. The principal bedroom has an abundance of natural light with floor to ceiling windows, fitted wardrobes and shelving. A sliding door leads to the en suite shower room with natural light flooding through the skylight. There are two further bedrooms both with floor to ceiling windows, one with built in wardrobes and the other with a range of shelving. The bathroom is very well appointed with tiled floor, part tiled walls and high specification fittings.

The kitchen reception room is open plan and features two sets of bi-folding doors which both lead out to decked areas one of which has stairs to the garden. There are a range of wall and floor mounted units with solid preparation surfaces and an array of white goods. From the kitchen a door leads to the utility room with space and plumbing for a washing machine and a further door to the W.C.

The garden is arranged in two sections both of which are laid to lawn. There is also a bicycle storage unit and private parking.

Square Footage: 1500 sq ft

address: Turner House, 26 Clevedon Road, Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
This unique apartment, set within the prestigious Richmond Bridge Estate, is the brainchild of the current owners who combined two adjoining units to form probably the largest single level apartment within the development.

Providing in excess of 2400 square foot of accommodation, this stunning property has a beautifully light feeling throughout, enhanced by its elevated position and the open plan nature of the receiving hall, reception room and dining room. These grand rooms have high ceilings and no less than three sets of west facing French windows, two of which open to a private balcony. There is a striking white kitchen with clean lines and a separate utility room.

Four of the five bedrooms (and three bathrooms) are cleverly situated along a corridor away from the main living and entertaining spaces. The principal bedroom, with en suite has access to one of the two private balconies. The fifth bedroom (with its own bathroom) is located in such a way that it would be ideal for a nanny/au pair or a home office. All bedrooms have fitted wardrobes.

In addition, this property has the advantage of two secure parking spaces in the underground car park and is offered for sale with no onward chain.

The Richmond Bridge Estate is situated on the banks of the River Thames, close to Richmond Bridge on Clevedon Road. Providing 24hr security and concierge service, the development is set within well-tended communal gardens with grand open spaces, including a fountain. There are also two gym facilities for residents, allocated parking, bike storage and visitor parking.

It is ideally situated within close proximity to the good selection of local shops and cafes in East Twickenham and a 5 minute walk to Richmond Bridge, across which can be found an extensive selection of facilities, including a mainline train service to London Waterloo and the District Line Underground service, two theatres and two cinemas.

address: Paradise Road, Richmond, Surrey, UK TW9
detailedDescription:
An elegant and historically significant Grade II listed Georgian Villa positioned in the heart of Richmond and once residence of the author Virginia Woolf.
Originally built in circa 1750, this now exceptional four storey family home, has been painstakingly restored carefully blending the beautiful Georgian architecture with the contemporary features required for modern living. There are a whole host of period features; high ceilings and large windows giving the house masses of natural light. The house boasts over 3,600 square feet of internal space. Houses of this age and grandeur and rare in Richmond therefore an internal inspection is highly recommended

An exquisite, Grade II listed, Manor House currently undergoing extensive restoration.

Originally dating back to the 14th Century, and rebuilt in the early 1700’s, the property is naturally arranged over four floors, to include ample off street gravel parking and an extensive lawned garden. It offers fine Georgian detail to include pine floorboards, panelled walls, fireplaces and box window shutters.

Steps leading up to a sumptuous receiving hall which in turn leads to a drawing room, dining room and kitchen. The first floor offers a master bedroom suite, a second larger than average bedroom, a small double bedroom, an office and a separate w/c. There are three further double bedrooms to the second floor, a family bathroom and a store room. The lower ground floor is divided into three sections providing ample cellarage for storage.

Moments from the River Thames and within close proximity of Kew Gardens Village and the flora and fauna of the Royal Botanical Gardens.

detailedDescription:
A spectacular three bedroom apartment centrally located in the Grade II Listed, Star and Garter House, affording amongst the most impressive views of the historic vista from Richmond Hill.

Majestically situated on Richmond Hill, adjacent to the Richmond Gate entrance of Richmond Park, The Star & Garter provides an unparalleled blend of luxury, service and facilities. Residents enjoy use of the swimming pool, jacuzzi, gym, treatment rooms, movie screening room and 20,000 sq. Ft of landscaped, communal gardens.
There is also a 24 hour concierge and town car service providing private and direct access to Richmond town centre.
Many striking original architectural features of this commanding building have been stylishly and sympathetically retained as evidenced in the marbled magnificence of the grand entrance.
This exquisite apartment is gloriously positioned with feature full-height windows to the principal rooms and enjoys high-specification throughout with leading technologies deployed for the heating, cooling, security, lighting and audio-visual systems.
In all, and extending to c 1500 sq. Ft of accommodation, the property provides three bedrooms, three bathrooms (two en suite) and dual aspect reception room open plan to kitchen.
There is also allocated underground parking for two cars parked in tandem and the right to a shared use with the neighbouring apartment of a private terrace directly overlooking Richmond Gate. EPC rating D

A charming loft converted Edwardian home near the 'Outstanding' Thomson House Primary School and Mortlake Station. Comprising a wide hallway with cloakroom and storage, leading to a modern kitchen and spacious reception room with dining area to the rear. The contemporary kitchen boasts generous fitted cabinets and modern appliances whilst the reception room has a stunning bay window overlooking a lovely, landscaped and private garden. The ground floor also benefits from underfloor heating.

The first floor comprises three bedrooms, two with fitted cupboards and large windows offering plenty of natural light and a beautiful family bathroom. On the second floor is the generous main bedroom and ensuite bathroom, with plenty of storage space and a Juliet balcony. There is ample storage in the eaves which is easily accessible.

The house further benefits from a garage and off-street parking. Sherwood Close boasts with well-manicured communal grounds and is located just off of Lower Common South, nestled close to the green open spaces of Putney Lower Common.

Transport links are close by at Barnes Station with regular trains into London Waterloo and the number 22 bus route towards Fulham, Chelsea and the West End.

address: Woodman Mews, Kew Riverside, Kew TW9
detailedDescription:
Impressive modern family home within the well-known Kew Riverside development; built around 15 years ago by St. James - part of the Berkeley Homes group.

Accommodation is arranged over four spacious and well-laid-out floors; each enjoying excellent natural light and modern design features all around. The configuration of the house is immensely practical and versatile with the option to have five or six bedrooms, depending on needs, and with plenty of space for the whole family to spread out. There are also four bath/shower rooms plus a guest cloakroom on the ground floor.

Residents of Kew Riverside can enjoy the use of a private residents-only fitness suite and pool, plus the benefit of on-site concierge service and security.

Situation
Set in 26 acres, Kew Riverside is a prestigious riverside development of modern apartments and houses. Located on the south bank of the River Thames it is situated between Kew Bridge & Chiswick Bridge and close to the world famous Royal Botanical Gardens at Kew.

Kew Village offers a selection of independent shops and eateries, set within an attractive village atmosphere, whilst Kew Retail Park has various larger retail options including a major M&S with foodhall. Kew Gardens station provides District Line Underground and London Overground services to central London whilst Kew Bridge station offers regular services directly into London Waterloo.

The location is also very convenient for access to Heathrow Airport plus major roads including the M4, M3, M24, A316, A4 and A205.

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This impressive double fronted detached house has been beautifully refurbished and remodelled to a high specification throughout and offers an elegant home, retaining many period features with a contemporary living space.

The house is wonderfully private and has fabulous views over the London Wetlands with sheep and highland cattle grazing on the bank at the bottom of the garden.

It is set back from the road behind electronic gates and has a sweeping in and out driveway. The property opens into a spectacular entrance hall creating a sense of light and space. To the front is a bay fronted double reception room with intricate ceiling plasterwork and an attractive period fireplace. Opposite is a formal dining room with a marble fireplace.

To the rear is a stunning open plan kitchen/dining/family room with herringbone parquet flooring offering a wonderful living and entertainment space, spanning the back of the house. The kitchen features striking marble work surfaces, fully integrated appliances, and a large central island unit. Three sets of full height glass doors open onto a large terrace overlooking a 107ft south facing landscaped garden designed with both family living and entertaining in mind complete with a contemporary garden studio, putting green and driving net. There is also a cloakroom on the ground floor.

The lower ground floor comprises two double bedrooms, a shower room, a home office, a self-contained kitchen/dining/family room, utility room and wine cellar. An attractive patio area has been cleverly designed to allow plenty of natural light and creates a central living well.

On the first floor to the front there is a luxurious principal bedroom suite which features a sumptuous marble en suite bathroom with chrome fittings and built in storage. There are a further two double bedroom suites both with bathrooms.

The top floor comprises three additional double bedrooms, one with an en suite shower room and a stylish guest bathroom. There is also excellent eaves storage.

Location:
Situated in one of the most sought after and prestigious locations in Barnes, close the River Thames and access to Central London and Heathrow via the A4 and M4.

Barnes is famous for its Village atmosphere, restaurants, cafes, pond, opens spaces and The Wetland Wildlife Nature Reserve.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's, Lowther and Barnes Primary.

There are two Southern Region overland train stations in the area, Barnes and Barnes Bridge.

Over the River Thames, Hammersmith provides an additional comprehensive range of shopping facilities and access to the District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City and Circle line tube stations.

For the sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated close by, The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

For those who enjoy rowing, there is a club at Dukes Meadow and for the walker and the garden enthusiast the open spaces of Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
A simply stunning house in sought-after 'Little Chelsea' in Barnes. The property was recently renovated to exacting standards and boasts immaculate and stylish interiors throughout, extensive under-floor heating and a Sonos sound system.

On entry, the hallway feels light and welcoming with an impressive Crittal-style window wall overlooking the reception room with a guest cloakroom under the stairs.

The bay-fronted double reception room provides bespoke shelving, plantation shutters and hardwood flooring. The flooring continues through to an exceptional open-plan Bulthaup customized kitchen and dining room. This room is flooded with light via skylights, a glass wall and bi-folding doors to the garden. There is an exposed brick feature wall and an island with a breakfast bar.

The garden is low-maintenance with an artificial lawn, a slate patio and boxed flower beds. The garden studio provides additional accommodation, ideal as an office, and a deep storage cupboard.

The first floor offers an inviting bay-fronted master bedroom with custom-made wardrobes across the length of one wall. The beautiful bathroom includes a double-basin vanity unit, a free-standing bathtub and a walk-in shower. The second bedroom is also on this floor.

Upstairs, the loft space has been impeccably converted to maximise light and space. It encompasses two generous bedrooms, one of which has an elegant en-suite shower room. There is also ample eaves storage on this floor.

Westfields Avenue is nestled amongst the desirable pastel terraces of 'Little Chelsea' and offers proximity to the boutiques and eateries of White Hart Lane and to the 'Ofsted Outstanding' rated Barnes Primary School. Barnes Bridge mainline station and the River Thames are a short walk from the property.

Please note old photos used

Ingram House is located on Park Road, moments from the Hampton Wick gate entrance to Bushy Park as well as providing convenient access to Kingston upon Thames which is within walking distance of approximately 10 minutes. detailedDescription:
A Brand New Two Bedroom Apartment In The Iconic Twickenham Gateway Development

Help to buy available - A brand new two bedroom apartment in the iconic Twickenham Gateway development. This stunning apartment has been finished to an exceptional standard throughout and briefly comprises a large open plan kitchen/living room with a contemporary designed Leicht German kitchen, a principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes and a stylish shower room, second double bedroom and a modern bathroom suite designed by Porcelanosa. Additionally the apartment benefits from an impressive private terrace, engineered timber flooring in the kitchen/living area, secure bicycle storage and smart video entry system.

Twickenham Gateway offers a new way of living, combining spacious, well-designed apartments with the ultimate in convenience to give you more time to enjoy life. detailedDescription:
This six bedroom semi-detached property is situated in an excellent location on the desirable and popular Richmond Hill. The house is within walking distance of some outstanding schools as well as Richmond's notable attractions such as The Green, Richmond Park and The River.

The property is arranged over three floors and offers close to 4,000 sq ft approximately of spacious well appointed accommodation. On arriving at the house there is a generous driveway, providing off street parking for at least two cars and side access.

Once inside the property you are instantly impressed with the generous hallway and the many period features; the front reception room is an excellent example of this with its high ceilings generating an abundance of natural light, ornate cornicing and a beautiful marble fireplace.

Towards the rear of the house there is a fully fitted kitchen with modern appliances and a large dining room which can be open, or closed off, to the kitchen. These two rooms at the rear are connected to a sunny and light conservatory which overlooks the garden. There is a TV room/snug, cloakroom and cellar to complete this floor.

The first floor provides two exceptional suites, one of them an elegant, well-appointed bedroom with a bay window, high ceilings and an en suite bathroom. The second suite is also well-proportioned with fitted wardrobes, en suite bathroom and views over the garden. There is a further bedroom/study, and a utility room.

The top floor of the house has four further bedrooms and a family bathroom, creating an excellent floor for children's bedrooms or visiting guests. It would be easy if the new owners did want to create an additional bathroom on this floor, as there is already plumbing in one of the bedrooms.

The garden to the rear measures close to 80 ft approximately and is mainly laid to lawn. There are a number of mature trees, shrubs and plants that provide good screening and privacy.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Kings Road is located on Richmond Hill within reach of the vibrant and excellent facilities of Richmond Town including the station which offers fast links into Central London via both the underground and overland trains.

Schools in the area include King's House School, Old Vicarage School, Marshgate Primary School and The Vineyard School.

Nearby places of interest include Kew Gardens, the 2,500 acres of royal parkland at Richmond Park, Twickenham Stadium and Ham House.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes) and is well placed for the A316/M3, M4 and M25 giving access to the airports at Heathrow and Gatwick, as well as the south coast and the west country.

(All times and distances are approximate).

A beautifully presented four bedroom semi-detached house with an additional one bedroom self-contained garden studio and off-street parking.

Location

Howsman Road is close to the river and Hammersmith Bridge with Barnes village close by.

The house is within easy walking distance of a selection of excellent local schools and nurseries, such as the Sunshine Nursery, Bright Horizons, The Harrodian, St Pauls, Swedish School and Lowther Primary. Transport links are well catered for with bus routes.

For those who commute there are good bus services to Richmond and Putney as well as Barnes and Barnes Bridge stations which provide a good service into Waterloo. Hammersmith Underground is also nearby.

Description

This attractive four bedroom house, with an additional one bedroom self-contained garden studio, has been refurbished by the current owners creating a contemporary family home across three floors. The house is set back from the road and benefits from off-street parking, with an electric car charging, and useful side access

The house opens into a central hallway. To the front is a generous bay fronted double reception room with a pretty window seat and attractive wood flooring which runs across the ground floor. To the rear is a stunning kitchen/dining/family room with integrated appliances and features a 3 door Aga. Bi-folding doors lead out to a wonderful landscaped 42ft garden designed with entertaining and family living in mind. The garden benefits from a superb self-contained annex which comprises of a kitchenette, bedroom, bathroom and office space.

Upstairs, there are four bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes/cupboards and an upstairs cloakroom. On the top floor, is a useful study with accessible storage under the eaves. The family bathroom/downstairs cloakroom is located on the ground floor.

address: Star And Garter, Richmond Hill, Richmond TW10
detailedDescription:
This spacious and wonderful three bedroom en suite duplex apartment with private terrace has been finished to the highest of standards, creating a residence unparalleled in its luxury, service and facilities.

On entering the property there is a spacious hallway with a cloakroom and storage cupboards. Following on, there is an elegant open plan kitchen/reception room with high ceilings and sash windows which offer an abundance of natural light and create a feeling of space. The kitchen is fitted with state of the art Chrome duo Grohe taps and Miele appliances. A double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and en suite shower room complete the ground floor.

On the first floor the principal bedroom benefits from an adjoining dressing room with mirrored fitted wardrobes, and an en suite bathroom with double vanity unit. A final third bedroom with en suite shower room follows.

The apartment offers superior living, with access to underfloor heating, a multi room audio system and air conditioning supplied.

The historic and Grade II listed Star and Garter House dates from 1924, and is located adjacent to Richmond Park, London's largest park extending to approximately 2,500 acres. The development also enjoys breathtaking views overlooking the Thames; the only listed view in England protected by an act of Parliament.

The Star and Garter benefits from a 24 hour concierge, and dramatic communal areas with majestic communal gardens and terracing. Further notable features include a gym and swimming pool, whirlpool/jacuzzi, spa room, screening room and underground car parking. Residents will also benefit from a 'town car' with a service into Richmond.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Richmond offers many shops, cafes, restaurants and bars, the renowned Richmond Theatre, excellent leisure opportunities and easy access to central London via both overland and underground train services, Heathrow airport and beyond.

Richmond Park is one of London's eight Royal Parks and is only a stone's throw from Star and Garter House. The park covers 2,500 acres and has protected status as an important habitat for wildlife and is a National Nature Reserve. The park is also a venue for a range of activities including fishing, rugby, golf and horse riding.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's and The Lowther School.

There are two Southern Region overland train stations in the area, Barnes and Barnes Bridge.

Over the River Thames, Hammersmith provides an additional range of shopping facilities and access to the District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City and Circle line tube stations.

For the sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated close by, The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

The second reception room has also been extended with a beautiful pitched roof extension with vaulted ceilings and four skylights allowing lots of natural light to pour in, large rear windows with views over the landscaped rear garden and French doors that lead out onto the raised deck area. The kitchen is also a good size with access out on to the rear garden. There is also the benefit of a downstairs WC tucked under the stairs.

To the first floor the you are met with a spacious landing, a family bathroom with separate WC and four large bedrooms all offered in good condition.

detailedDescription:
A superb four bedroom family house in the heart of Barnes village.

Location

Byfeld Gardens is a much sought after road in Barnes village, which offers an eclectic mix of local shops, restaurants, boutiques, a cinema and galleries.

There is a pretty duck pond, green and the River Thames towpath which are all frequently used for those who enjoy walking, running or cycling.

There are excellent transport links at Barnes Station or Barnes Bridge Station offering a frequent service into Waterloo. There are also good bus services serving Putney and Richmond, all of which offer underground connections. Heathrow airport is easily accessible

There are excellent schools in the area including St Paul's, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. For younger pupils there is St Osmunds (rc), Lowther Primary School, St Paul's Juniors and Barnes Primary School.

Description

This wonderful four bedroom house is decorated in fresh neutral tones and offers well balanced living and entertaining space across three floors.

To the front of the property is a generous bay fronted reception room with attractive wood flooring, a welcoming wood burning stove with a feature fireplace. This flows through to an open plan kitchen/dining room at the rear with glass doors extending the living space further onto a large decked terrace overlooking a beautifully landscaped 43ft garden, with raised flowerbeds and a paved rear patio complete with garden shed. Alongside is a contemporary kitchen with an excellent range of fitted units and cupboards, solid wood work surfaces, integrated appliances and a breakfast bar. The house also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom and a cellar offering storage space.

Upstairs, on the first floor are two generous double bedrooms, an additional single bedroom and a contemporary family bathroom with a separate glass shower and bath. A guest double bedroom/study is on the top floor and has a dual aspect with dormers to the front and back with a stylish shower room alongside.

Square Footage: 1732 sq ft

detailedDescription:

We have rarely seen a property refitted and presented to this standard of finish and attention to detail, it is quite exceptional and a has been a meticulous labour of love.
This landmark Church conversion occupies an lovely location not far from the bustling bars and restaurants on Richmond's delightful Kew Road near the Old Deer Park. It is a small, well run select development and the leaseholders benefit from a share of the freehold so are invested in the management and maintenance of this magnificent building and also benefit from secure allocated parking bays. This fine apartment is located and accessed from the rear of the building so it particularly peaceful and displays many exquisite features of the original church including exposed stone mullioned windows and high beamed ceilings. This is coupled with handsome polished warm walnut wood flooring, a stunning feature glass staircase, high specification kitchen and ensuite bathrooms with a walk in wardrobe and a lighting design which compliments these beautiful finishes.
Richmond town centre offers a wide and sophisticated range of shops restaurants and pubs, two cinemas and a renowned theatre set on the picturesque Green. The station has a fast and frequent mainline service to London Waterloo and also the District line tube and Overground serving North London.

address: Richmond Square, Kew Foot Road, Richmond, Surrey TW9
detailedDescription:
Now Launched. Elegant courtyard facing apartment sits within the beautifully restored historic façades of Shaftesbury House

Location

The London Borough of Richmond upon Thames is in South West London. It is situated along one of the most picturesque and accessible parts of the River Thames which links Hampton Court Palace, Richmond Town Centre and Kew Gardens with London.

Richmond itself is home to Richmond Park and its famous deer, stunning riverside views and a historic green within a town centre bustling with life and steeped in history. With two award winning theatres, an art gallery and a museum, the town has much to offer connoisseurs of culture.

Sporting enthusiasts will not be disappointed. Richmond boasts numerous golf clubs nearby and is well located for Polo at Ham, Rugby at Twickenham and Wimbledon for Tennis whilst the River Thames plays host to the Great River Race, Richmond Amateur Regatta and, further downstream, the Oxford and Cambridge boat race – all highlights of the social season along with music of every genre performed in some glorious outdoor settings during the summer months.

Less than ten miles from central London, Richmond benefits from all that the internationally renowned Capital has to offer – business, finance and politics to culture, gastronomy, entertainment and retail – with excellent national and international connections by road, rail and air, Heathrow Airport is just 7.4 miles away.

Description

Now Launched.

Sales Pavilion Open
Viewing available by appointment

A rare opportunity to purchase within the Kew Foot Road Conservation Area of Richmond upon Thames.

Richmond Square presents one magnificent three bedroom townhouse over three floors behind the original central Georgian façade, one beautiful two bedroom townhouse and 54 exquisite and individually styled apartments, penthouses and loft apartments.

A blend of new building and the restoration, conversion and enhancement of existing Grade II Listed and historic buildings of Merit, the exceptional residences of Richmond Square surround terraces and a tranquil landscaped courtyard.

This elegant courtyard facing apartment sits within the beautifully restored historic façades of Shaftesbury House. The apartment comprises a spacious living and dining area with generous ceiling heights up to 2.6m. The handcrafted Italian designed kitchen gives a contemporary style that contrasts and enhances the traditional architecture. The master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and ensuite bathroom is spacious and light with beautifully understated luxury and muted tones. The property also benefits from a large private terrace accessed from the master bedroom and living area - great for socialising and entertaining.

The private landscaped gardens at Richmond Square are filled with rich planting, perfect for relaxation and catching up with friends.

Residents can enjoy the convenience of a concierge service, leaving you free to entertain, work or unwind.
A rare opportunity to purchase within the Kew Foot
Road Conservation Area of Richmond upon Thames.

Square Footage: 538 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 998 years remaining

detailedDescription:
An attractive five bedroom end of terrace house in Barnes Village.

Location

Cambridge Road is in the heart of Barnes Village, which offers an eclectic mix of independent retailers including butcher, fishmonger, greengrocer, cheese shop and wine merchant. Barnes has several good pubs and highly regarded restaurants, and the Olympic Cinema. There is also a Sainsbury's Local and Marks and Spencer supermarkets and a weekly farmers market.

Barnes Pond and the surrounding green adjoining Barnes Common is close by, along with The Wildfowl & Wetlands Trust's 100 acre Wetlands Centre. There are pleasant towpath walks along the River Thames.

For those who commute Barnes Bridge station and Barnes Station provide a frequent service into Waterloo. There is also a regular bus service to Hammersmith, giving access to the underground and bus networks.

The schools in the area include – St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils – St Paul's Juniors, St Osmunds' (rc) and Barnes Primary School.

Description

This period home has been extended and modified to provide versatile accommodation over three floors.

The state-of-the-art kitchen/ dining room has been designed to incorporate as much natural light as possible and offers a central island, dining area, fitted appliances and underfloor heating. Further accommodation on the ground floor includes a double reception room with double glazed bay windows, a cloakroom, a good sized utility room in the cellar and a downstairs bathroom.

The property also benefits from side access from the kitchen and from the garden and well-arranged storage. French doors lead out from the kitchen to a large and mature south facing garden with artificial lawn and two decked areas for seating. The garden has a wonderful rear open aspect.

The bedroom accommodation comprises three double bedrooms and a family bathroom on the first floor. There are a further two bedrooms and shower room on the second floor.

Square Footage: 1907 sq ft
