title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Forming part of a converted church, this delightful two bedroom split level apartment shares a communal entrance hall, but the original design has been completely altered by the current owners. The property was stripped back to its shell with new wiring, plumbing, Lutron lighting and thermostatically controlled heating systems installed.

The ground floor is divided into a large open plan kitchen/dining/reception room. The bespoke kitchen is built around the curvature of the staircase and features Miele appliances built into a range of units under a Zodiac Quartz worktop.

The dining and reception areas feature a range of handmade joinery and cabinetry from Vavona Joinery and are fully wired for the Bang & Olufsen audio system.

Adjoining the reception area is a double bedroom with built in wardrobes (also by Vavona) and an en suite bathroom with separate shower, heated mirror, underfloor heating and Aquavision TV installed above the bath. A cloakroom completes this floor.

Upstairs the apartment has a principal bedroom with large glass panels inserted into the floor to allow light to flow through the property, and it also benefits from a walk in dressing room and en suite shower room.

Externally the building has electric gates, a private off street parking space and is positioned opposite Old Deer Park and in close proximity to Richmond Station and Kew Gardens.

Fixtures and fittings: All those items regarded as tenant's fixtures and fittings, together with the fitted carpets, curtains and light fittings, are specifically excluded from the sale. However, many of the items were handmade as part of the design brief and may be available by separate negotiation.

Kew Road is conveniently positioned within close proximity from Richmond station (0.5 mile), Richmond town centre and many of the area's attractions such as the River Thames (0.6 mile), Richmond Green (0.7 mile), Richmond Park (1.5 miles) with its 2500 acres of Royal parkland and Kew Gardens (0.3 mile).

Schools in the area include King's House School (0.9 mile), Marshgate Primary School (0.7 mile) and The Vineyard School (1.2 mile). Places of interest include Twickenham Stadium (2.4 miles) and Ham House (3.2 miles).

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to central London via both South West trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is 8.4 miles away and can be reached easily by road, train or bus.

*All times and distances used are approximate.

detailedDescription:
A spectacular townhouse in a private development on the banks of the River Thames in Chiswick. The property features a waterfront rear garden and an integral garage in addition to two off-street parking spaces.

The property has been tastefully modernised by its current owner, to include state-of-the-art systems including air conditioning, underfloor heating, a Lutron lighting system, and a three-zoned Sonos surround-sound system. Great attention to comfort and detail has been taken in the finish of the property, which includes imported stone and antique wooden flooring, an Italian leather wall and privacy screens on the windows facing the river.

The entrance level hosts the garage, which has space for three cars, a snug or office room to the rear, and a downstairs cloakroom which also houses a washer-dryer.

The first floor offers an excellent living and entertaining space, laid out in an open-plan arrangement made up of three sections. A bright living room with floor-to-ceiling windows looks out over the river and offers access to the garden, the mezzanine level hosts a dining area which can comfortably seat ten guests, and a tastefully-designed semi-open-plan kitchen features luxury appliances including and American fridge-freezer and a wine cooler.

The second floor hosts a tiled family bathroom with underfloor heating, two large double bedrooms complete with bespoke built-in wardrobes, and a third single bedroom which is currently arranged as an office.

The master suite is situated on the top floor, and consists of a large double bedroom with built-in wardrobes, a private dressing room, and an underfloor-heated en suite bathroom complete with stone his-and-hers sinks and showers, and an airing cupboard. This level also offers access to a roof terrace, which includes a Hydropool hot tub and overlooks the river.

Chiswick Quay is a peaceful private development on the waterfront, and this property is one of the few which overlooks both the marina and the River Thames. In addition to the Thames Path, the property also has access to an abundance of green spaces nearby, including Dukes Meadows and Chiswick House and Gardens. A selection of independent cafes and restaurants are located nearby in the Strand-on-the-Green area close to Kew Bridge, with a further range of shopping and dining opportunities close by on the Chiswick High Road.

Commuters benefit from proximity to Chiswick Mainline station, which offers rail connections towards Waterloo, and local bus routes, as well as access to free parking outside of the development. Motorists can access the A4/M4, North Circular and South Circular for excellent road links into and out of the city centre. Numerous well-regarded schools including Grove Park Primary School, Chiswick School, The Falcons Pre-Preparatory School and Strand-On-The-Green Junior School are also within easy walking distance.

detailedDescription:
A charming and stylish extended period cottage with a delightful sunny courtyard garden, superbly located in "The Alberts", a very sought-after and peaceful enclave close to Richmond town centre and station.

Gingerbread Cottage has been much improved by the owner, carefully blending the original period details with some striking contemporary touches.
The ground floor is extended with an open plan design offering a lovely sitting area in front of a large open fireplace, there is a recessed dining area and a bespoke fitted kitchen. There is also a shower room, cloak room and inner hallway stepping out to a pretty walled garden.
The first floor, again has some striking design touches. Access via an open steel and hard wood stairwell onto the landing with vaulted ceilings and large windows pulling in lots of light. A nicely designed shower room is set back to the rear from the landing.
The main bedroom has a spiral staircase up to a converted loft space which the owner uses as a sleeping area. Double depth fitted wardrobes have been designed and built specifically to complement the main bedroom.
Outside the rear garden is walled and enjoys a sunny southerly aspect and a high level of seclusion.
Worple Way is a highly regarded area of 'no through' roads which make up a very peaceful and charming period neighbourhood know as 'the Alberts' within which are two pubs and an independent delicatessen.
There are some excellent local schools nearby including outstanding Marshgate Primary.
Central Richmond is moments away and offers a wide and sophisticated range of shops restaurants and pubs, two cinemas and a renowned theatre set on the picturesque Green.
The station has a fast and frequent mainline service to London Waterloo and also the District line tube and Overground serving North London.

There has been no expense spared in making this stunning apartment extremely conducive to modern day living whilst retaining its period integrity.

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

This wonderfully bright and spacious 3/4 bedroom apartment is situated in a popular art-deco purpose built development at the top of Richmond Hill.

The immaculately presented accommodation spans approximately 1,683 sq ft of accommodation and includes an open-plan double-length reception/dining room with wood flooring, bespoke cabinetry and access to a balcony, a fully fitted modern kitchen with built-in appliances, principal bedroom with en suite shower and dressing room, double bedroom with en suite shower room, two further bedrooms and a family bathroom.

The property further benefits from being sold with no onward chain, a share of the freehold and unallocated parking for the residents, that operates on a first come first served basis.

Hillbrow is located in the heart of Richmond Hill village, a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, with the world famous Richmond Park and Terrace Gardens on its doorstep.

Local places of interest include the unesco World Heritage Site - The Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew, Twickenham Stadium and Ham House.

Schools in the area include King's House School, Old Vicarage School, Marshgate Primary School and The Vineyard School.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to central London via both South West trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes).The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways, and is situated 6.8miles from Heathrow airport.

detailedDescription:
This floating home comes with a very rare 20-year mooring licence with a guarantee of renewal at the end of the term, giving you the security of never having to relocate your future home.

This bespoke houseboat features a generous open indoor space with patio doors directly onto the deck overlooking the river, where additional outdoor seating, dining & relaxing can be enjoyed. The interior incorporates a large u-shaped kitchen with breakfast bar, creating a great area for entertaining and cooking. The property has two large double bedrooms and a family bathroom at the rear.

Outside, there is a small garden on-land that has been beautifully landscaped and leads you through to the property. The houseboat's roof terrace (which is a wonderful place to enjoy Island life) spans the entire length and width of the boat. This presents an excellent location for outdoor dining, entertaining, viewing wildlife, or simply relaxing while reading a book. Another convenience is that the owner can park their car right outside the property.

Taggs Island is one of the few Thames islands to have the luxury of car access from Hampton Bank and it is a short walk to Hampton Court train station. Hampton Court Palace & bridge with its popular bars, cafes, and restaurants are also 10 mins walk away as well as being adjacent to the Royal Bushy Park which is literally just across from the island. Kingston-upon-Thames, great for shopping and evening entertainment is a further 10 minute drive or short bus ride, with bus stops both ways near the island bridge.

This property is only available to cash buyers.

address: Strand On The Green, Chiswick W4
detailedDescription: riverhomes are delighted to bring to market this magnificent family home on Strand on the Green with direct river views. Originally built as a Dairy/Farmhouse on the Burlington Estate, the original building dates back to 1697. The current owners have sympathetically and extensively extended the property, using 17th century hand made bricks sourced from the demolition of the Royal Mint building and original Georgian oak panelling. Set back and elevated from the road and with stunning river views it provides over 3000 sq. Ft of lateral living over two floors, it boasts five bedrooms (three with river views) three bathrooms, two reception rooms, dining room, kitchen, family room and a snug on the lower ground floor. Four of the bedrooms are located in the main house and the fifth is in a self contained cottage in the garden with a separate entrance through the garage. In addition it has a large and mature front and rear garden and garage and off-street parking. Strand on the Green is a lively waterside community, with its local restaurants and parade of independent shops. Located close to Kew Bridge and Chiswick overland stations, with convenient access to A4/M4 both into and out of London. EPC rating F.

address: The Avenue, St Margarets, Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
Rarely available, first time to the market in 65 years! An opportunity to own this simply stunning eight-bedroom Victorian residence with direct access to the St Margarets trust grounds built in 1856.

The property is currently under one freehold title, and has historically been converted into two very large apartments; it now offers the opportunity to convert into a stunning example of a very large early Victorian family residence.

This family home would require some modernisation and reconfiguring throughout, the current accommodation currently comprises over 3145 sqft of accommodation arranged over four floors, including a one-bedroom annexe to side, plus still boasting further scope for extension (stp).

The St Margaret's 'Pleasure Gardens', also known as The St Margaret's 'Trust Grounds, ' are comprised of approximately 14 acres of beautiful parkland that are for the exclusive use of the residents of the four roads that immediately surround them. They are subdivided into three areas, namely the The River Grounds', 'The Lake Grounds' and 'Avenue Grounds', This property backs the latter and has the added benefit of a seasonal tennis court and a great social side with many functions throughout the year.

detailedDescription:
A stunning apartment set within this beautiful period property in Barnes. This property has been refurbished and reconfigured in recent years and offers two bedrooms, one with a large en-suite bathroom, a separate family bathroom, a walk-in larder and a lovely open plan kitchen and reception room.

There are sliding doors onto a private south facing garden with mature planted beds. The property comes with one off street parking space and there is a communal bike storage unit.

The property is located opposite St Paul's School and a short distance from a parade of amenities and independent shops on Castelnau.

There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

Hammersmith Station is the closest transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

Exquisite, full of charm and character two bedroom cottage nestled in one of the quiet yet hugely convenient roads of Hampton Village.

Comprises of spacious open plan reception/diner fitted with bespoke display cabinets, made to order window shutters and French door into the garden, fitted kitchen with ample storage and family bathroom on the ground floor, this unique home offers comfortable living and entertaining space.

Upstairs, there are two double bedrooms with the access to the loft for storage and fitted wardrobe in one of the bedrooms.

Externally, there is a cute secluded rear garden that has been lovingly maintained by the current owners.
Plentiful free on road parking for vehicle owners.

Parrs Place located few minutes walk to Hampton Train Station ( 40 mins to London Waterloo), local shops, bars and restaurants. It is in catchment area for excellent schools ( Hampton Junior, Carlisle, Hampton Boys, leh), close proximity to Open Air Hampton Swimming Pool, Hampton Court Palace with it's magnificent gardens, Bushy Park, Hatherop, Carlisle and of course River Thames as well as very close to bus routes towards Heathrow, Hounslow, Kingston and Richmond.

This cottage is unique and we highly recommend viewings to appreciate it's character in full.

detailedDescription:
Description

The Property Partnership are delighted to offer for sale this immaculately presented three bedroom end of terrace house, ideally located a short distance away from St Paul's, Harrodian & Lowther Schools.

Beautifully light throughout, this stunning house comprises a contemporary fitted kitchen with ample dining space and an abundance of natural light, sliding doors lead out to a very pretty double width garden which also benefits from side access. There is also a generous reception room, downstairs w/c & separate study with garden access. To the first floor, there are three bedrooms and a fitted bathroom suite. Subject to the necessary consents, one could also extend into the loft space to provide another bedroom and en-suite.

Barnes nestles within a loop in the Thames between Richmond and Putney. Geographically contained by the river on three sides and by Barnes Common to the south, leafy Barnes retains a decidedly countrified air and is known for the strength of its schools including St. Paul's and the Harrodian. The areas proximity to open spaces, including the Wetlands Centre and Richmond Park, make Barnes and its near neighbour Mortlake the ideal home for those wishing to combine swift access to London with the qualities of village life. Barnes maintains a cornucopia of local clubs and societies and has benefitted from significant investment in recent years, not least the renovation of the old Olympic Studios on Church Road to create a fabulous cinema, The Olympic.

This room has a large bay window to the front sitting area and a beautiful contemporary kitchen with a large island, providing two distinct zones.

Providing nearly 900 square foot of accommodation, this bright and spacious property is presented in immaculate condition and has the benefit of a long lease (999 years) and a share of the freehold.

The property is enviably located in the heart of St Margarets' village, with it's great selection of shops, cafes and restaurants and St Margarets mainline station. Orleans Primary School (Ofsted Outstanding) is within a few minutes’ walk.

There are several parks nearby, including Moor Mead Park and Marble Hill Park and the River Thames is within a quarter mile. There are two health and fitness clubs within the village and a flagship Virgin Active is located within Twickenham Rugby Stadium.

address: Hillbrow, Richmond Hill, Richmond, Surrey TW10
detailedDescription:
Situated on the first-floor of this purpose-built apartment is this stunning apartment offering lateral accommodation of 1600 square feet. The property comprises; four bedrooms and three bathrooms, including a main bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and ensuite bathroom, a double reception room with floor-to-ceiling windows, separate modern kitchen and a large southerly-facing balcony. The property further benefits from off-street parking on a first-come-first-served basis.

This property is located in the heart of Richmond Hill village, a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, with the world famous Richmond Park and Terrace Gardens on its doorstep. The village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few.

You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.

Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

Incredibly stylish first and second floor maisonette with its own private ground floor entrance, two bedrooms and two bathrooms, located in the centre of Richmond in a very pleasant pedestrian only location.

The flat has been designed with bold design and striking decoration together with high-quality fittings and a high level of attention to detail, creating this beautifully put-together modern home. Offering close to 1000sq.ft. Of accommodation over two levels with en-suite bath/shower rooms to both bedrooms and a wonderfully light yet incredibly private living area on the upper floor. There are many thoughtful design features and technology within the flat and it provides a complete 'turnkey' opportunity; ready to move in to and enjoy straight away.

Situation
Church Court is, as the name suggests, adjacent to Richmond's St Mary Magdalene Church and is a quaint traffic-free pedestrian only lane that runs between George Street and Paradise Road. It is located in the heart of central Richmond offering ultimate convenience for access to transport, shops and recreation options. Many well-known retailers and smaller boutique shops occupy The Quadrant and George Street and the surrounding roads and lanes, together with many restaurants, cafes and pubs. Richmond station, with fast connections to London Waterloo, plus district Line Underground and Overground services, is less than 200m from this flat, as is Richmond Green and the River Thames just a little further. Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are also reachable on foot and both under a mile away.

Additional Information
Lease details-Start date - 17/07/2012
Lease duration-150 years
Length left on lease-141 years
Service charge-60% of works required as and when required
Ground rent-£275.00 per annum

A beautifully proportioned three-bedroom apartment situated on the first floor of this handsome Victorian conversion.

The property is presented in immaculate order by the current owner and briefly comprises; spacious reception room, separate modern kitchen, two generous double bedrooms, a third single bedroom/study and a beautifully appointed bathroom.

The property further benefits from being offered to the market with no onward chain and a separate storeroom.

The property is in an excellent location with its close proximity to Richmond town centre and its good transport links, attractive high street, a superb range of specialist shops, supermarkets, boutiques, coffee bars and restaurants.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to central London via both South West trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes).

The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Schools in the area include King's House School (0.9 miles), Old Vicarage School (0.5 miles), Marshgate Primary School (1.1 miles), The Vineyard School (0.5 mile) and The German School (1.3 miles).

Other places of interest include Richmond Park (0.8 mile), Kew Gardens (0.9 mile), Twickenham Stadium (2.0 miles) and Ham House (1.5 miles).

detailedDescription:
A wonderful two bedroom apartment with a triple aspect and plenty of natural light. This very well presented property has undergone refurbishment and reconfiguration in recent years and now offers two double bedrooms, two modern bathrooms, an open plan kitchen and reception room with a generous breakfast bar. The apartment is set within a well maintained small block of six and is located on the top floor, benefitting from the use of loft storage space. There is a cover and gated parking space located to the rear of the property.

The property is close to a parade of amenities and independent eateries, whilst nearby Barnes Village is home to the well-known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. Hammersmith Station is the closet transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A unique opportunity to acquire a beautiful, Victorian, ground floor conversion apartment, with steps leading to a private front entrance and glorious garden, nestled in a particularly desirable road on the upper-slopes of Richmond Hill.

Situated in an imposing and striking building, the property features a private doorway and hallway leading to all of the rooms and stylish accommodation. The kitchen/breakfast area blends seamlessly into the entertaining space, where you’ll find the lounge/family area, this really is the ‘hub of the property’, and is certainly complemented by a vaulted ceiling with sky-light windows bringing in masses of natural light, whilst the kitchen features integrated appliances and generous food preparation areas. Additionally, a family bathroom, plenty of storage space, a shower-room and bespoke wardrobes add to the appeal.

The garden really is quite wonderful, ideal for a family and al fresco dining.

Then comes ‘The Pod/ The Cabin’, a wonderful studio room, constructed with quality materials, with a kitchenette, then ample space for a double bed, with a shower and w.c too, it is a perfect ‘Guest Bedroom’ or ‘Granny Annex’.

Additionally, and of a huge benefit, this property offers private off-street parking plus a share of the freehold is included.

The location of this super home provides excellent access to the town centre, where you will find a plethora of shops, fine restaurants and charming lanes packed with boutiques and independent shops, The River and Richmond Green, whilst The Vineyard School, Kings House School, Royal Richmond Park and the outstanding transport links of Richmond-upon-Thames complete this fine property.

This magnificent property comes highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
An attractive 1930's semi-detached family home situated along a highly sought after avenue. The property offers impressively spacious accommodation over two floors with driveway parking and a well established rear garden.

The ground floor accommodation benefits from a stunning open-plan living dining kitchen area with central island and bi-folding doors onto a substantial seating terrace. In addition there is a separate living room, children's playroom, study and separate utility room with downstairs W/C. The first floor provides four double bedrooms and two family bathrooms.

Outside the beautifully established rear garden offers a substantial area of lawn with mature borders providing a range of plants and shrubs. There is a raised seating terrace which wraps around the rear of the property and offers a fantastic entertaining space. At the bottom of the garden lies a detached timber-clad home gym which is heated and air conditioned for full use throughout the year.

The property is located approximately 0.4 miles from Kew Gardens underground station with a range of local amenities nearby.

detailedDescription:
Rarely available first floor (lift serviced) 1-bedroom apartment within a popular purpose built development opposite the iconic Royal Botanic Gardens of Kew.

The property is well presented throughout and comprises reception with impressive floor to ceiling window and enviable views, newly installed built in kitchen, well-proportioned bedroom and a wonderful bathroom.

The property has a private garage, a Residents Owned Freehold and a well maintained communal garden.

Circa 0.4 miles from Kew Gardens station and village.

Attractively offered to the market with no onward chain and visitor parking.

Kew village has a variety of local independent shops, chemists, a bank, post office, public house, butcher, organic whole foods, florist, library, restaurant, bistro and cafes. Kew Gardens station is situated within the village and the picturesque vintage public house overlooks the station platform. Kew Retail Park, Kew Green and the Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) are nearby. In the summer cricket can be watched on Kew Green, opposite the old horse pond, where there is a choice of restaurants and public houses. The Thames Path is very close for riverside walks towards Richmond or Putney. There are a number of nurseries and schools in the area.

Nearby Richmond offers a variety of shops, banks, cinema, theatre and leisure facilities including Richmond Park which is the largest of the Royal Parks and a special area of conservation.

Transport links include the London Underground (District Line) and the London Overground into London or Richmond as well as regular bus services. Kew Gardens and Mortlake stations are within easy walking distance. Heathrow airport is less than 10 miles away and the motorway network is within easy reach. Driving routes include access to M3, M4 & the South Circular for convenient access both in & out of London.

Schools - Kew has a wide choice of quality local state primary schools, Queens, Kew Riverside & Darrel School. As well as an excellent range of private independent schools, Broomfield, The Unicorn, Kew College and close by Godophin, St Paul's and Colet Court.

detailedDescription:
Freehold central Twickenham residence representing a superb opportunity for an investor or developer.

Four spacious apartments in central Twickenham with potential realistic rental income of £65,000 combined.

An exceptional opportunity to acquire a stunning freehold residence in central Twickenham- currently arrange as four spacious apartments.

Book viewings or enquire about this property 24/7- if viewing on Rightmove or Zoopla simply click the link below.

Ideal for an investor or discerning buyer wanting a very large property in a superb location, the property is currently arranged as four spacious apartments and is producing a superb yield.

There is scope to convert the existing accomodation into one grand residence.

A rare opportunity.

There is a driveway to the front.

Each apartment runs on seperate heating and electrics and is classified as a seperate dwelling and as such presently pay seperate council tax bills.

Separate EPCs for each apartment available upon request.

Property Description

Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £1,125,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Ground Floor

A large secure walkway runs the length of the property and provides access to the ground floor flat as well as the garden area, which in turn provides access to the upper two floors via a spiral staircase.

The ground floor apartment (photos 3-6) is an excellent size for a one bed and comprises a very spacious reception room, bedroom, modern kitchen/breakfast room and a spacious, modern bathroom.

Currently rented at £1285 pcm.

First Floor

The first floor (pictures 7 - 10) is made up of two smaller one bedroom apartments. Both comprising a large studio/open plan kitchen/diner, seperate bedroom and en-suite.

Both the apartments have the same layout. The rear apartment accessed via a spacious balcony off the spiral staircase and the front accessed via a staircase to the front of the property.

Both apartments are currently rented out and each are achieving £1140pcm.

Second Floor

Photos 11 - 19.

The top floor is a very spacious two double bedroom apartment which benefits from a large and very useable loft room.

Accessed via a balcony off the spiral stairs, the accommodation comprises two double bedrooms, a large bathroom, a large loft area with two seperate areas, and a grand open plan reception room/ kitchen with large windows and vaulted ceilings.

This apartment is currently occupied by the owner, however would achieve a realistic rental yield of £1600pcm.

detailedDescription:
Ground Floor 2 bedroom apartment in a well maintained modern development with a private garden, an allocated parking space, landscaped communal grounds, visitor parking and secure entry phone access. Situated just 0.3 miles from Twickenham mainline train station and only 0.2 miles from the A316 with direct access to the M3/M25 and into Central London.

With no onward chain and offering 516 sq ft of well balanced living space with modern fixtures, fittings and floors, large double glazed windows and doors and neutral decor throughout.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This rare Grade II listed period house is located on the highly sought-after lower slopes of Richmond Hill. Set in a prime location, the property is a stone's throw from the River Thames and the Thames Towpath which provides ample opportunity for socialising at riverside eateries, walking, cycling, boating and fishing. Nearby green spaces including Richmond Green, Old Deer Park, Terrace Gardens and the 2,500 acres of Richmond Park provide further extensive opportunities for leisure. The house is also only a short distance from Richmond's vibrant activity and extensive array of local amenities.

Built in approximately 1725 under the reign of King George I, this impressive house forms part of a beautiful early Georgian terrace and retains much of the original charm of the building. Plenty of stunning period features including high ceilings, well-proportioned rooms throughout and a garden at the rear.

This house has a wealth of history and has been occupied by a number of acclaimed owners.

Entrance is onto the raised ground floor and into a large reception room with original panelling, a beautiful original fireplace and large sash windows which help to create a sense of space and light throughout. This double reception room runs the length of the house and also features wooden flooring. At the rear of the house there is a cloakroom and access to the patio garden, an ideal space for al fresco dining in the summer.

On the lower ground floor is a fully integrated kitchen/breakfast room, with two windows and a front terrace making the kitchen unusually light. To the rear of the house is a formal dining room and separate utility area.

On the first floor there is a large principal bedroom with a beautiful fireplace and built in wardrobes. There is a further double bedroom and well-appointed shower room on this floor.

On the second floor there is a further generous double bedroom, a study/fourth bedroom and a family bathroom.

The house further benefits from two spacious, stand up loft spaces that span the house. One of the lofts has roof access and a large window, and has previously been used as an art studio. Both lofts have extendable stairs.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

The property is situated in a prime Richmond location and is only moments from the area's vibrant activity and attractive riverside amenities, the famous Richmond Green, numerous shops, bars and restaurants.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include The Vineyard School, Deer Park School, Marshgate Primary School, Orleans Primary School, Orleans Park School, Holy Trinity Church of England Primary School and Windham Nursery School.

The area is abundant with a range of attractions and leisure opportunities for families to enjoy. Richmond Park is one of London's eight Royal Parks and covers 2,500 acres. The park has protected status as an important habitat for wildlife and is a National Nature Reserve. The park is also a venue for a range of activities including fishing, rugby, golf and horse riding.

Nearby Richmond Green has been described as "one of the most beautiful urban greens surviving anywhere in England."

The world-leading Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew is a unesco World Heritage site and is home to over 50,000 living plants.

The property is only a short distance from The River Thames which also makes this a very special place to live.

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both South West Trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is only 6.8 miles away. *All times and distances are approximate.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A stunning four bedroom townhouse with allocated parking in a desirable modern development close to the river and Thomson House Primary School.

The ground floor has a smart fully fitted kitchen, spacious WC and a fantastic sitting room and separate dining area and with bifold doors leading to a light south facing garden. There is an abundance of storage in the hallway and living area with underfloor heating throughout the ground floor.

The first floor has an impressive main bedroom with Juliet balcony and further built-in storage, a family bathroom with access from the hall and also the second double bedroom.

On the top floor are two further double bedrooms each with en-suite shower rooms and with more storage and loft access. Solar panels also help with energy provision and are a further feature that this stunning modern house offers to a buyer.

Wadham Mews is off Williams Lane in a quiet location adjacent to the River Thames offering easy access to Mortlake Green and Sheen Lane. Mortlake train station is within very close proximity to provide a good service into London Waterloo, The City and the West End.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Weir Cottage has a fascinating historical and architectural heritage. The current house was originally constructed around 1850, and then completely remodelled as a Victorian Arts & Crafts home around 1890. During the golden age of the silver screen in the 1930's and 40's, Weir Cottage was used as a gatehouse for the Teddington Film Studios.

The ground floor benefits from an imposing hallway with double doors opening into the spacious light filled living / dining room which contains within the original snug, a striking inglenook fireplace, with its hammered copper finish and hidden storage spaces beneath the benches. The open plan living and dining room also benefits from a gas fire place with stone hearth and surround with beautiful French doors opening out onto a private back garden, which has views sweeping down over the landscaped gardens down to the rivers' edge. The original Victorian awning that covers the patio, means you will be able to spend precious time in your garden all year round.

The ground floor also benefits from a carefully planned study with plenty of natural light and French doors leading out onto the terrace, along with inbuilt shaker style cupboards. In addition, there is a separate downstairs cloakroom and utility room containing a sink, washing machine plus dryer and Worcester gas fired condensing system boiler.

The bespoke kitchen has been carefully designed in a shaker style with a porcelain matte finish with fully integrated Siemen appliances and Caple wine cooler, stone worktops, ceramic tile splashbacks and a porcelain grey tiled floor.

The stairs sitting within the original turret with their feature oak handrail take you up to the first floor where you will find the spacious master bedroom with its impressive views down to the river, dressing area, ensuite and two balconies.

Additionally, there are three generously sized bedrooms with their own shaker style fitted wardrobes in a porcelain matte finish. The second bedroom also has an en suite shower room with the other 2 bedrooms benefiting from a family bathroom.

The bathrooms and cloakroom all have high-quality sanitaryware with chrome taps and fittings, Calacatta stone ceramic wall tiles, chrome heated towel rails, light grey porcelain floor tiles and wall mounted mirrored cabinets.

Throughout the house, traditional timber windows with leaded lights which have been incorporated into the double glazing to enhance the light filled rooms.

Weir Cottage benefits from its own private gardens, a paved terrace with external wall mounted lights, garden and bin storage. Gates lead out onto the beautifully landscaped communal gardens, with riverwalk access and children's play areas.

The house comes with 2 allocated car park spaces located in the secure underground car park. Plus there are additional storage spaces available to purchase within the communal basement.

This landmark property boundary extends to a total plot area of 4,252 sqft

The house includes a 10-year blp warranty, from practical completion of the building works

This house is perfect for those wanting to enjoy the space now but with potential for a future loft conversion, subject to planning to create a master bedroom with ensuite.

detailedDescription:
This large Victorian home has been transformed by the current owner into a stylish modern family home with a large west-facing rear garden. The property comprises; a storm porch entrance into a wide hallway, a stunning double-reception room with wood-burning stove, bay window and fitted shelving, a boot room with storage, a downstairs WC and a stunning open-plan kitchen/living/dining room with large island, sliding rear doors and a walk-in larder. On the two upper-floors there are five double bedrooms and three bathrooms (all with under-floor heating) including a main bedroom with ensuite bathroom with separate bath and walk-in shower. The property has fitted storage throughout and also benefits from loft and eaves storage. The rear west-facing garden is 78 ft long and features a large shed with power as well as rear access to Heron Road.

Located in St Margarets, this property is superbly located for all that St Margarets and Richmond has to offer with Richmond town centre only a short walk or cycle away along the river and over Richmond Lock to Richmond Green and riverside. St Margarets perfectly balances city and country living thanks to its proximity to spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, St Margarets and Richmond has outstanding state and private school options, including Twickenham primary, Orleans Park and St Stephens primary school to name a few.

You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots close-by alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include The White Swan pub situated on a stunning stretch of Richmond riverside, Armstrongs family butchers, Holly & Co coffee shop and restaurant Del Posto.

Nearby Richmond and Kingston town centres offer a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

address: Brasenose Drive, Harrods Village, Barnes, London SW13
detailedDescription:
Chestertons are delighted to offer this very attractive, large and triple-aspect penthouse apartment on the top floor (4th, with lift) in one of the original, listed, depository buildings in the prestigious Harrods Village development by the Thames in Barnes.

The property is presented in excellent condition and combines the industrial feel of the original building with loft-like space and modern style through large rooms, wooden floors in the living room, entrance hall and corridor, sisal carpet in the 3 bedrooms and marble floors in the 3 bathroom/shower rooms.

Moreover, the apartment has exceptional natural light, a bright southerly orientation and high ceilings throughout. And, by virtue of its high position, the apartment offers wonderful vistas of the surrounding area, including partial views of the Thames, an attractive outlook on to the manicured communal gardens and far-reaching landscapes to the London Wetlands Centre, a 'safe haven of wide-open spaces bursting with wetland nature'.

The apartment opens on to a wide, welcoming hall with excellent storage space and a marble guest toilet with shower. The hall and corridor lead on to a spacious (452 sq ft / 42m2), elegant and dual-aspect reception/dining room with far-reaching views. Off the entrance corridor and adjacent to the living room is a modern, large (195 sq ft / 18m2) and fully-equipped kitchen/breakfast room overlooking the entrance to the development and with an outlook to the London Wetlands; off this room is a separate utility room with fitted sink, worktop and recent washing/drying machine.

There are two large, double bedrooms, each with ample built-in wardrobes and an ensuite marble bathroom; there is also a third double bedroom, located close to the guest toilet and shower. The apartment benefits from two allocated parking spaces on the ground floor of the building, conveniently located for the main lift.

Harrods Village is an exclusive, gated and well-maintained development with a 24-hour concierge and comprehensive on-site facilities for the residents including a 25m. Swimming pool, gymnasium, sauna and business centre. Local shops are 2 minutes' walk and the development is conveniently located for access to the facilities and charms of Barnes Village and pond, the river Thames (with direct access to the Thames towpath) and the excellent primary and secondary schools nearby including Lowther Primary, Barnes Primary, St Pauls, The Swedish School and The Harrodian.

detailedDescription:
An outstanding and idyllically situated family home.

Location

Baden House is idyllically situated, nestling discretely just behind Richmond Green - once a jousting ground to Henry vii's former Tudor Palace and today a quintessential and picturesque village green that is home to more gentle pursuits, such as Sunday afternoon cricket. Richmond town centre can be found a short stroll away and has a sophisticated array of shops, boutiques and restaurants. A particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames can be found at the end of Friars Lane, providing an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life. Richmond train station offers a rapid and direct service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Line tube and overland to Stratford, via North London. Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

Built in 2012 Baden House is an outstanding example of a recently built home, with superb attention to detail and a real depth of quality to its finish. Its architectural style is both stylish and elegant, blending seamlessly with and further complimenting the beautiful Georgian houses around Richmond Green. It occupies a wonderfully discrete yet convenient position and provides generous off street parking and a walled garden that is both charming and private. The accommodation is beautifully balanced and magnificently proportioned over four floors with large windows allowing an excellent flow of natural light. The lovely room proportions are further emphasised by the impressive ceiling heights. The kitchen and five bathrooms are superbly appointed and the house is most tastefully presented throughout.

Square Footage: 4100 sq ft

detailedDescription:
A handsome and very substantial detached 4 double bedroom family house built in the early 1900's and offering very flexible accommodation. Lying within easy walking distance of Twickenham's town centre and station with its fast and frequent service into London Waterloo.

The current owner has already extended the property to the side in order to create consulting rooms, but these could easily be adapted to form a self-contained granny or au pair flat. This would still leave excellent extension potential to both the rear and into the loft space (subject to planning).

The property boasts some amazing original features, in particular the magnificent entrance hall with it's panelled walls and a stunning leaded & stained-glass window. There is also a sunny 68' x 43' rear garden with a delightful summer house/studio and brick-built bike store, whilst to the front there is an 'in-and-out' driveway allowing off street parking for several cars.

The property is located close to the A316 offering swift access by car into central London in one direction and the West country via the M3 in the other.

Perfect for any budding interior designer or someone looking to increase the value of a property by skilfully renovating and increasing the space.

Sitting on the first floor of this detached residence on a quiet and very popular road in the heart of East Sheen village this flat has the freeholders consent to convert the loft, which could almost double the size of the property to create something truly spectacular to suit the new owner’s specific taste and needs. Leinster Avenue is close to Mortlake Station, which offers easy access to central London with journey times of just 24 minutes to Waterloo and 4 minutes to Richmond. It is a short walk to both the River Thames and Richmond Park and is within striking distance of Waitrose and everything Sheen High Street has to offer; coffee shops, numerous eateries and a wonderful selection of independent shops. It really is a fantastically friendly little neighborhood of London to live in.

A stylish apartment, in Richmond upon Thames, with a glorious South-West facing sun-terrace.

detailedDescription:

The property offered to the market in excellent condition throughout, having undergone significant improvements and restoration by the current owners.
Upon entry you are met with lovely wide, bright and airy entrance hall with Herringbone parquet flooring, a large front reception room with large working bay window, original feature fireplace and also offered with Herringbone parquet flooring. The second reception is a great size also offering a working bay window, Herringbone parquet flooring and has been cleverly combined with the beautifully designed kitchen extension creating the heart of the home measuring an impressive 18'8 x 10'4 with large windows, high ceilings and wave-line roof pitch to allow lots of natural light to pour in and the added benefit of access to the landscaped rear garden via French doors.
A grand staircase takes you to the spacious landing and first floor which comprises a large master bedroom with fitted wardrobes and bay windows, a large second bedroom, a double aspect good size single bedroom and a newly fitted family bathroom all offered in good condition.
Further benefits include a fitted utility area, gas central heating, shed with garden room which could be used as an office which measuring 2m x 2m and located moments to both Whitton High Street, Whitton Train Station, local amenities and falls within the catchment areas for many highly sought-after Richmond Borough schools.

address: The Old Court House, The Green, Richmond TW9
detailedDescription:
The Old Court House is a Grade II* listed Queen Anne property, built between 1705 and 1707.

The lease extension cost for an additional 90 years is likely to be between £7,565,000 and £7,789,000 plus costs, based on subject to contract and without prejudice negotiations.

In addition to The Old Court House there is the self-contained The Old Court House Cottage which measures 1,021 sq ft and provides a large reception room, fitted kitchen with access to the garden, bedroom and bathroom.

The main house is arranged over four principal floors and provides spacious and elegant accommodation. Throughout the property there are numerous period features usually found in a property of this age and type. The Adam style door case, elegant staircases and the large box sash windows, with window seats, are just a few of the majestic period features on show.

On arriving at the house you are instantly impressed with the period grandeur and its historical positioning, with one of the boundaries forming part of the Richmond Palace arch, which leads down to the historic Old Palace Yard.

There is a delightful panelled entrance hallway, with stone tiled floor and high ceilings. Two exquisite rooms fall either side of the hallway, one of them being an incredible bay fronted dining room with feature fireplace, high ceilings and stripped wood floors. The reception room on the other side is equally as impressive with views over The Green.

To the rear of the ground floor there is a fully fitted kitchen with an array of built-in appliances and a kitchen island. A utility room and cloak room complete this floor.

The first floor provides the elegant drawing room which measures over 25 ft wide approximately and is the perfect room to entertain family and friends. This is followed by an additional reception room or bedroom, depending on how the new owners wish to arrange the accommodation and the main bedroom and a bathroom.

To the top floor there are four further bedrooms a bathroom and a separate WC. The views from all of these rooms are exceptional with The Green to the front, and Old Palace Yard and the marvellous houses that surround it to the rear.

The lower ground floor is currently used as accommodation for the housekeeper and provides two additional reception spaces, bedroom, kitchen, bathroom and vault.

The walled south west facing garden to the rear is a very special feature and measures 80 ft approximately. It provides a lovely mixture of mature trees, shrubs and plants. To the rear of the garden there is access to the garage, which fronts Old Palace Yard and provides off street parking. The palace yard can be used by visitors, if there is space, to park their car while visiting the property.

The Old Court House is positioned within the heart of Richmond overlooking Richmond Green, which has been described as "one of the most beautiful urban greens surviving anywhere in England."

The Old Court House and The Old Court House Cottage are only moments from the fabulous amenities of Richmond including, The Orange Tree and Richmond Theatre, numerous bars, restaurants, fabulous shops, boutiques and the two cinemas. Richmond has an abundance of excellent schools and many are within walking distance from the house including Marshgate, Kings House, The Vineyard and The Old Vicarage.

Richmond Borough is home to some of the finest Royal Parks including Richmond Park, Old Deer Park, Bushy Park and Home Park at Hampton Court. There are several great golf courses and the World Heritage site of Kew Gardens. The River Thames also makes this a very special place to live.

Transport links to Central London are speedy and excellent with frequent trains via both overland and London Underground's District Line. The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is approximately 5.8 miles away and can be reached easily by road, train or bus.

address: Cavendish Court, Cardigan Road, Richmond, Surrey TW10
detailedDescription:
Cavendish Court was designed by renowned British architect and designer Eric Lyons, who achieved great recognition for his experimental modernist design and is perhaps best known for his partnership in the well renowned Span Developments.

This stunning top-floor purpose-built apartment is presented in excellent condition throughout and features a light and spacious open-plan double reception with doors to a large balcony. The property comprises; a spacious entrance hallway with built-in storage and utility space, a large open-plan living/dining room, a separate modern kitchen with balcony, a large bathroom with separate bath and walk-in shower and a separate WC. There are large windows throughout and two private balconies to the front. Further benefits include communal gardens at the front of the building and a garage with power to the rear. Share of freehold.

Richmond Hill
Located between Richmond town centre and the world-famous Richmond Park, Richmond Hill is a small community with a beautiful village at its heart. Featuring a variety of homes from large period properties to an eclectic mix of conversion and purpose-built apartments, the village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces such as Terrace Gardens and easy London transport links including boat services along the river. Richmond Station is also close by, with links to London Waterloo and Reading by rail and London Victoria via the District Line.
An ideal location for families and professionals, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary. There are secondary school options in neighbouring Ham, Kingston and Twickenham, including the Tiffin Schools and Grey Court.
You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.
Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

Open plan kitchen/dining/living area.
Rooftop sun deck and smaller lower deck.
Well insulated, new boiler, plumbing, and wiring throughout.
4 large storage areas within the hull.
Modern bathroom.
Mains utilities: Gas, water, sewage.

Close to nature, the shops, and to bus and rail transport.

detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

***Video tour available*** An immaculately presented, excellently located one bedroom ground floor apartment is offered to the market with no upper chain. The property is offered with vacant possession and has recently been redecorated throughout and offers its next owner the opportunity to move in and enjoy the property straight away. The well-proportioned light and airy, welcoming accommodation briefly comprises: Secure communal entrance, private entrance hall with three convenient storage cupboards, an inviting reception room opening onto the kitchen/diner with a large window overlooking the garden to the front of the property and onto open green spaces beyond, attractive flooring and fitted kitchen units with a range of attractive cupboards, washing machine and a newly installed electric oven and hob. There is ample space for a dining table and chairs making this an ideal space in which to relax and entertain.
There is a good-sized double bedroom with a large built-in wardrobe with newly fitted carpet and a pleasant shower room/wc with a white suite, large shower and contemporary tiling. There is a large private additional storage space located in the block on the ground floor providing very useful shed style versatile storage. The property is very well presented and would be ideally suited to a variety of buyers given its neutral decoration providing a blank canvas on which to place one's own stamp.
Externally there is a pleasant communal garden area to the front with lawn, shrubs and flowerbeds overlooking a pleasant green space providing ideal outdoor spaces in which to enjoy the warmer months. On street parking is available. Cowper Road is located on the perimeters of Ham Common, home to the local cricket club and charming annual fairs. The flat has a rural outlook within walking distance of Ham Gate and Richmond Park. A variety of local shops and amenities are close at hand on Tudor Drive and Ham Parade which holds a monthly farmers market. Perfectly situated between Kingston upon Thames and Richmond upon Thames.
The property is offered with 92 years remaining on the lease. Ground rent of £10 a year and annual service charge of £974.62. Viewing comes highly recommended.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Set in a highly sought after Victorian crescent, this truly stunning four bedroom period home boasts a wealth of character and offers a wonderful balance of bedroom and living accommodation, set over four floors.

On arriving at the property, you are immediately impressed by its handsome facade and balconied elevation. The house is full of natural light, and has been beautifully maintained to create a welcoming family home.

The entire ground floor consists of high ceilings throughout and includes a double aspect drawing room with a working fireplace and cornicing. An elegant hallway leads to a beautiful kitchen/dining room which is complemented by luxury fittings and bespoke cabinetry, integrated modern appliances, air conditioning and a Sonos music system.

Bi-folding doors open from the kitchen to an immaculate landscaped south facing garden with patio. This enclosed and private space is a perfect venue in which to entertain family and friends in the warmer months. To the rear of the garden is a fully equipped garden studio which could be used flexibly as additional accommodation, an office or a home gym.

On the first floor is the generous en suite principal bedroom, with a balcony which overlooks the crescent. The bathroom contains a modern freestanding bath, separate walk-in shower, double vanity unit and ample bespoke storage. A second bedroom with an en suite shower room follows. Both bedrooms on this floor are equipped with air conditioning.

On the second floor are two further bedrooms with built-in wardrobes, and a family bathroom.

The property further benefits from a laundry room located on the lower ground floor, side passage access, and off street parking.

Lawn Crescent is located in the heart of Kew, and is only a short distance from a range of local amenities. Local attractions include the Royal Botanic Gardens, Old Deer Park, and The River Thames. Chiswick, Richmond town centre and Richmond Park with its 2,500 acres are all within easy reach.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include Broomfield House School, Windham Nursery School, Marshgate Primary School, The Vineyard School, East Sheen Primary School, Deer Park School, Orleans Primary School and Orleans Park School.

Transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London via both Overground and District Line from nearby Kew Gardens station. The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is only approximately 7.2 miles away.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A unique double fronted detached Lion House which has just been fully refurbished with no expense spared.

On the ground floor you find the covered entrance leading to the entrance hall with cloakroom. To the right you find a through reception room which features a firplace, Ted Todd herringbone flooring which is exteded throughout the ground floor and a Solar giving a dual aspect and views to Barnes Common.

To the rear you have the kitchen/family room at maximum 35' x 22' with the bespoke kitchen by Luke McHardy & Co with a hand made in France Lacanche range cooker and french windows to the garden.

On the first floor landing you find the attractively decorated principal bedroom with double doors leading to a large luxury en-suite bathroom.

There are two further bedrooms on the first floor, a family bathroom and a laundry room.

The top floor offers a further three bedrooms, one with a Bonus childs play area, a family shower room and another room currently used as a gym with access to eaves storage.

The garden comprises a terrace, garden stores and a lawn with doule gates giving access to Station Road.

The interesting history of the Barnes Lion Houses, is they were built by James Nicholl between 1899 and 1903, who actually lived at Grove House.

Nicholl's building yard, known as "Beverley Works" was at the end of Willow Avenue. Similar houses had already been erected by him in the Hurlingham area of Fulham. The lugubrious lion figures identify the work of Nicholl.v

Location:
The property is situated in one of sought after locations in Barnes near the pond and opposite the Barnes Common Green.

Barnes Village provides an eclectic range of shops, restaurants and the pretty Duck Pond.

Heathrow can be accessed via the A4/M4 to the West and into Central London to the East.

Barnes Station and Barnes Bridge Station provide a frequent service into Waterloo and Richmond. Hammersmith Broadway provides an underground and bus network system.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary School.

For Sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated close by, The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

title: 6 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a wonderful end of terrace house, set within the grounds of the Garrick Estate and situated on a private residential road. Adjacent to Royal Bushy Park and the banks of the River Thames, this stunning property offers open plan living, exceptionally well presented fixtures and fittings throughout, stunning wood flooring and a beautiful Georgian style bay window.

Inside there is a master bedroom with built in wardrobe, en-suite bathroom plus two further generous double bedrooms and a magnificent family bathroom off the hallway. The living area is arranged and split over the upper and lower ground floors with an exceptionally beautiful upper level open plan living room which incorporates a dining area and provides further access to one further bedroom/study. It is an extraordinarily broad living area that features Oak board flooring, a Limestone surround fireplace and an impressive curved bay window.

The lower level opens on to a contemporary white, high gloss kitchen with Granite worktops, integrated appliances and space for an American style fridge freezer. There is a cool glass breakfast bar and access directly on to the private west facing patio garden and further through to the magnificent communal lawns and mature border trees which were once graced by the Shakespearian actor, David Garrick. To the front of the property there is a generous parking space in front of the power operated integrated double garage.

This property is offered to the market with no onward chain. Hogarth Way is a highly sought after private residential road which benefits from being close to and Hampton Court, Hampton Village and the Hampton Hill High Street. Transport links are good with regular trains into London Waterloo from either Hampton or Hampton Court stations.

detailedDescription:
An opportunity to purchase this light and bright second floor one bedroom apartment offering stylish living space on Cardigan Road.
This property underwent a full back-to-brick refurbishment in 2015 and now offers modern living within a Victorian façade. The property comprises; one bedroom with storage, a modern bathroom with shower and a modern kitchen with integrated appliances and a reception room with a large sash window. The apartment would suit a first time buyer, a buy-to-let investor or those looking for a Richmond/London bolt-hole.

Richmond Hill village is a small community with the world famous Richmond Park on its doorstep. You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend. Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

The village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few.

detailedDescription:
This stunning four bedroom purpose-built apartment in a prime Richmond Hill location, features lateral accommodation of over 1300 square feet in this attractive Edwardian mansion building with lift and sizeable communal gardens. Situated on the third floor, this period apartment benefits from far reaching panoramic views, high ceilings and a west-facing balcony. The property comprises; four bedroom and two bathrooms including a main bedroom with ensuite bathroom, a spacious separate kitchen and a large reception room with balcony, offering river views.

Cardigan Mansions is superbly located for the amenities of both Richmond Hill and Richmond town centre. The Thames tow-path and Richmond riverside are on your doorstep, with river views from the balcony. There’s the glorious Terrace Gardens (and Hollyhocks cafe) virtually next door and Richmond Park, Kew, Ham and Teddington Lock are all close-by.
Richmond Hill has a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, balancing city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links with Richmond Station offering direct routes to London Waterloo and Victoria and the City (District Line). An ideal location for families, Richmond has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few. Everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, small supermarkets and coffee spots are on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend. Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.
London Heathrow is the closest airport to Richmond, allowing for international travel and the country lifestyle is within reach with the M4 and M3 being easily accessed.

detailedDescription:
This magnificent, extended semi-detached family home boasts 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, an abundance of entertaining space and is situated between Richmond upon Thames and Kew Gardens.

The super reception room is complemented by a bay window, plantation shutters and high ceilings, whilst there is ample space to dine with many guests. The splendid kitchen/breakfast room is over 15ft deep with generous food preparation areas and masses of storage space, whilst both the family bathroom and en-suite bathroom are finished in a contemporary style with sleek tiling and quality sanitary-ware. The principal bedroom boasts twin velux windows, a Juliet balcony and ample storage space to the eaves, whilst this property is further enhanced with two more generously proportioned double bedrooms, then bedroom 4 could certainly be used as a home office/study, too.

Notably, the property also benefits from a downstairs cloakroom/w.c, ideal for guests and visitors.
The garden is absolutely perfect for a family, reaching out to over 40ft, to a Westerly aspect, ideal for al-fresco dining and the evening sunsets. There is a lovely decked area, ideal for barbeques, leading to a mature lawn and flowerbeds to the borders, a great sized garden when compared to some others in the immediate area.

The location of this property is fabulous, with very highly regarded schools in close proximity, a choice of District Line or Mainline routes in and out of London and a plethora of amenities and leisure facilities on-hand, too. Additionally, North Sheen recreation ground is moments away, whilst for the sporting enthusiast Dukes Meadows is great for tennis, golf and skiing and then Kew Retail Park just moments away is a great shopping option, as is Richmond town centre. Also nearby, you'll find Kew Village, an enchanting spot, full of eateries, coffee shops and independent shops.

This excellent family home of around 1450 square feet arranged over three floors certainly comes thoroughly recommend.

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

This very well presented three bedroom period house is arranged over two floors and extends to a total of approximately 1,521 sq ft.

The property has many appealing features including high ceilings, feature fireplaces, sash windows and traditional cornicing.

On entering the house there is an attractive hallway which leads to a charming reception room that looks on to Halford Road, followed by a further reception room which opens to the garden.

To the rear of the house is a spacious fitted kitchen and dining area, with ample space for entertaining friends and family.

The kitchen provides direct access to the private garden which catches the sun beautifully during summer. The back wall faces south west and is ideal for plant growing, with the current owners having grown potatoes, tomatoes, peas and herbs during 2020.

Further benefits include a downstairs cloakroom and access to a convenient cellar that provides space for storing wine or for general storage.

The first floor of the house provides a spacious and well-proportioned principal bedroom with fitted wardrobes and windows offering ample light. Two further bedrooms and a family bathroom complete this floor.

There is the potential to extend into the loft and to the side off the kitchen to further enhance the space if required by the new owners, subject to the usual planning consents being obtained via Richmond borough council.

The property is situated in a quiet residential road and is perfectly located for local Richmond amenities, as well as the many attractions the area has to offer including Richmond Green, Richmond Park, The Thames Towpath, Ham House and Garden and Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew.

The house is located in an area renowned for its exceptional schools. Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' schools include Deer Park School (0.36 mile), The Vineyard School (0.37 mile), Marshgate School (0.52 mile), Orleans Park School (0.94 mile), Grey Court School (1.52 miles) and Radnor House (1.88 miles).

Halford Road is positioned within close proximity of Richmond town centre. Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to central London via both South West trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow airport is only 7.1 miles away and a direct bus (490) to the airport runs from the nearby bus station.
*All times and distances are approximate
