detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented house in Barnes village.

Location

The property is conveniently located for Barnes Village with its eclectic range of shops, restaurants, duck pond and The Olympic Cinema is within a short walk.

The open spaces of Barnes common and the award winning Wetland and Wildfowl Centre are also situated close by.

For those who commute Barnes station offers a service into Waterloo, whilst the red route bus service provides access to Hammersmith Bridge for the underground.

There are excellent educational facilities in the area including St Pauls', The Harrodian, and The Swedish School. For younger pupils there is St Osmonds (rc) and St Pauls Juniors.

Description

Cedars Road is a quiet cul de sac in the heart of Barnes Village, bordering the Common.

The house benefits from high ceilings, period details and has been modernised for family living. The generous hallway leads through to all ground floor rooms with the fully fitted kitchen/breakfast room to the front and two grand receptions to the rear. All rooms retain their period fireplaces, the dining room leads through to a beautiful conservatory creating lots of natural light and views onto the private garden and common. The garden has direct access to Barnes common and features a storage shed with spiral wine cellar.

The principal bedroom is located on the first floor, with en suite bathroom, built in wardrobes and views over the common. There are two further large double bedrooms, both with built-in wardrobes and a guest WC on the first floor.

The second floor features two further double bedrooms, a family bathroom with separate shower and bath. The utility room is located on this floor.

Square Footage: 3001 sq ft

detailedDescription:
An exclusive riverside apartment in the prestigious Harrods Village development, with allocated underground parking.

Location

Harrods Village is situated close to Hammersmith Bridge making it an ideal location for those who commute into Central London. There is a range of local shops, restaurants and riverside pubs close to the property.

Barnes Village with its eclectic range of boutiques, restaurants and pretty duck pond is just a short drive. Nearby Hammersmith Broadway offers a more comprehensive range of High Street brands, a theatre and a cinema complex.

The property is close to highly regarded schools such as St Paul's School, The Harrodian and The Swedish School.

Description

William Hunt Mansions is located within an iconic riverside depository building and forms part of the exclusive Harrods Village development in Barnes.

This wonderful two bedroom apartment is on the fourth floor offering spectacular river views. The property is approached from the front of the building with stone steps leading up to the communal front door with an entry phone system. The communal hallway has a lift and stairs with access to upper and lower floors.

The apartment opens into a central hallway with a guest cloakroom and attractive wood flooring which runs across the property. There is a large reception room with high ceilings and river views. A contemporary kitchen offers an extensive range of fitted units and cupboards with fully integrated appliances. A useful utility room is conveniently located off the kitchen. Alongside are two double bedrooms both with fitted wardrobes and one with a stylish en suite bathroom. There is also a modern guest bathroom.

The apartment also benefits from an allocated underground parking space, 24 hour security/concierge at the entrance gates seven days a week, a private health complex with a 25 metre swimming pool, saunas, steam rooms, a gym and a business centre.

Square Footage: 1313 sq ft

detailedDescription:
Enjoy your new freedoms in your new home.

A beautiful new 1270 sq ft (approx.) two bedroom two bathroom apartment with private, covered and secured parking in the exclusive Boat Race House riverside development.

The apartment has a large south facing open plan kitchen, dining and living room. The kitchen benefits from integrated Miele appliances, a wine cooler, a breakfast bar and stone worktops. The is a also a separate utility room off the kitchen.

There is a spacious master bedroom with walk-in wardrobe and en-suite, a large double second bedroom and a large family bathroom. Boat Race House is a boutique riverside development which is located next to the finishing post of the historic annual Oxford and Cambridge Boat Race – a world famous London event since 1892. Furthermore residents have immediate access to cycle routes and the pathways that run along the banks of the river. Regular buses go to Richmond and Hammersmith for further access to the City on the District, Piccadilly and Hammersmith and City Lines. Heathrow airport is 13 miles and Gatwick 31 miles.

detailedDescription:
No chain. An 1148 sq ft three-bedroom, two bath/shower room ground floor apartment with a secure gated garage, presented in excellent condition throughout, located in the ever-popular Courtlands development, with its beautiful paddock and lakeside gardens in Richmond. The apartment has a large open plan south facing kitchen reception room, which leads to a private south facing balcony. Kitchen is equipped with Bosch and Neff integrated appliances along with an integrated Brita water filter system. There is solid oak flooring throughout the apartment, ample storage with modern fitted wardrobes to all three bedrooms and a large ensuite to the master and a bath and separate shower in the family bathroom.

Located within the catchment for Ofsted outstanding state primary schools St Elizabeth's, Marshgate, Holy Trinity and Sheen Mount along with the much sought after and highly regarded Kings House Schools. East Sheen Common is practically on the doorstep with wonderful woodland walks to Richmond Park, London's largest Royal Park, home to roaming deer. Richmond town centre is within easy reach, providing fast mainline links into London Waterloo and direct underground links into London Victoria. Richmond town centre and riverside walks, have an enviable wide range of shops, bars and restaurants, whilst Richmond Hill is a few hundred yards away, providing access to the beautiful Terrace Gardens, with incredible views of Petersham Meadows and river Thames.
EPC D potential C

detailedDescription:
This magnificent and architecturally exquisite double fronted detached Victorian house provides extensive and beautifully proportioned lateral family accommodation of 2,670 sq. Ft. Over three floors.

The house occupies a large plot with ample off street parking. Internally the floor plan allows equally for elegant entertaining and informal family life and displays many splendid period features. Upstairs, all the bedrooms are of a generous proportion with en-suite to the main bedroom and two further bathrooms. There is also the use of a large basement.

To the rear of the property is a 53ft rear garden with garage.

Situation
Stanley Road is within a few hundred yards of Teddington High Street, with its charming array of boutiques, shops and restaurants and Teddington train station which offers a direct service into London Waterloo. Bushy Park is also within a few hundred yards and provides hundreds of deer inhabited acres, as an ideal retreat from the stress of daily life. Local schools, both private and state, enjoy an excellent reputation.

detailedDescription:
Set at the end of a cul-de sac close to Twickenham town centre, this Tardis of a house benefits from off-street parking to the fore, a south facing garden and a versatile layout over two floors. The accommodation comprises, wide entrance hall with space for coats, cozy but good-sized reception room to the fore with feature fireplace leading to the kitchen and double doors through to the rear reception, the L-shaped kitchen/diner/ family room to the rear offers a good deal of natural light, a utility room, smart worksurfaces, ample space for the modern family, dual bi-folding doors to the garden and wood-burner. The garden is private, sunny and currently has a studio set up. To the first floor, a wide landing and four good double bedrooms, the master of which with fitted wardrobes and ensuite shower room. The house also has a further parking space demised on the road.

Grimwood Road runs off Whitton Road and by virtue is close to local amenities and bus-routes. Twickenham Railway station with its fast links to London Waterloo is a very short walk, as is Twickenham town centre and the River Thames and by car the A316 and motorway network are a short drive. The house is also in catchment for some of the areas finest schooling, and Grimwood Playground is moments away.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful, detached family house with three good sized bedrooms, two bath / shower rooms, a lovely west facing private rear garden and offered for sale with no chain. Much loved by the current owner, this family home offers very good potential for improvement and extension, all of which is subject to the usual consents. Warwick Close is a highly desired road in the ‘Ormond’s’ area and gives good access to sought-after local schools, Hampton open air swimming pool and Hampton village with its railway station and amenities. The gates of Royal Bushy park and the amenities of Hampton Hill High Street are all close by.

A timber front door leads to the spacious entrance hallway with a double-glazed frosted window, built-in under stairs storage cupboard, tiled flooring and doors to all rooms. There is a fully tiled cloakroom W.C with a pedestal wash hand basin, chrome heated towel rail and a double-glazed frosted window. The kitchen is garden facing and has a range of modern fitted units with an integrated stainless steel Neff double oven, ceramic hob and extractor fan. There is an integrated Neff dishwasher, space for an upright fridge freezer, concealed wall mounted gas central heating boiler and tiled flooring. Light floods in through a side aspect double glazed window and double-glazed French style doors to the garden. The main through reception room has ample space for sitting and dining reception areas, a double-glazed bay window and a character feature fireplace. A squared arch leads to the conservatory which is being used as a family reception room and has double-glazed sliding doors to the garden. An inner hallway leads to the third bedroom / additional reception room with a front aspect double glazed window. There is a fully tiled and modern fitted shower wet room and W.C with a wall mounted shower attachment, vanity sink unit, heated towel rail, double-glazed window and an extractor fan.

Stairs lead to the first-floor landing with access to loft space via a pull-down ladder and doors to all rooms. The master bedroom is a bright, double aspect room and far-reaching views towards Bushy park can be enjoyed. There is a double-glazed bay window and a range of built-in wardrobes. The second double bedroom is front aspect, also provides attractive views, has a built-in wardrobe and an airing cupboard houses the hot water tank. There is a fully tiled family bathroom and W.C with a bath with a wall mounted shower attachment, vanity sink unit, radiator and double-glazed frosted window.

Outside there is a paved front garden with shrub borders and where trees and shrubs sit on a raised bed. Two driveways provide off street parking and there is lighting and a dwarf wall. Secure pedestrian side access leads to a wonderful west facing private rear garden which is mainly laid to lawn. There are tree, flower and shrub borders, three sheds, multiple outside power supply points and a tap.

detailedDescription:
Designed to provide the best mix of property and the water, this 2 bedroom yacht-house is modelled on modern streamline motor yachts yet appointed to allow high ceilings, excellent natural light, picture windows and great views.

Accommodation comprises stylish open-plan integrated kitchen and dining area with solid wood flooring and bi-fold doors leading to a large entertaining deck. On the lower floor a large reception room below an atrium has extensive views upstream whilst the spacious master bedroom with en suite bath and shower has wrap around windows looking downstream. The second bedroom with en suite looks directly out onto the river. There is a separate guest WC and various utility areas and there is the potential to easily add a 3rd bedroom should a buyer require and plans can be provided for this from the owner.

This outer well insulated vessel with full heating and air conditioning has uninterrupted views and is the trophy of three yacht houses and is located on a well maintained secure mooring next to Kingston Bridge. The superb Kingston Town centre is a short walk away with its abundance of shops, restaurants, bars and gyms. Hampton Wick railway station is a short walk. Mooring charges are £11,200 per annum. detailedDescription:
A rare opportunity to purchase an end of Terrace Little Chelsea House.

The property is approached through a small front garden leading to an entrance lobby and in turn to the open plan reception room.

The reception room is double glazed and has french windows giving access to the courtyard garden and a door leading to a fully fitted galley kichen which leads to a part octagonal dining room enjoying views of and access to the garden.

On the first floor you find three bedrooms and the family bathroom and a paddle staircase leading to a spacious loft room with eaves storage cupboards.

As the property is at the end of terrace, there is a secluded courtyard garden paved in Indian sandstone and the attractive rear garden is generous and boasts side access.

Location:
The property is situated in the sought-after Little Chelsea, off White Hart Lane and close to the River Thames.

Little Chelsea has an eclectic range of shops. Restaurants as well as a Sainsbury's Local. Barnes village is closeby offering further shopping, the famous duck pond and the Olympic Cinema.

Barnes Bridge station is a short walk away and provides access to the Southern Region railway service to Waterloo.

There are excellent schools in the area and of particular note - St Paul's, The Harrodian, The Swedish School and Ibstock Place School. While for younger pupils there is Colet Court, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary School.

For the sports and keep fit enthusiasts, The Roehampton Club and the lta National Centre are situated closeby. The Riverside Health Club is to be found on the north bank of the Thames, whilst Barn Elms offers a wide range of sporting activities.

There is a rowing club at Dukes Meadow and for the walker and the garden enthusiast the open spaces of Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are within easy reach.

address: Teddington Riverside, Broom Road, Teddington TW11
detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Weir Cottage has a fascinating historical and architectural heritage. The current house was originally constructed around 1850, and then completely remodelled as a Victorian Arts & Crafts home around 1890.

At that time the architecture borrowed heavily from nearby Strawberry Hill House with motifs such as the turret and the distinctive window arches. In 1906 an architect named Ernest E. Fetch made the final structural adaptations to the house, and this is the home which has been completely restored today.

The property is arranged over two majestic floors and measures 2217 sq ft approximately. The house has been finished to an exceptionally high standard and has a number of charming architectural and period features, such as the distinctive chimneys, exterior iron working and the unique turret.

Internally the property has spacious and well proportioned rooms, with an array of features, with the striking inglenook fireplace, with its hammered copper finish being the centre piece of the reception room. There are oak floors with underfloor heating throughout the ground floor, fully fitted kitchen and a separate study perfect for home working.

The first floor provides a luxurious principal suite with en suite bathroom and an extensive fitted wardrobes. A further suite follows, perfect for guests or family, two more bedrooms and a family bathroom.

To the outside of the property there are your own private terraces to enjoy which create a stunning additional area to entertain family and friends through the warmer months. From your own private areas there are views over the communal gardens and towards The River. Further benefits include a Children's play area, River walk access and well lit out door areas.

With the sale of Weir Cottage you also secure two underground parking spaces and a 10-year blp warranty, from practical completion of the building works

Teddington Riverside sits in an idyllic position on the bank of the River Thames, overlooking Teddington Lock. It also has the very best of south-west London's culture, parks and schools on its doorstep, and is adjacent to the famous Lensbury Club hotel and spa. Teddington railway station is close by as well as the busy high street which offers an array of amenities. Other area attractions include: Kingston town centre, Richmond Park, Hampton Court Palace and Teddington Lock. Local transport links include: Numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to Central London (Waterloo) from Teddington Station via South West Trains (37 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways. Heathrow Airport is approximately 6 miles away, which is perfect for those who travel abroad often.

Geo-located between elegant Richmond upon Thames and the shopping haven of Kingston upon Thames, and only five minutes' drive from historic Hampton Court Palace and Ham House a lifestyle here would allow for instant towpath walks, cycling, rowing, and plenty of fresh-air and jogging in Richmond Park or Bushy Park. The development's landscaped gardens offer space for family picnics, outdoor yoga or just relaxing under a tree with a great book.

address: Maids Of Honour Row, Richmond TW9
detailedDescription:
Built circa 1718, as lodgings for the Maids of Honour attending the Princess of Wales, wife to George II, this Georgian terrace is considered to be one of the finest examples in the country.

Modernised extensively in 2007, the house functions as a modern family home with plentiful living space and a delightfully private south-west facing garden.

In 1744 the house was owned by Swiss Count Johann Jacob Heidegger, a leading Impresario of Masquerades in the 18th Century. Together with Handel, Heidegger was permitted to produce Operas at the Kings Theatre in 1729. In 1745, Heideggers friend and scene artist Antonio Joli, a pupil of Giovanni Paolo Panini decorated the entrance hall. The panels are topographical landscapes taken from Zeiler's Topographia Helvetiae, Merian's Topographia Italiae and also Fischer Von Erlach's Historische Architekur. Above the door leading to the staircase a painted music book open at the beginning of an aria from an opera performed at the Haymarket in Febuary 1745.

Situation
The house is located on Richmond Green and only few hundred metres away from Richmond's elegant town centre as well as the most beautiful part of the River Thames made famous by jmw Turner's paintings. Many boutiques and cafes populate the nearby street and lanes, along with a collection of mainstream retailers. Kew Gardens and Richmond Park, with its 2500 acres of stunning deer inhabited parkland, are also both around a mile away. Richmond station provides a fast and direct service into London Waterloo, plus District Line Underground and London Overground services. The A316 is close by and becomes the M3 after five miles, allowing a fast transfer to the M25 or continuation to the west. The opposite direction takes you directly into central London, with Hyde Park Corner being just over eight miles away.

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Teddington Riverside presents six exquisite 4 bedroom 3 bathroom Townhouses. The front door opens onto a wide oak engineered hallway with a coatroom. This hallway leads into a spacious and light filled living / dining room with a bespoke gas fireplace. The double balcony doors open onto a private gated back garden with views that overlook the communal landscaped gardens leading down to the River Thames. A bespoke fitted kitchen leads off the living room and features stone worktops, lacquered cabinets, glass splashbacks and integrated Siemens appliances.

The engineered oak banister staircase leads up to the first floor where leading off from the wide landing you will find the master bedroom with inbuilt fitted wardrobes and en-suite bathroom. The 2nd spacious double bedroom has it's own Juliet balcony with a Jack and Jill bathroom. Plus there is an additional storage cupboard off the hallway.

On the second floor you will find 2 additional double bedrooms with a separate family bathroom plus a large utility room housing a sink, separate washer and dryer with ample storage space and again a separate storage cupboard.

In all of the bathrooms, elegant high-quality sanitary ware is paired with stone wall tiles, porcelain floor finishes and electric towel rails.

Situation
Teddington Riverside is set in 2.5 acres of landscaped communal gardens and offers a rarely found standard of living on the banks of the River Thames.
title: 4 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
Weir Cottage is a four-bedroom detached home that sits at the entrance of Teddington Riverside. With its two gable ends and curved turret, Weir Cottage was formerly the original lock-keeper's residence, before becoming the official gatehouse for the world-famous Teddington Film Studios. Carefully restored to its former glory, Weir Cottage is destined to become one of southwest London's most iconic homes. Enjoy the stunning architectural details and uninterrupted views through the private garden down to the river.

Situation
Teddington Riverside is set in 2.5 acres of landscaped communal gardens and offers a rarely found standard of living on the banks of the River Thames.

address: Elm Bank Mansions, The Terrace, Barnes, London SW13
detailedDescription:
An elegant one bedroom apartment within a desirable period mansion block located close to the heart of Barnes Village and within 100 yards of both the River Thames and Barnes Bridge station, with its excellent commuter links.

This charming apartment is presented in immaculate condition throughout. The entrance hallway features oak finish flooring which continues through to the reception room. The space includes a large storage cupboard with floor to ceiling built-in shelving and lighting.

To the right of the hallway is the bathroom, which is fully tiled with heated towel rail and bespoke built-in mirror cabinets with under lighting. The sink offers additional storage with cupboards placed underneath. The well-appointed kitchen, benefiting from two large sash windows offers an excellent southerly view, jet black granite worktops, gloss cream linear cupboards, with Miele, Bosch and AEG appliances and marble tiles.

To the front of the apartment is the spacious reception room which has four sash windows, providing an attractive view over greenery from a superb easterly aspect. The room also provides high ceilings and a stone feature fireplace with coal effect gas stove, blending both modern conveniences with traditional features. Next to the reception room is the bedroom with fitted ivory carpet and built-in wardrobes. This highly-regarded Edwardian Mansion block benefits from well tended gardens, secure bicycle storage facilities and attractive views over the River Thames.

Located on Elm Bank Gardens, a quiet tree lined street off the Terrace. The property is ideally located for the shops, cafes, restaurants and amenities on White Hart Lane and Barnes Village. Barnes Bridge station is moments away providing fast and easy access into London Waterloo and to Heathrow Airport. The close proximity of both the M3 and M4 motorways makes access to the south and west very easy.

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Popes Avenue is a quiet tree-lined residential road within walking distance to the local amenities and numerous excellent schools. Set only moments from Twickenham Green, this delightful five bedroom detached house is arranged over 2,300 sq ft. With a north east facing garden.

The beautifully bright accommodation offers a seamless blend of entertaining and bedroom space. On the ground floor, there is a large entrance hall that leads to a generous reception room boasting hardwood floors, a feature fireplace and French doors providing direct access to the garden. Beyond, and to the rear of the house, there is a beautifully extended kitchen complete with a breakfast bar and a wonderfully light conservatory/dining room, again with French doors leading out to the landscaped rear garden. There is additional side access to the house via a door located in the utility room and accessed through the kitchen. The ground floor is completed by a further reception room with a feature fireplace and bay window, a generous home office/sitting room and a cloakroom.

Upstairs, there is a spacious landing providing access to three large double bedrooms with views over the garden, a further double bedroom with a bay window and a single bedroom with views over the front of the house. There are two family bathrooms and plenty of storage space which complete this floor.

The property further benefits from access to a generous loft that provides ample storage and the opportunity to extend subject to the usual planning permissions. The house has secure off-street parking and a separate garage.

The property is situated in an extremely sought-after area of Twickenham and benefits from access to an excellent array of shops, bars and restaurants situated around Twickenham Green.

The surrounding area is well-suited for family life with numerous recreational facilities close by including: Bushy Park, the river, golf courses, rugby / football pitches, cricket clubs and riding stables to name a few. Other local notable venues include: Strawberry Hill House and Garden, Orleans House Gallery and Twickenham Stadium.

Local Ofsted 'Outstanding' rated schools include: Twickenham Primary Academy (0.24 mile), St Richard Reynolds Catholic primary and high schools(0.47 miles) and Waldegrave School (0.47 miles).

Local transport links are excellent and include the mainline station at Strawberry Hill which offers speedy access into Central London, the M3 and Heathrow.

*All distances are approximate.

detailedDescription:
Description

A 'cool' & unique two bedroom home in the heart of the 'Royals' area of SW14. It features a wonderful 27ft x 26ft private garden, light & airy split level living space, superb storage, eclectic design, private side access and a highly sought after location Further features include exposed brick work, outside storage, refitted shower room, kitchen snug, skylight lanterns, sash windows as well as practical double glazing and gas central heating. There is a private front door with stairs immediately up to a raised kitchen/breakfast room with eating area, storage and an open view through to the back reception with stairs leading down to this lounge. The lounge is an eclectic space with a high level bookcase accessed via a wheeled library ladder, sitting/tv area, side door to outside and then bi-folding doors onto the garden. The first floor offers a landing with storage, a gorgeous shower room with sliding door, front bedroom with exposed brick wall and double glazed sash windows and a rear double bedroom with built in wardrobes. Externally there is a front garden and gated side path with an outside store. The private rear garden has been thoughtfully landscaped to create a tranquil, relaxing and sunny retreat offering seating areas and a covered 'natural' pergola. Queens Road is a highly sought after road in the heart of the 'Royals' area of SW14 with excellent access to Mortlake Station, local shops and amenities as well as a number of ofsted rated 'outstanding' primary Schools. Richmond Park and The River Thames are also highlights of the local area.

Acting as a focal point of the property, the courtyard provides a real feeling of Mediterranean living and offers fruiting fig trees along with views of the sky.

The first floor hosts the principal bedroom which benefits from a dressing room and en-suite bathroom with separate shower, two double bedrooms and a tiled bathroom suite. The second floor provides three further double bedrooms and another family shower room.

address: Station Road, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription:
Set behind low level brick walls, sits this beautiful four bedroom Victorian family home, offering over 1900 sq. Ft. Of accommodation. The original stained glass door opens into a welcoming entrance hall with access to a good size cellar and dressed with stunning period features which continue throughout, from three metre high ceilings, ornate coving and ceiling roses to feature fireplaces.
To the fore the formal reception room is a sight to behold with a multitude of period features, storage to the chimney recess and a feature fireplace with a working gas fire, perfect to nestle around on those cold winter nights, all beautifully illuminated through a huge box bay window, dressed with plantation shutters. A second good reception room overlooks the garden and has a plethora of bespoke shelving.
To the rear a stylish 'Häcker' designed kitchen/dining room boasts an array of cupboards, underfloor heating, fully integrated Siemens appliances, five ring gas hob and double oven, elegantly finished with white quartz worktops and bathed in natural light through dual aspect, with French doors that lead onto the garden.
The high ceilings continue on the first floor, which hosts two good size bedrooms, the majestic master bedroom to the fore spans the full width of the house with floor to ceiling fitted wardrobes. This floor is served by a luxurious family bathroom with twin vanity sinks, separate walk in shower and heated towel rail, as well as an additional, separate W.C.
The top floor flows naturally in keeping with the character of the house to provide a further two double bedrooms and a modern shower room, complete with walk in monsoon shower, heated towel rail and underfloor heating.
The south facing garden is mainly laid to lawn with easy-grass, planted borders and has a raised patio providing a fabulous 'entertaining terrace, ” ideal for al-fresco dining on those summer evenings. That all important side access, gives way to two timber sheds and a bike store.

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walk throughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

The light well-balanced accommodation is arranged over three floors, spans approx 1400 sq ft and provides an excellent blend of living and entertaining space.

On the ground floor and upon entering the property is an exceptional family room that spans the full length of the property and consists of an open plan modern fitted kitchen, dining and reception area. There is also a conservatory that provides an excellent play area and access to a decked back garden.

On the first floor, there is a generous principal bedroom with custom-built wardrobes, a double bedroom with views over Kew Green and a beautifully appointed family bathroom with a separate shower unit. On the top floor, there are a further two bedrooms and a shower room.

Set on Kew Green, home to Kew Cricket Club, the original main entrance to The Royal Botanic Gardens at Kew, Elizabeth Gate (0.3 miles), the Duck Pond, St Anne's Church and Kew Midsummer Fete.

Kew Green has a number of local shops, including a convenience store, numerous pubs and restaurants. As well as Kew Green being a space for residents to enjoy, the tow path of the River Thames is approximately (0.1 mile) away. Kew Pier (0.2 miles) runs (on a summer timetable) boats towards Westminster and Hampton Court.

Kew Village (0.8 miles) provides further shops, bank, pharmacy, a monthly Village Market and Kew Gardens Station (Overground and District Line Services to Richmond and Central London). Kew Green is also on the 391 and 65 bus routes into Richmond, Hammersmith and Ealing Broadway.

There are good selection of schools close by including Kew Green Preparatory (0.16 miles), Kew College (0.27 miles), Broomfield House (0.35miles) and Queen's Church of England School (0.27miles).

(All distances are approx.)

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An extremely spacious and stylish contemporary two bedroomed house offering almost 1800 sq ft living space situated in a converted factory on the banks of the River Crane, offering an excellent blend of living and entertaining space. The property offers off-street parking and direct river views and landscaped communal gardens.

On the ground floor, there is an impressive open plan reception area with exposed brick walls and vaulted ceilings. The stunning kitchen/dining area is located at the rear and benefits from built-in AEG appliances, a breakfast bar and double doors that provide direct access on to the riverbank. This floor is completed by a separate utility area and cloakroom with a shower.

Upstairs there are two generous double bedrooms, a beautifully appointed bathroom and a designated space for a home office at the top of the stairs. The impressive principal bedroom enjoys a Juliette balcony and benefits from a mezzanine level that provides additional storage space for the room.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Crane Mews is a gated development situated on Gould Road and well placed for access to Twickenham Town Centre and the Green.

The area also benefits from numerous recreational facilities close by including: Bushy Park, the river, golf courses, rugby/football pitches, cricket clubs and riding stables to name a few. Other local notable venues include Strawberry Hill House and Garden, Orleans House Gallery and Twickenham Stadium.

Local transport links are excellent and include the mainline stations at Twickenham and Strawberry Hill which offers speedy access into Central London.

title: 2 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
An exquisite garden apartment with stunning views

Location

This apartment is superbly situated at the summit of Richmond Hill, within just a few hundred yards of both Richmond Park (with its 2300 deer inhabited acres) and the sophisticated shops and restaurants of the town centre.

Whilst even closer at hand the local shops at Friars Stile Road cater well for day to day needs and have a lovely village atmosphere.

Just across the road are the beautiful Terrace Gardens, providing an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life and a shortcut to a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames.

Richmond train station has a rapid and direct service into London Waterloo, as well as the District line tube and overland to Stratford, via north London.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

This exquisite Georgian grade II listed duplex apartment has the most wonderful view from its principal reception room, over the River Thames, Petersham Meadows and the Thames Valley beyond. This aspect remains the only English landscape view to be protected by an Act of Parliament. Since the late 17th century artists have been attracted by the panoramic prospect of the meandering River Thames, verdant woods and meadows offered by this elevated position, and was perhaps best captured by jmw Turners incredible watercolours.

The apartment is tastefully presented and provides over 200 square metres of accommodation that is arranged over the raised and lower ground floors of this beautiful landmark building. Downstairs there are three good sized bedrooms that are served by three superbly appointed bathrooms and a large dressing area to the main suite. Upstairs the magnificent room proportions of the principal reception rooms are further emphasised by their fabulous ceiling heights, and the open aspects and large windows afford an excellent flow of natural light.

The apartment has a lovely atmosphere and its period integrity is beautifully intact. Other notable features include its gorgeous fireplaces, beautiful ceiling mouldings, a secure communal bike storage facility and a good length lease.

What is also particularly unusual about this apartment is the generous size of its private garden, that is partly walled and mainly laid to lawn.

Square Footage: 2167 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 117 years remaining

detailedDescription: Dating back to 1717 Ormond House is an attractive Grade II listed Georgian building steeped in history. Situated on a quiet residential road, conveniently positioned for easy access to the town centre and train station, the river Thames is also within a couple of hundred yards. Located on the first floor of this imposing building, the apartment benefits from a tremendous amount of natural light, with a south facing reception room. There is an impressive 14’-0” x 16’-5” master bedroom, two further double bedrooms, separate fitted kitchen, guest cloakroom and family bathroom. The impressive communal foyer entrance, leads to some internal bicycle storage and into a south facing pretty communal garden. Richmond is home to some wonderful open spaces, Richmond Green once famous for jousting and archery is now home to regular cricket matches which can be enjoyed by all. Richmond Park is London’s largest Royal Park and home to roaming dear, both are within a few hundred yards of Ormond Road. Richmond station provides fast direct mainline links into London Waterloo circa 18 minutes and direct tube links into London Victoria circa 25 minutes. The town centre has a sophisticated array of shops, boutiques and restaurants, and for those that wish to relax you can enjoy some beautiful riverside walks along the Thames. Richmond is also home to some of the finest Ofsted outstanding schools in the country, The Old Vicarage and Kings House are particularly sought=after.

The development is located on the River Thames, just on the other side of Richmond Bridge and on a particularly attractive stretch of the river. The Thames towpath is just outside the development and offers endless riverside walks on both sides of the river via Richmond Bridge.

Richmond town centre offers extensive shopping, dining and entertainment options. address: Lower Teddington Road, Hampton Wick, Surrey KT1
detailedDescription:
A fabulous lateral home in stunning riverside gardens

Location

Leander House forms part of this prime conservation area within just a few hundred metres of Hampton Wick mainline station, providing a direct train service into London Waterloo.

Hampton Wick also offers a quaint array of local shops for day to day requirements whilst just over Kingston Bridge (within approximately half a mile) the more extensive shopping amenities are available with many of the major retail outlets evident.

Local schools, both private and state, enjoy an excellent reputation, as do the many and varied local sport clubs, including the much acclaimed Lensbury.

The commuter is further served by access onto the A308 (within approximately three quarters of a mile) which in turn adjoins the A3, thereby providing access into central London and the City. The A316 is also within easy reach and adjoins the M3 at Sunbury or Central London in the other direction, via the A4. The M3 in turn adjoins the M25 Motorway, connecting Gatwick and Heathrow international airports.

Description

Discretely positioned behind a long driveway and set within stunning riverside gardens Leander House was built in the 1960’s and provides extensive and naturally light family accommodation (of just under 10,0000 square feet including the staff cottage) that is laterally configured over just two levels. Whilst lovingly nurtured and designed by our clients the property offers incredible scope for re-modelling, updating or rebuilding - subject to the usual local authority planning consent. The plot size and river frontage is particularly generous compared to other houses in the area and provides extensive mooring facilities.

The house lends itself superbly well to both formal entertaining and everyday family life and features an incredible split level indoor pool area with a vaulted ceiling. The garden and river aspects are exceptional and can be enjoyed from all the
principal rooms. The property also benefits from secure parking for many cars and a separate staff cottage.

Square Footage: 9735 sq ft

title: 5 bed detached house for sale

address: West Hall Road, Kew, Richmond TW9
detailedDescription:
West Hall Manor is a stunning and important Grade II listed period house in need of some renovation, set within delightful gardens and gravel drive to the front offering off street parking.

The current owner has been restoring the property sympathetically retaining and enhancing the abundant period features including panelled walls, fireplaces, box window shutters, good pine floors which make this property so enchanting.

Believed to date back to the 14th Century and rebuilt in 1724 the house arranged over four floors comprising generous, adaptable accommodation currently provides six bedrooms, three reception rooms and kitchen whilst the lower floor offers further light and spacious rooms with excellent stone floors.

The property is conveniently located close to the River Thames tow path, Kew Retail Park, Kew Village and Kew Gardens underground station.

detailedDescription:
Video Walkthrough Tour and Brochure on Available on Request.

This is a high specification penthouse with far reaching views which occupies the whole of the top floor of the building. The reception room and open plan kitchen benefit from dual aspect providing plentiful amounts of natural light and a panoramic vantage point perfect for entertaining. The kitchen provides a rather professional set up with three ovens and an integrated coffee machine. The work tops are granite and the cupboards have a walnut facade.

There is a master suite with a dressing room/walk in wardrobe and an ensuite. The en-suite has two basins, a shower and a WC. There are three further double bedrooms (one with built-in storage) and a family bathroom with a separate bath and shower.

The penthouse also benefits from a recently added home automation system, air conditioning. This architecturally interesting development has the benefit of a lift and secure underground allocated parking.

The penthouse is situated close to Richmond just off the A316 between Richmond station and the large Sainsbury's. Richmond offers two theatres, two cinemas and all the usual high street shops as well as boutiques and various eateries. Richmond station provides an overground service to Waterloo (from 16 minutes) and the underground (District Line).

address: The Coterie Apartments, 16 Willow Avenue, Barnes, London SW13
detailedDescription:
A wonderful two bedroom apartment with views across Barnes common and secure parking in the heart of Barnes village.

Location

The Coterie Apartments are situated in Barnes village which offers an eclectic selection of shops and restaurants. There is an active local community with a farmer's market, annual summer and food fair which attracts many visitors every year. There is also the duck pond, Barnes green and the River Thames.

Barnes and Barnes Bridge stations provide a service into Waterloo whilst there are good bus services to Richmond and Putney. Hammersmith Underground is also nearby.

The schools in the area include St Paul's School, The Harrodian, The Swedish School, Ibstock Place School. For younger pupils - St Paul's Junior, St Osmunds' (rc), Barnes Primary School.

Description

The Coterie Apartments were built in 2003 in Barnes Village, close to Barnes station and with secure parking.

Flat 9 is on the first floor, serviced by a lift, with an extremely light and spacious reception room with a large bay window overlooking Barnes Green with double doors leading out to a pretty balcony.

The contemporary kitchen offers both floor and wall units, built-in gas hob, oven, dishwasher, fridge freezer and a breakfast bar with French windows opening on to a second balcony.

A large cupboard in the hallway houses the washing machine and tumble drier.

There are two double bedrooms. The principal bedroom has an en suite bathroom with a separate bath and shower, complete with a walk in wardrobe. The second double bedroom has an attractive bay window with a shower room across the hallway.

Square Footage: 1384 sq ft

address: Staines Road, Twickenham, Middlesex, UK TW2
detailedDescription:
A wonderful three double bedroom Victorian end-of-terrace house full of character and many delightful period
features. The property comprises a bright and spacious kitchen/dining/ family room with bi-folding doors opening
out to a beautiful South facing garden. On the ground floor there is a tranquil through lounge – which boasts a
large feature fireplace with ornate surround and gas connection point in the first section as well as a wood
burner in second part of the room. To the first floor there are two bright double bedrooms and an elegant main
bathroom - all with period fireplaces – while on the top floor there is an impressive loft bedroom with a
contemporary en-suite shower room. The mainly lawned garden can be accessed from the side and has a large
raised patio ideal for entertaining and a Summer house excellent for storage. The house is positioned just a short
walk from Twickenham Green and within easy reach of Twickenham’s main shopping area. There are several
excellent schools nearby and both Strawberry Hill and Twickenham train stations service those in the area
looking to commute. An internal viewing is strongly recommended for such an exceptional property. EPC=E.

title: 3 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
This is a magnificent five bedroom detached family home located in a popular residential road within close proximity of Hampton village and offering further potential for extension subject to planning permission.

The property has been renovated throughout and benefits from having a bright entrance hall, 21ft living room, modern kitchen with separate lounge area, dining room and gymnasium, plus downstairs W.C.

On the first floor there are five bedrooms and four bathrooms, plus potential to go into the loft STPP. Outside there is ample off street parking at the front of the house and a large garden at the rear that is mainly laid to lawn with shrub borders and side access.

Hampton Village offers an array of boutique shops, cafes and there is a Waitrose food store within walking distance. Transport links are great with regular trains into London Waterloo, easy access to the M3 and M25 motorways and regular buses into both Richmond and Kingston town centres. There are many well regarded schools locally both state and private.

title: 5 bed detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A recently modernised two double bedroom second (top) floor apartment in a quiet cul-de-sac location in a popular part of Teddington near the River Thames.

Upon entering the flat you walk into a good sized square central hallway with two storage cupboards. The main bedroom provides built in wardrobes, whilst the second bedroom is also good double. The kitchen and living room face south / west, so good natural light and with views over the lawned communal gardens.

Internally the flat is presented in excellent condition throughout with fresh paintwork, and quality flooring. Other works implemented in the last fews years include; a new kitchen (2019) cleverly remodelled to provide space for large upright fridge freezer, as well as breakfast table and chairs. The kitchen also includes integrated dishwasher and electric hob (gas point if needed) with extractor hood and also houses an updated Worcester Bosch combination boiler. The bathroom was also re-fitted with shower over bath, W.C, wash basin and heated towel radiator. There is also an extendable hygienic shower hose.

Residents benefit from secure door entryphone, useful drying room off the landing by the flat front door, as well dedicated secure storage at ground level outside by the entrance - perfect space for prams and bikes.

It should be noted that our clients have just completed a lease extension, thus meaning the new owner will benefit from a long lease of 176 years with a peppercorn ground rent. EPC C

Location Bucklands Road is a turning off Broom Road leading to Sycamore Way with plenty of unrestricted residents parking. There are excellent schools nearby including Collis and Sacred Heart Primary Schools, Hampton Wick Junior and infant and St John's Junior, as well Teddington Senior School. There are many local amenities and superb transport links. Parkland and green open space is abundant with lovely towpath walks across Teddington Bridge & Lock into Kingston and Richmond.

Tenure Long lease 176 years remaining.

Service charge Payable at £900 per annum.

Ground rent Peppercorn at £10 per annum.

detailedDescription:

Forming part of this highly attractive period building, the property features a spacious, south facing reception room with character detail and magnificent views over the cricket square and towards St Anne's church, a 17' (approx.) master bedroom with fabulous elevated outlook to the rear, a second double bedroom, modern bathroom and delightful 14' (approx.) kitchen/breakfast room. There is also an internal staircase leading up to the flat roof area outside. Situated enviably amongst the attractions and amenities around the Green, moments from the River Thames tow path and within convenient walking distance of Kew Gardens underground station and Kew Bridge mainline station.

detailedDescription:

A truly charming freehold cottage on East Sheen's 'Parkside'. Plough Cottage is a wonderful and exceptionally desirable cottage boasting a large reception room, separate kitchen, two bedrooms, family bathroom and a lovely rear garden.

Description
This is an attractive period cottage boasting two bedrooms, plenty of character throughout and a rear garden. Plough Cottage is situated on a charming residential street nestled between East Sheen High Street and Richmond Park. Inside the house lies a spacious through-lounge, a dining area and an open fireplace. At the rear of the property is the kitchen which overlooks the lovely garden. Upstairs the house has two bedrooms with wardrobes and a family bathroom. 'Parkside' is regarded as a delightful part of the area with the houses being particularly well located for local amenities and schools.

detailedDescription:
A stunning 3 bedroom apartment on Richmond Hill

Location

Hillbrow occupies an enviable position within just a hundred metres of the shops at 'Richmond Hill Village', that cater superbly for day to day requirements and a provide a charming village atmosphere. Whilst slightly further afield Richmond town offers a wonderful and sophisticated array of shops and restaurants, as well as the much acclaimed Richmond Theatre - situated on picturesque and historic Richmond Green.

The stunning Terrace Gardens (also within just 150 metres) offer an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life and lead down to a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames. Richmond Park is also within a short and pleasant stroll (bypassing one of the finest views in the country) and has 2300 acres of deer inhabited woodland.

Richmond train station provides a rapid and direct overland service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Line tube and overland to Stratford, via north London.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are amongst the best in the country.

Description

This well presented and generously proportioned apartment is situated on the ground floor of this much acclaimed and well located purpose built apartment block at the summit of Richmond Hill. The decor is tasteful, with neutral tones further emphasising the excellent room proportions and superb flow of natural light. Other features of particular note include the stunning double reception room, a fabulous large entrance hallway, a share of the freehold and secure unallocated parking for the residents, that operates on a first come first served basis.

Square Footage: 1239 sq ft

detailedDescription:

The property is located on the ground floor of this modern purpose built block and benefits from being close to a variety of shopping outlets and amenities. There is a master suite with fitted wardrobes to one wall and an en-suite bathroom with both bath and shower. The second bedroom also has a built-in wardrobe and there is a further shower room. detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A spacious two double bedroom third floor apartment located in a purpose-built block and a popular residential riverside development in Teddington close to the River Thames. The property is offered for sale with vacant possession and no upper chain and is in need of refurbishment, offering buyers an ideal opportunity to purchase a property onto which they can place their own stamp.

The spacious accommodation briefly comprises: Communal entrance hall via secure entry phone system, with caretaker's office, lift to third floor, private inner hallway with storage cupboards, bedroom two/second reception room, kitchen, a large reception room with riverside view, bathroom/wc, master double bedroom with en-suite bathroom. The property benefits from double glazing, residents permit parking and communal riverside gardens. The vendor has indicated that this property will be sold with an extended lease.

Hamble Court is conveniently located in Broom Park just off Broom Road in Teddington, providing very easy access to Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames and Teddington. Royal Bushy Park and Home Park are also close by making this an ideal location of those looking to be close to local shops and amenities as well as green spaces.

Hampton Wick station is close by with trains to London Waterloo in approximately 35 minutes. A 3D virtual tour is available as are socially distance viewings, with viewing coming highly recommended. The vendor has advised that the lease has been extended bringing the lease to approximately to 157 years, service charge is £1,242.36 per half year and ground rent is £150 per half year.

detailedDescription:
An exquisite Queen Anne home of great period integrity

Location

The Vineyard is a highly regarded and conveniently situated road just off the lower slopes of Richmond Hill and this section of The Vineyard is particularly charming, with the eclectic mix of Queen Anne, Victorian and Edwardian architecture, together with the almshouses.

The house is within just a few hundred metres of Richmond town centre, which has a wide selection of shops, the much acclaimed Richmond Theatre, two cinemas and a sophisticated selection of restaurants and bars.

Fast access to the City and West End can be achieved from Richmond main line (London Waterloo) and underground station, which can be found within just a few hundred metres of the house.

Richmond Park and the river are also nearby and offer an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

Dating from around 1710 this architecturally beautiful double fronted family home is a wonderful example of a Queen Anne house and is denoted as being of special historic and architectural importance, by virtue of its Grade II listing. Its distinctive brick facade is relieved by beautifully regimented fenestration and a handsome pilastered entrance canopy, with a charming fanlight.

The house has a lovely atmosphere and its period integrity is beautifully intact, with a number of notable features. These features include panelled rooms, operational window box shutters, tall corniced ceilings, a flagstone floor to the kitchen and dining room, gorgeous fireplaces and a most elegant staircase. All of which are complemented by the tasteful presentation. Also of particular note is the magnificently proportioned drawing room, that was formerly a ballroom and features a striking floor to ceiling bow window.

There are many dual aspect rooms with open outlooks, thereby affording an excellent flow of natural light.

The house lends itself perfectly to both everyday family life and more formal entertaining and has a two storey self contained annexe to the side (that connects through to the house at the lower level), thus providing an ideal space for guests or older children seeking some independence.

There is a delightful and well proportioned walled garden that is predominantly laid to lawn and a generous hardstanding area that is gated and provides secure off street parking

Square Footage: 3818 sq ft

detailedDescription:
This elegant Grade ii-listed house is located on The Vineyard, a coveted residential street moments from the centre of Richmond and the banks of the Thames. It was built during the reign of Queen Anne and features wonderful Regency additions, including a ballroom that looks out onto the private walled garden through curved sash windows. Internally, the house exceeds 3,700 sq ft across four light-filled levels.

Setting the Scene

The Vineyard meanders north-east from the Grade ii-listed St Elizabeth of Portugal Church at its southern end, past a variety of almshouses and Clarence House, a 17th century Grade ii-listed house associated with Bernardo o’Higgins. O’Higgins was a Chilean independence leader who liberated Chile from Spanish rule in the Chilean War of Independence (1812-1826); he is commemorated on the wall of the property with an English Heritage blue plaque.

The Grand Tour

The house lies off a widening bend on a tree-lined section of The Vineyard, where an original red London phonebox still stands on the cobbled pavement. Entrance is via the west-facing garden, through electric gates which lead the way to off-street parking. Formal entry to the house is from the paved perimeter, where tapering stone steps bordered by hedges lead up to the raised ground floor. One of the Regency additions is the entrance vestibule, which extends the chequered-tiled hallway beyond an arched transom where the original door once stood.

To the right is the first of many reception rooms; a beautifully panelled drawing room with an open fireplace and shuttered south-facing windows, which extend across two aspects. To the left of the hall is a family room where afternoons can be whiled away reading; this is also used as an occasional study. Beyond lies the exquisite former ballroom, now a music and living room, with oak flooring and a slate fireplace flanked by bespoke bookshelves. Elegant floor-to-ceiling sash windows curve to frame superb views of the garden.

The lower-ground level is divided into two distinct sections, with a study/reception area at the southern end, and an open-plan kitchen and dining room at the other. This space has stone flooring and painted timber ceilings, as well as an automated electric Aga. From the dining room, steps lead up to the garden through French doors. To one side of the house is an independent annexe, linked to the main house through a storage passage behind the kitchen. This is set over two levels and has a kitchenette on the upper floor.

An ornate timber staircase lined with coir matting ascends from the entrance hall to the upper levels of the house, where two generous bedrooms can be found on each floor. These have charming views over the garden and have been carefully finished with a smart colour palette of blues and greens to create a distinct atmosphere in each space. On both the first and second floor, a bathroom and shower room lie between the bedrooms.

The Great Outdoors

The brick-walled garden is exceptionally private and largely laid to lawn. It can be accessed from the lower-ground dining area and several of the ground floor rooms. Mature trees dot the perimeter and in one corner there is a dedicated seating area for lunches in the warmer months – and the cooler ones, for those willing to brave the British weather. Further planting opportunities abound for those with green-fingered tendencies.

Out and About

Richmond-upon-Thames is a historic borough of south-west London that was formed in the 16th century during Henry viii’s reign. It was recently listed as the best place to live in the capital, following a government survey that noted its superb open spaces, excellent eateries, historic architecture, good schools and low crime rate.

The Vineyard is a particularly sought-after residential road near the centre of Richmond. It is within easy walking distance of the restaurants, shops and station at Richmond as well as Richmond Park and the schools for which the area is renowned. At the end of the road is Friars Stile Road, noted for its excellent and comprehensive collection of shops and eateries, namely Italian restaurant, La Luna di Luca, popular gastropub, The Malborough, l’Amandine Patiserrie and Coffee House, Richmond Hill Bakery and The Good Wine Shop. The Richmond Theatre is nearby, as is Petersham Nurseries with its excellent restaurant and garden shop. The River Thames is just a stone’s throw from The Vineyard – the perfect spot for a slow Sunday stroll, and a gateway into central London for avid walkers.

Quick access to central London is available from Richmond train station and Richmond Underground station, which lie a few hundred metres away from the house.

address: Mallard Place, Strawberry Hill, Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
A spacious townhouse with versatile accommodation including driveway parking and integral garage, forming part of an award-winning Span Development by renowned architects Geoffrey Townsend and Eric Lyons.

Designated a conservation area, Mallard Place, is a riverside development consisting of apartments and houses on a secluded stretch of the Thames with incredibly well maintained and thoughtfully planned communal spaces. Residents also enjoy exclusive use of an outdoor heated swimming pool, beautiful lawned gardens alongside the Thames with a pontoon, and private moorings are available on a 10-year licence - please enquire for further details.

Internally the main living space is arranged mainly over the raised ground floor level, with internal access leading down a garage / utility room as well as a large bonus storage area (with restricted head height), aptly named as a 'man cave" by the current occupants. Doubtless there are various other permutations of use for this space.

The first floor provides master bedroom with en-suite shower room (currently set up as a playroom) with a good second double providing built-in wardrobes, as well a main family bathroom. The previous tenants were using the loft room (second floor) as a third bedroom.

Externally there is a comfortable size garden with 'same-level' patio including brick plant retainer with steps down to the main garden area. There is useful rear access.

The property was comprehensively modernised in 2000 / 2001, but rented in recent years, so very much an opportunity for the incumbent to stamp their own mark. The guide price is sensible to factor general updating, accordingly we anticipate good interest.

"The test of good housing is not whether it can be built easily, but whether it can be lived in easily"

- Eric Lyons.

Location: Mallard Place off Strawberry Vale is midway between Teddington and Twickenham High Streets with a vast array shops, restaurants and amenities. There are excellent transport links nearby with a dedicated R68 bus stop linking Richmond and Hampton Court, whilst Strawberry Hill train station connects to London Waterloo. Fast trains to London from Twickenham.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful ground floor modern maisonette with two double bedrooms, private front, side, and rear gardens, and a garage in a nearby block. Templar Place is a lovely, quiet residential cul-de-sac close to Hampton Village with its railway station and amenities. Sought-after local schools, bus services and Carlisle Park, with its two play parks, cricket pavilion and bowling green are all close by. The property is leasehold and there is a long lease in-excess of 140 years unexpired.

An entrance hallway, accessed by a double glazed private front door has three spacious built-in storage cupboards, and doors to all rooms. The bright and spacious reception room is front aspect and has a large south facing double glazed window.

The master bedroom is a good-sized double room with a built-in wardrobe with further shelving and cupboard space above. There is a front aspect second double bedroom.

The kitchen breakfast room has a range of modern fitted units with integrated double oven, four ring hob and extractor hood. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine, space for an upright fridge freezer, tiled flooring, and a breakfast bar and space for bar stool. The modern fitted gas central heating combination boiler is wall mounted.

There are side and rear aspect double glazed windows, and a rear aspect double glazed door to the garden. The fully tiled family bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted white suite with a bath, with a hot and cold mixer tap and a handheld shower attachment. There is a wall mounted shower attachment, shower screen, vanity sink unit, chrome heated towel rail and shaver point. Tiled flooring sits on top of underfloor heating, and there is a side aspect double glazed frosted window. There is double glazing and gas central heating.

Outside there is a south facing, lawned private front garden with tree and shrub borders. There is a side garden with shrubs and outside tap and a shared driveway leads to the garage in a nearby block of two with an up and over door. The private rear garden is a real wow factor of the home and has paved and artificial lawned areas.

Location

A charming two bedroom maisonette situated to the side of an imposing and handsome period property with its own separate entrance.

Situated on the first and second floors, this delightful home has a light and airy feel with accommodation of approximately 1,000 sq ft.

description
A four bedroom semi-detached house filled with period features and generous living space on every level. This charming family home is situated on a welcoming residential street close to the amenities of the high street and outstanding schools. The property boasts a large bay window to the front with a front garden and access to the rear garden at the side. On the ground floor lies a wide entrance hall with under-stairs storage, a generous double reception room with an attractive fireplace, separate kitchen and a private garden with an open west-facing outlook. The first floor offers two large double bedrooms with generous storage and a stylish family bathroom with a bath and shower, plus an additional shower room to the front. Upstairs is a spacious loft conversion, with two bedrooms, a living area and great storage. The windows throughout the property have been refurbished, many with double glazing, and the rooms are bright and well proportioned. This is an ideal family home offering further long-term potential to extend on the ground floor and in a highly requested location. Outstanding schools are nearby as are Richmond Park and the River Thames.

detailedDescription:
Fabulous period family home enviably positioned on the highly coveted Manor Grove in Richmond.

The property comprises an impressive formal front reception room, flooded with natural light from a flat fronted window illuminating the linked approx. 21ft kitchen/dining room with separate utility room.

French doors open onto a perfectly formed, low maintenance garden complete with a garden studio room ideal for home working.

A beautiful wooden staircase leads to a spacious front bedroom with built in storage, a further double bedroom situated to the rear of the house & a family bathroom.

The top floor holds a primary bedroom suite (complete with en-suite bathroom) with wardrobes. Attractively offered to the market with no onward chain.

Richmond has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site. Richmond has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Richmond is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Richmond's exceptional transport links with both overground and underground lines running from the centrally located Richmond station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

address: Amyand Park Road, St Margarets, Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
Your own private entrance leads to this charming apartment with direct access to a huge south facing garden at the rear. Equidistant to St Margarets Village and Twickenham town centre, you will be spoilt for choice with all the facilities that are available within a 10 minute walk, including two train stations and the River Thames.

The property is set within an attractive Victorian semi-detached townhouse and forms the entire ground floor level of the building. To the front is a generous reception room with modern parquet wood flooring and a large picture window, providing excellent natural light. Adjacent to this is the principal double bedroom, with a full wall of fitted wardrobes and then a contemporary bathroom with white subway tiling. An internal hallway, with matching wood flooring, extends to the rear of the apartment where the kitchen and second bedroom are located. The kitchen is well appointed, has space for a dining table and provides direct access to the shared gardens at the rear.

The apartment further benefits from a long lease.

As mentioned, the property is enviably located between the cosmopolitan St Margarets village (with its great selection of shops, cafes and restaurants and St Margarets mainline station) and Twickenham town centre with its greater selection of facilities and a more regular train service to London Waterloo. There is also a weekly farmer's market. Orleans Primary School (Ofsted Outstanding) is within a few minutes’ walk, as is St Marys C of E Primary School. Orleans Park is also within a short walk.

There are several parks nearby, including Moor Mead Park and Marble Hill Park and the River Thames is within quarter of a mile.

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

This Grade II listed 4 bedroom family home has been meticulously renovated for modern day family living while keeping numerous period features.

Painstakingly restored and refurbished, Leonard House is set over 4 floors with an excellent balance of bedroom to living accommodation and is full of natural light throughout.

Entering through a communal main entrance, a private hallway leads to a grand formal reception room, with the dining room to the rear of the house. The main reception rooms have notable ceiling heights, herringbone wood floors and wood panelling.

On the floor below is the British hand-crafted eat-in kitchen with built in Miele appliances, a central island with hob and eating area, a further reception room, cloakroom/utility room and shower room.

On the first floor is the beautiful principal bedroom with feature fireplace, second bedroom, and a well-appointed bathroom again with fireplace. On the second floor are two further well-proportioned bedrooms, one of which is en suite, and a family bathroom with period fireplace.

To the rear of the house is the pretty landscaped courtyard garden, designed by Chelsea award-winner Heather Appleton to provide maximum privacy and a low maintenance garden.

A parking space is available by separate negotiation in the covered car park on Paradise Road, along with five years of car club membership.

Leonard House was formerly the home of Leonard and Virginia Woolf who set up the Hogarth Press at 34 Paradise Road. The Hogarth Press grew from a hobby of the Woolf's to a full commercial printing business. A commemorative London blue plaque is positioned on the front of the house.

The property is only moments from the fabulous amenities of Richmond including The Orange Tree and Richmond Theatre, numerous bars, restaurants, fabulous shops, boutiques and the two cinemas. Local places of interest include Richmond Park (0.8 mile), Kew Gardens (0.9 mile), Twickenham Stadium (2.0 miles) and Ham House (1.5 miles).

Schools in the area include King's House School (0.5 mile), Old Vicarage School (0.4 mile), Marshgate Primary School (0.7 mile), The Vineyard School (0.5 mile) and The German School (1.3 miles)

Local transport links include numerous bus routes to surrounding areas, plus fast and frequent trains to central London via both South West trains (Waterloo 19 minutes) and London Underground's District Line (West End 38 minutes). The property is well placed for access to the A316/M3, M4 and M25 motorways.

All distances and times are approximate.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Description

Positioned behind electric gates No. 4 is one of only two houses located on a private road within the prestigious Barnes Waterside. A spectacular contemporary home with flexible accommodation has been created after a complete architectural remodel.
The ground floor comprises a comfortable family room, a generous reception room with a contemporary fireplace, and bi-fold doors onto a paved terrace with a built-in barbecue, perfect for outdoor living. Elegant Dinesen engineered wood flooring extends across the hall and into the reception space. To the rear of the house is a stunning 39' kitchen/dining room with an abundance of natural light offering a wonderful multi-purpose living space. There is a superb bespoke Bulthaup kitchen with fully integrated appliances, large central island/breakfast bar and underfloor heating. Full height sliding picture windows open onto the wonderful secluded 100' x 32 'south facing garden. Directly adjacent to the Wetlands with its 74 acres of birds and wildlife with the London skyline visible in the distance. A major feature is the bespoke sculptural staircase creating a sense of light and space. There is also a study, utility room/second kitchen, guest cloakroom and excellent hall storage.
The main bedroom is on the first floor with bi fold windows allowing far reaching green views, extensive wardrobe space, and a luxurious en suite bathroom with a separate glass double rain shower. There are 4 additional double bedrooms all with en suite bathrooms and benefit from unbroken, elevated views over the Wetlands. The second floor offers a further 2 double bedrooms and a luxurious family bathroom.
A secondary staircase within the house allows for self contained accommodation accessed from the driveway, useful for a granny or home office annex.

There is off street parking for several cars at the front of the house along with a double garage.

detailedDescription:
This beautiful Edwardian 1st and 2nd floor apartment has been completely and utterly refurbished, there’s not one square inch that hasn’t been carefully thought about and planned to provide a stunning apartment. Once inside however, it feels far more like a house than a maisonette.

The property has very spacious accommodation, the 3 bedrooms are all proper doubles, one with a very stylish ensuite shower room.

The stylish family bathroom has a shower over the bath.

Being West facing, the beautiful open plan kitchen/living room is flooded with light, and the square bay window and period fireplace are stunning features of this fabulous room.

The kitchen has a dishwasher, induction hob and electric oven, and large fridge freezer. The washer/dryer is located in its own cupboard away from the living area.

This well-planned apartment will make someone a very happy home.

detailedDescription:
This stylish apartment has been meticulously modernised to a very high standard throughout, whilst retaining charming period aspects.

The property consists of two large double bedrooms both with designated dressing areas, the master bedroom also benefits from a fully-fitted en suite. The high quality kitchen opens on to a remarkably large reception area with its decorative cornicing and parquet flooring. The reception area leads on to a private south-west-facing landscaped garden via full length bi-folding doors.

An astute internal layout and design allows flexible living. The property impressively offers underfloor heating throughout and a separate utility room.

Excellent transport links are offered by being positioned less than five minutes’ walk from Barnes Station with excellent links into Waterloo, plus bus routes from Richmond through to Putney.

This spacious and charming period corner plot maintains many of its original features and is positioned looking directly over Twickenham Green.
Located close to Twickenham Town Centre, Twickenham Mainline Station with direct links to London Waterloo, local amenities, local transport links, popular public houses and restaurants.
