detailedDescription:
This lovely well-planned apartment offers over 1000 ft.² of bright and spacious accommodation with the fantastic bonus of its own private patio/terrace. It features a stylish circular dining area with floor-to-ceiling windows, plus separate living area and a smart modern open plan kitchen. The master bedroom features in en-suite bathroom and there is a second double bedroom plus family bathroom also. Other features of the apartment include smartphone controllable heating and private parking. Residents can also enjoy private gym and swimming pool/Jacuzzi facilities, plus on-site concierge and security.

Situation
The Kew Riverside development is enviably situated on the banks of the River Thames and close to the world famous Royal botanical Gardens at Kew. Kew Village offers a selection of shops and eateries, set within an attractive village atmosphere and Kew Retail Park has various larger retail options including a major M&S with foodhall. Kew Gardens station offers District Line Underground and London Overground services to central London whilst Kew Bridge station offers regular services into London Waterloo.

Additional Information
Lease detials from January 1st 2001
Lease duration: 125 years
Unexpired lease : 104 years
Service charge : £4059 per annum
Ground rent: £908 per annum

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful 5 bedroom townhouse with stunning river views and off-street parking in the heart of Kew

Location

Enviably positioned between picturesque Kew Green and a beautiful stretch of the River Thames, the house is within just a few hundred metres of the main entrance of the unesco world heritage site, Kew Gardens. Kew Village is also nearby and has a charming atmosphere with a good selection of independent shops and cafes, a monthly market and the Michelin starred 'Glasshouse' restaurant. There are also numerous and excellent pubs and restaurants along this stretch of the river and also facing Kew Green Kew Gardens train station is located in the village and is on the District Line tube as well as the overland train to Stratford, via north London. A direct train service to London Waterloo runs from Kew Bridge Station, a few hundred metres away on the other side of Kew Bridge. The M4 motorway can also be accessed just over the bridge. Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

Set within an exclusive gated riverside development of just a handful of properties this four storey five bedroom modern townhouse was built around 1980 and provides over 2300 square feet internally. The house is tastefully presented and has an excellent flow of accommodation, providing superbly well for both family life and more formal entertaining. The stunning river views can be enjoyed internally from the two main bedrooms and the first floor living room, as well as externally from the two full width river facing balconies.

Other features of particular note include a communal tennis court and gymnasium for the exclusive use of the residents, a resident caretaker and off street parking. As well as the private garden there are beautifully tended communal gardens, that are well established and mainly laid to lawn.

Square Footage: 2312 sq ft

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A very attractive and spacious family house located on this quiet cul-de-sac road in Barnes. Presented in excellent condition this property is one of the larger on the road comprising four double bedrooms and at over 1500 sq ft of internal space.

It boasts a lovely double reception room through to a modern, extended kitchen / living room with doors onto a lovely landscaped garden. On the upper floors there are four double bedrooms, a family bathroom and a further shower room.

Lillian Road is nestled in behind the famous St Pauls School and just off Lonsdale Road close to a parade of amenities and independent eateries, whilst nearby Barnes Village is home to the well-known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. The Village offers an array of boutiques, cafés and High Street favourites.

There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

Hammersmith Station is the closet transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented apartment with one double bedroom situated on the second floor of this modern block, and with a long lease with in excess of 160 years unexpired. The property is located moments from Hatherop Park and gives good access to sought-after local schools and bus services. Hampton village with its railway station, amenities, Waitrose supermarket and village green are all close by.

A communal entrance hallway with an entry phone system and stairs leads to the second-floor private entrance. An entrance hallway with an airing cupboard housing the hot water tank has doors to all rooms. The reception room has ample space for sitting and dining reception areas. The kitchen has a stunning range of modern fitted units with an integrated oven, hob and extractor. There is space and plumbing for a washing machine, space for a fridge freezer, integrated microwave, side aspect double glazed window and tiled flooring.

The bedroom is a good-sized double room with a built-in wardrobe and shelving into an alcove. The family bathroom and W.C has a modern fitted white suite with a bath with an overhead shower attachment. There is tiled flooring with under floor heating and an extractor fan. Additional features include bamboo wood flooring, double glazing and electric heating.

Outside there are well maintained lawned communal gardens with trees and shrub borders. There is a covered and allocated off street parking space, and further unallocated residents and visitors parking spaces.

detailedDescription:
Purplebricks- West London are proud to present to the market this superbly modern designed family Riverside townhouse.

Ideally located on the private street, Chiswick Quay. Four floors with direct views looking both onto the river and Marina. The property features four large bedrooms.

This riverside house boasts the vast open plan sitting room that looks directly out onto the manicured gardens that flow directly down to the banks of Old Man River Thames. The first floor opens up into three aspects, the vast sitting room, split level dining area and recently updated modern kitchen with a three component floor to ceiling refrigerator, freezer and wine cooler. With the open kitchen, the chef is never left out of the conversation or river view. One large bathroom with underfloor heating. A three shower head wet room including a washer dryer closet on the top floor. A further ground floor cloak room also with washer/dryer. Indoor 3 car garage with electric door opener and 2 out side private driveway spaces & still plenty of free, on street parking for guests on the private street.

The property also displays a series of tasteful modern design features including Italian leather walls, imported stone, antique wood, under floor heating, zone selective Lutron lighting system, built in surround sound speaker system for the HD TV and Sonas System accessed through your mobile devices, a 4 person Hydropool hot tub in the roof top garden-enjoy the warm water over looking the river, wireless electric blinds. There is air conditioning in the south facing rooms of the house.

Situated for the A4 & waking distance to transport connections including rail, bus & tube. This home offers much beauty and tranquillity whilst being close to the High Road & all of it's bars, shops and restaurants. Close by also Chiswick house, Strand on the Green, Kew Gardens, Richmond Park & Syon House . Heathrow is 10.3 miles just down the A4 from this modern property.

Reception Room

The large reception area with floor-to-ceiling window and double door opening onto the terrace and communal gardens to the river - vast open living area with dual aspect light intake, Nordic pine panelling and many bespoke features such as brass fitted reclaimed lights and Cotswold oak solid steps.

Dining Area

The dining area-arranged as a mezzanine level to the reception area also on looking at the river and the terraced area offers a large dining space which is currently set with grand pieces of furniture, seating over 10 people.

Kitchen

A tastefully designed kitchen for those that love to cook and cater. Much thought has gone into the design of this well presented kitchen featuring bespoke & luxury imported appliances such as American dual door commercial fridge and full height glass drinks chiller. Another interesting feature of the kitchen is it's antiquities - a large pagan stone has been set as the fire back to the large Britannia oven - a charming and historic feature that compliments the bespoke brass sink beautifully.

Master Bedroom

Set on the top floor occupying the south west facing aspect. A large and bright master bedroom with built-in sliding door wardrobes. A concealed entrance to a large dressing room which could be made nursery/5th bedroom opening onto a large ensuite. The master bedroom posts the best views of the property yet

Master Dressing Room

The master dressing area could be presented as a fifth bedroom or nursery, the room offers large sliding fitted wardrobes and access to the pitched loft space. Direct access to Large ensuite bathroom with views over the Marina

Master Bathroom

A large beautifully presented master ensuite. Featuring his and hers sinks and showers, natural stone inset and feature sinks. This large bathroom also benefits from a airing and utility cupboard.

Roof Top Terrace

A large private sun. Terrace accessed via a full floor-to-ceiling glass doors. The Terrace offers ample space and a four man hydro pool.

Bedroom Two

A charming third floor aspect large double bedroom with fully fitted wardrobe area. Sea grass wall fabrics and a large floor-to-ceiling bay window with direct views over the gardens and river. The room also features a Bose smart music system with fitted speakers.

Bedroom Three

Yet another sizeable bedroom, front aspect with floor-to-ceiling windows. Large built-in cupboards and ample floor space

Bedroom Four

A rear addition river view room. Currently presented as a study with Nordic pine wood panelling and Hidden cupboards.

Sun Terrace

Set on the ground level in line with the gardens, This large terrace accessed via the glass doors from the reception room is directly south facing. A sizeable private terrace and dining area. The suntrap terrace benefits from a 4x3m counter lever designed umbrella system and tendered plant beds.

Communal Gardens

The development offers much green space and well tendered gardens. The Private terrace on looks the sweeping gardens down to the rivers edge.

Entrance Hall

An impressive entry - The reclaimed Scottish castle front door opens on to a large hallway and Boot area with access onto the garage, guest clock room and storage rooms.

Downstairs Cloakroom

Large guest toilet with storage currently used as a utilities area.

Storage Room

Set off of the garage a large and cool storage room

Integral Garage

A larger than average garage which could fit up to three cars. Some properties within the development have change this to residential use.

Off Road Parking

In addition to the integral parking the property offers a drive way for yet another vehicle.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

detailedDescription:
A lovely raised ground floor period apartment quietly and conveniently located within half a mile of St Margarets village and Richmond.

Ravensbourne House is a handsome, period apartment building with an elegant entrance hall and large communal gardens set in this quiet, sought-after tree-lined road in desirable East Twickenham.
This charming and well-presented raised ground floor apartment benefits from high period ceiling heights and well-proportioned rooms with a particularly spacious bedroom and both this room and the main reception room display handsome Victorian feature fireplaces.
The river and picturesque Marble Hill Park are also within half a mile. St Margarets station is within walking distance as is Richmond town centre with its picturesque Green home to the renowned Richmond theatre. Richmond also offers two cinemas, an extensive range of shopping and recreational facilities and many excellent pubs and restaurants. The station provides a fast and frequent mainline service to Waterloo, the District line tube and the Overground line serving North London.

Parrs Place is a quiet cul-de-sac in the heart of Hampton Village off Tudor Road and approximately 350 yards to Hampton Station, Village Green, local shops and the ever popular Waitrose store.

A bright and spacious two bedroom apartment in the heart of Hampton Village, close to local amenities and Hampton Station. The property has a well proportioned reception room which is open plan to the modern kitchen, two bedrooms and a family bathroom. There is parking for one car on a first come first serve basis and well maintained communal gardens.

Located in the heart of Hampton Village which is walking distance to Waitrose, various bars and restaurants and Hampton mainline station. Bushy park and the River Thames are also close by.

detailedDescription:
A stunning three-bedroom apartment set within the exclusive Royal Swiss Apartments development, in a picturesque setting overlooking Barnes Common.

Set on the second floor (with lift), the property is bright throughout and boasts a large reception room with a semi open-plan kitchen which leads out onto a private roof terrace. The excellent master bedroom has built-in wardrobes and an en suite shower room, and there are two further bedrooms and a separate shower room and cloakroom. All bedrooms have access to a private balcony. The property also benefits from off-street parking, a built-in sound system and video entry system.

Located just moments from Barnes Station, there is quick and easy access into Waterloo, Clapham Junction and Richmond, whilst the shops and restaurants of Barnes Village and Putney are all located within easy reach.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This spacious top-floor Victorian conversion apartment is conveniently located on Church Road and benefits from off-street parking for two cars. The property comprises three bedrooms (two doubles and a single or office), a large reception room with a separate kitchen and a family bathroom.

The property is located on Church road approximately halfway between Richmond town centre and Richmond Hill village. Richmond Hill is a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, the village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families and professionals, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary.
You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.
Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

detailedDescription:
Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Situated in a sought-after cul de sac, this light and well-proportioned four bedroom house is ideally positioned for access to Ham Common and Richmond Park. Rare to the market, this is a fantastic opportunity to purchase an exceptional family home.

The property is accessed via gates located on Ham Farm Road and forms part of a quiet enclave of only ten Mews houses.

On arrival at the property, there is a generous paved front garden which provides direct access to the rear garden and single garage.

The ground floor briefly comprises: Entrance hall, modern fitted kitchen/breakfast room and spacious open plan reception/dining room boasting double doors leading out to the paved 42' rear garden. The ground floor is complete with an additional reception/study (enjoying views over the front garden), utility room and cloakroom.

Upstairs, there is a generous principal bedroom with en suite bathroom, a further double bedroom with built-in wardrobes, a third double bedroom, a single bedroom and family bathroom.

The property also benefits from a good sized loft space for storage, off-street parking and beautifully maintained communal gardens.

Beechrow is located only two miles from both Richmond and Kingston, with their sophisticated array of shops, restaurants and boutiques. There is also a good selection of local shops at Ham Parade, within just a few hundred yards.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country. These include: The German School in Petersham (0.83 miles), The Russell School in Petersham (0.77miles) and Tiffin Girls' school in Kingston (0.53miles).

Richmond train station offers a direct and rapid service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Underground Tube and overland line to Stratford, via North London. The property is situated within easy reach of the A3 and A316, and is 7 miles from Heathrow Airport.

*All distances highlighted are approximate.

address: Brick Farm Close, Richmond, Surrey TW9
detailedDescription:
Bright and spacious newly refurbished apartment enviably positioned in Kew, Richmond. The property comprises of a luxurious kitchen with fully integrated appliances and a quartz worktop in the kitchen, Well-appointed reception room with access onto a covered terrace with far reaching views, 3 double bedrooms and a sumptuous family bathroom.

Further benefits include a separate storage unit and residents parking on a first come first served basis, and a well-maintained communal garden.

Circa 0.4 miles from Kew Gardens station (District line and overland) and 0.2 miles from The Thames River and Kew retail Park.

Kew has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site. Kew has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events.

Kew village market is held monthly and, in summer, Kew Green hosts the Kew Village Fete and cricket. Kew is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Kew's exceptional transport links with both overground and underground lines running from the centrally located Kew Gardens station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

detailedDescription:
Presented to the market in excellent condition throughout is this top floor, one bedroom flat located in a convenient position in central Twickenham.

The property has been well maintained and comprises a large, bright reception room with views over communal grounds, a fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and granite work surfaces, a three piece bathroom and a large double bedroom. Further benefits include, access to a large loft space, cinema system in the living room, ceiling speakers in the kitchen and bathroom, communal gardens, an allocated parking space and a share of freehold.

Sandringham Court is positioned in a no through road located off Twickenham high street and is ideally placed to take advantage of all that Twickenham has to offer, from the range of boutique shops in Church Street, to the ambient restaurants and delightful riverside pubs and walks. Situated within a pleasant walk to Marble Hill Gardens along the riverside and within easy access of both Richmond and Kingston with comprehensive amenities. Commuter links are excellent with Twickenham station providing frequent services to London, Waterloo and easy access to the M3 and M25 motorways and Heathrow Airport.

To arrange a viewing, please contact the vendors' sole agents Chase Buchanan.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A rare find... Central portion of an imposing historic building offering exceptional accommodation extending to almost 3,000 sq ft. High ceilings abound together with large window areas all combining to make this an exceptionally spacious and beautifully presented family home of distinction.

Forming the main central portion of a substantial period building set within a popular tree lined residential road that runs parallel to the River Thames and was formally the home of George Fitzclarence, earl of Munster and son of Dorothea Jordan mistress to Prince William Duke of Clarence (future King William IV),

This fine family home still retains a unique period ambience with large bright windows areas, elegant high ceilings and well proportioned rooms throughout. Comprehensive refurbishment has sympathetically transformed the property into a comfortable contemporary home finished to an exceptionally high specification and benefitting from a new roof, new wiring and plumbing, gas fired central heating and well appointed bath and shower rooms (all bedrooms are en-suite). Centre stage is the stunning open plan family living area which boasts a Poggenpohl bespoke kitchen complete with stylish Quarzite work tops and integrated appliances and features bi-fold doors providing wide open access to the garden. To the front of the property there is a good sized drawing room and large receiving hall which creates an imposing first impression.

Arranged over the first and second floors there are five double bedrooms each having an en-suite and, on the first floor, there is a useful plumbed laundry room. The wide garden to the rear extends to some 86 ft and has been newly landscaped to provide a large lawned area with raised deck to the rear of the property ideal for al-fresco entertaining. To the front there is off street parking for two cars.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantial five bedroom detached family home with almost 3000 square feet of internal space located in the heart of Strawberry Hill. The property has been lovingly maintained by its current owners and benefits from gated off street parking for several cars, a large garage as well as a heated outdoor swimming pool within a large west facing garden. Presently, the ground floor comprises a welcoming entrance hallway, two reception rooms, a formal dining room, an additional study / snug, an open plan kitchen / breakfast room, separate utility room, downstairs shower and W.C. On the first floor there are four bedrooms - three of them with en-suite bathrooms. The spacious main bedroom benefits from a walk- in wardrobe and a Juliet balcony with lovely views over the garden. The property further offers scope to convert the large loft space and extend over the double length garage- subject to necessary planning consents.
Strawberry Hill is Richmond boroughs hidden gem, which adjoins a beautiful stretch of the River Thames and is conveniently placed for Richmond, Teddington, Twickenham and Kingston town centres yet retains its own identity with a very ‘Village’ feel. There are several excellent schools in the area, many areas of natural greenery and both Strawberry Hill and Twickenham offer excellent commuter services into Waterloo. Houses of this nature are exceptionally rare so an internal viewing is strongly advised. EPC= D.

detailedDescription:
A beautifully presented, one double bedroom apartment on Teddington High Street

Located within the ‘boutique’ end of Teddington high street, is this incredibly charming, one bedroom apartment on the second floor of a period building. Accessed from the high street, the property is full of character and is immaculately presented throughout, including sash windows, a feature fireplace and high ceilings.

Fitted with solid wood effect flooring throughout, you enter into a welcoming reception hall with a useful storage cupboard, into an open plan reception/kitchen boasting three large sash windows fitted with plantation shutters, allowing plenty of natural light. A chimney breast also offers the opportunity to reinstate a gas fireplace if desired. The kitchen has high gloss cupboards, modern tiles, a ‘Neff’ integrated oven and a four ring gas hob.

A spacious, neutrally painted double bedroom benefits from a sash window, feature fireplace, high ceilings, storage space and an A/C unit. A modern and well maintained bathroom offers a three piece suite with over the bath shower, LED lighting and an LED wall mirror.

Incredibly well located, you will find local shops, restaurants and bars all within a 5 minute walk, along with the likes of Bushy Park and the River Thames only a short walk away. Additional benefits to the property include a new boiler, neutral décor throughout and a secure intercom system.

Lease: 107 years remaining

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Sale Agreed by Milestone Teddington – part of the Chase Buchanan network of offices... A rare opportunity to purchase a three bedroom, period property on a fantastic corner plot…

An incredible opportunity to purchase a Victorian end of terrace property on a corner plot that has been loved and cared for by the same family for over 60 years. Moments from Teddington High Street, this period property is in need of modernisation, however holds a host of original features such as high ceilings, cornicing, a ceiling rose, sash windows and currently covered up original fireplaces.

Currently, the property has two reception rooms to the ground floor with the original kitchen situated at the back. There is potential (STPP) to extend the property to the rear and side, and still benefit from a generous south facing garden due to the size of the plot.

To the first floor, there are three bedrooms and a bathroom still retaining their original features, with the option (STPP) to also extend into the loft.

The garden houses a garage to the rear, with a dropped curb and the option to park a car in there.
This is a wonderful family home and given that properties rarely come to the market in this highly sought after road, early viewings are strongly advised by the vendors' sole agents.

Location: Regarded as one of the premier residential locations in central Teddington, close to Collis primary school. detailedDescription:
Detailed Description

A truly stunning family home on this requested Barnes Village street, well-appointed throughout and offered in fantastic condition. The house is entered via a spacious reception hall opening onto a double reception room with feature fireplace and high ceilings. From the hallway, stairs lead down to a utility room and office which could easily be utilised as a fifth bedroom. To the rear of the property, a stunning eat in kitchen has been created with concertina doors out to the secluded west facing garden. Additionally there is a very useful courtyard with side access. Upstairs, to the first floor is a guest suite with front aspect and pretty views whilst to the rear is a wonderful master suite, with a dressing room and fabulous bathroom with freestanding bath and walk in shower. The top floor has been skillfully converted to create a huge bedroom, a family bathroom and a further guest bedroom. Ideally located just a stone's throw from the River and Barnes Bridge rail station, and a short stroll to Barnes Pond and the shops, cafes and amenities of Barnes High Street and Church Road. Fees apply.

detailedDescription:
A self-contained two bedroom flat with its own fabulous private garden and private entrance. Located on Church Road, the flat occupies a position that is extremely convenient for everything Richmond has to offer; the station and town centre are with just a few hundred metres and Richmond Green, Richmond Park and the Royal Botanical Gardens at Kew are also easily reached.

Situation
Richmond town centre and station are less than 1/4 mile away and reached via a direct main walking route. Many well known retailers and smaller boutique shops occupy the high street and surrounding roads and lanes, together with a wide range of mainstream and independent restaurants and cafes. Richmond station, with fast connections to London Waterloo via modern South Western Railway trains, plus District Line Underground and Overground services, is in the middle of the town centre, as is Richmond Green and the River Thames. Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are also located close by.

Additional Information
The ground rent is cira £80 p/a and service charge is circa £1175 p/a. Lease - 199 years from 1 January 1986 (164 years left)

detailedDescription:
Property Description

Spacious ground floor flat with tastefully renovated, period features, with communal garden, modern kitchen with integrated appliances.

Property Details

This stunning period building located on Hampton Hill is host to a beautifully presented one bedroom, split level apartment. The south facing living area benefits from high ceilings and continuous sunlight, giving the space an airy and light feel. An incredible ceiling period feature covers the whole living area, which along with the newly refurbished stained glass windows, truly takes your breath away upon first glance.
The kitchen comprises of a rustic wooden work top and contemporary storage space, with newly installed appliances fitted throughout. A modern bathroom with ample storage and updated fixtures is also located on the ground level. The sunken bedroom still benefits from natural light whilst also feeling cosy in the winter. Fitted wardrobes line the walls, making the most of the unique space.
Local high streets accommodate an array of boutique stores, fantastic restaurants and independent coffee shops. Fulwell train station offers excellent transport links including a fast, direct service to London Waterloo. The nearby M3 and M25 motorways allow easy access across London, with other local amenities including Hampton open air pool, David Lloyd leisure centre and Hampton Court Palace within a walking distance.
A communal garden and private allocated parking space are also included.
Video Viewings:
If proceeding without a physical viewing please note that you must make all necessary additional investigations to satisfy yourself that all requirements you have of the property will be met. Video content and other marketing materials shown are believed to fairly represent the property at the time they were created.

detailedDescription:
An attractive four bedroom Victorian house of approx. 1869 sq ft, located in the ever popular area of Little Chelsea in Barnes, with proximity to the Ofsted Outstanding Rated, Barnes Primary School.

Boasting excellent living accommodation including a double reception through to a stunning kitchen with lots of natural light and further to a good size garden with patio and minimal maintenance artificial grass. There are four bedrooms, a large family bathroom, two further shower rooms and excellent fitted wardrobe space. There is a further storage area and patio in the basement and a separate modern studio in the garden which is perfect as a home office / study or further living space.

White Hart Lane is a popular road in Barnes, close to the river Thames and local amenities, boutiques and eateries such as Orange Pekoe and the Rick Stein restaurant. Transport links are close by at Barnes Bridge Station, with regular services into London Waterloo.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
It’s hard to find a sensibly priced home in central Barnes that offers great space and a prime village location. Well, this has both.

The living room has beautiful large windows and a small balcony that’s perfect for a morning coffee with a friend or a 6pm glass of wine as you watch the world go by.

The kitchen would appeal to the inner chef in anyone – black composite worktops, oodles of storage plus capacity to comfortably seat six for dinner. With that and the reception room, you have a perfect entertaining zone. Two of the 3 bedrooms are proper doubles, and the 3rd would make a very decent home office or nursery. There are also 2 bathrooms which will stop any squabbling and copious amounts of storage including a huge loft space. This heavenly home will make anyone very happy indeed.

The river plays a major role in life here, with the University Boat Race a highlight of the year; Barnes Common provides a huge open space, but a saunter down the towpath is just as entertaining and will lead you to the Wetlands Centre where you can explore the wonderful wildlife.

Communications are excellent: Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations have regular trains into Clapham Junction and Waterloo, or (once the river crossing is sorted) you could nip over to Hammersmith (District, Piccadilly, Hammersmith & City). Both Gatwick (by train) and Heathrow are easily accessed, as are the M3/M4 motorways famous for its productions as well as all the beauty of Richmond Park on your doorstep in which to externalise, there is always something to perk up your day. Heathrow is 20 minutes (on a good day).

Further benefits include fine elevated views to both the front towards Kew Green and St. Anne's church and to the rear towards the Royal Botanic Gardens. Enviably located moments from the Elizabeth Gate entrance to the Gardens, the River Thames tow path and the atmospheric restaurants, pubs and shops around the Green whilst Kew Bridge mainline station and Kew Gardens underground station are all within convenient walking distance. Many of the highly regarded local primary schools are also within easy reach.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Beautifully renovated and extended ground floor two-bedroom period maisonette, offering spacious and bright living with a private landscaped garden. Just moments from Kew Garden station.

This impressive lateral maisonette has a flexible open plan living area, consisting of a high quality kitchen with integrated Bosch appliances, Sonos sound system and beautiful feature brick wall, leading to a low maintenance, private rear garden.

The property benefits from a newly installed bathroom and 2 well positioned double bedrooms. The primary bedroom has fitted wardrobes, offering plenty of storage. A fully glazed door leads to a small courtyard.

There has been a newly installed bathroom, as well as integrated speakers and underfloor heating. Additionally new double glazed windows and doors have been fitted throughout.

Offered to the market with no onward chain.

Kew has its own distinctive, unrivalled identity which charms residents and visitors alike. Its individuality stems from those highly desirable amenities associated with metropolitan living, independent shops, chic cafes, restaurants and public houses, combined with the tranquil charms of The Thames riverside, the proximity of Richmond Park and, of course, The Royal Botanic Gardens (Kew Gardens) world heritage site. Kew has a strong sense of community as demonstrated by the hugely popular local events. Kew village market is held monthly and, in summer, Kew Green hosts the Kew Village Fete and cricket. Kew is the perfect place for buyers looking for an idyllic environment to bring up a family, with exceptional schooling options in both the private and state sector. Another bonus is Kew's exceptional transport links with both overground and underground lines running from the centrally located Kew Gardens station, the close proximity of the M3 and M4, and the A4 providing easy access to central London.

address: High Street, Hampton Wick, Kingston Upon Thames KT1
detailedDescription: Exceptional £/sq ft value - A very well presented, self contained, "duplex" apartment (with a private roof terrace) offering some 1400 sq ft of accommodation (gross internal area). So, bigger than many 3 or even 4 bed family houses - and twice the size of most 2 bed cottages! Both a 3D and a standard floor plan attached. At the asking price of £550,000, this equates to a £ per sq ft rate of just £392 / sq ft - exceptionally good value, in our view. The apartment has its own front door at ground level, with stairs then leading up to the first & second floors of this handsome, period building, with elevated views looking down Hampton Wick High Street, from the large picture window - a feature of the large "L" shaped open plan Kitchen / Living / Dining room at 1st floor level. A door from the Kitchen / Breakfast room leads onto a secluded, private roof terrace (16'9"x 12'8"). There is a WC / Cloakroom off the 1st floor landing. On the top floor is a large, rear aspect Master Bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a family bathroom and a 2nd / Guest Bedroom with study area and an en suite shower room. All in all a very spacious apartment (with lots of cubic volume as well as simply lots of actual floor space) ideal for those wanting a Hampton Wick base for entertaining, etc., and also with the ability to "lock up and leave", for those with second homes, etc. Excellent, central location, close to all transport links, Kingston town centre, the River Thames and Royal Bushy and Home Parks. Sole Agents. Viewing highly recommended.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A wonderful 4 bedroom house, presented in excellent condition on the ever popular Barnes Waterside. This property boasts a lovely and recently updated landscaped rear garden facing west and it benefits from plenty of natural light throughout.

To the front of the house there is off street parking for two cars. On the ground floor there is a well maintained kitchen with excellent storage space and a conservatory / dining area which leads to the garden, a w/c and internal garage. On the first floor there is a large reception room with Juliette balconies and a second reception room / study or fourth bedroom. On the Second floor there are three double bedrooms including the main bedroom with a modern en-suite bathroom and upgraded wardrobes and additionally a separate updated bathroom.

There is Planning Permission for a ground floor rear extension ref 18/1455/hot and scope to extend the property into the loft, subject to the required planning / Estate permissions.

Located just off Castelnau, offering a balance of village-style living and boasts a parade of amenities and independent eateries, whilst nearby Barnes Village is home to the well-known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. The Village offers an array of boutiques, cafés and High Street favourites.

There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

Hammersmith Station is the closet transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

address: Normansfield Court, Langdon Park, Teddington TW11
detailedDescription:
A sophisticated two double bedroom, two-bathroom, first floor apartment (lift serviced) within this elegant Victorian building surrounded by beautifully established gardens and grounds.

This spacious apartment is full of natural light due to its south / west aspect and occupies a favourable position at the front of the grand main building, therefore boasting the best views over beautifully tended lawns and established trees. These views are gained from all principal rooms, both bedrooms feature large box sash windows, whilst the living room, provides a deep bay window currently set-up as dining alcove. The accommodation is well configured with unusually high ceilings - ranging between 2.85 - 3m - giving a good overall feeling of space. A particular feature of the apartment is good storage provision, as well as engineered oak flooring 'wide board' style throughout (excluding wash facilities which are tiled and provide underfloor heating). A modern kitchen with open-plan arrangement to good size living / dining room. The kitchen well equipped with granite work tops and includes all the necessary integral appliances. Additionally, there is a useful utility cupboard off the kitchen. Both bedrooms are good doubles, almost replicated in size; the main bedroom with ensuite bathroom and vast wardrobe, whilst the second bedroom enjoys use of an independent shower room.

Residents enjoy the security of video entry-phone facility (three separate entrances) and lockable mailboxes under cover in the rear foyer. The main entrance with imposing staircase, original tessellated tiled floor, and decorative plaster cornicing sets the tone of the overall charm and splendour on offer. Residents also have exclusive use of a large and well-equipped Gymnasium as well as two secure bike stores. The gym is located to the basement of nearby Mary Crellin House (to the rear), and benefits from an adjoining studio room which provides plenty of space to accommodate Yoga / Pilates.

Externally visitor parking is found near the main entrance, whilst the dedicated parking space for this apartment is in the front parking area.

History: The site was once home to the Langdon Park Victorian Hospital, renowned for its connection to Sir John Langdon Down, a decorated British physician, best known for his pioneering work with Downs Syndrome patients. The main part of the Grade II listed building is now converted into luxury residential housing with new apartments blocks added in the grounds to the rear, namely Normansfield Court and Mary Crellin House, built in 2013 and 2014 respectively.

Tenure: Long lease of approx. 146 years remaining

Service charge is payable at approximately £283 per month

Ground rent: £250 per annum.

Location: Teddington and Hampton Wick High Streets offer an excellent selection of quality independent retailers, bars, cafés, and restaurants, with mainline stations connecting London Waterloo in approximately 35 minutes. Kingston town centre with some of the finest shopping facilities in the south east is also easily accessible, whilst major bus routes on Kingston Road connect with Twickenham, Richmond and Heathrow airport. The River Thames is close by, as are the green open spaces of parkland in both Langdon, Royal Bushy and Home Parks. There are many respected schools in the immediate vicinity, all within walking distance such as Collis Primary, Sacred Heart, and Hampton Wick Junior and infant.

detailedDescription:
Large Semi Detached 5 double bedroom home in a highly regarded residential area with driveway parking and a west facing garden with a purpose built home office. Situated just 0.3 miles from local shops, Strawberry Hill train station and Thames Riverside Radnor Gardens, 0.5 miles from Archdeacon and St Richard Reynolds and within 0.8 miles of Trafalgar, St James and Waldegrave Girls School/Co ed Sixth Form.

Extended, loft converted and refurbished by the current owners to offer an impressive 2890 sq ft of well proportioned living space over 3 floors with high specification fixtures, fittings and floorings, double glazed windows, plantation style shutters, built in storage and stylish modern decor throughout.

Porch opens to the entrance hallway with doors to the study, the living room, a shower room and the family room with open access into the stunning kitchen/dining room at the rear. This light filled room has a stylish integrated kitchen with a central island/breakfast bar, a roof lantern and velux windows, space for dining/seating and access to the seperate utility room. Folding doors open onto the garden with a large patio, lawn, mature planting, bespoke home office and secure gated side access. On the first floor are 4 bedrooms and the family bathroom. Stairs lead up to the main bedroom with a shower room, built in and eaves storage and a juliet balcony overlooking the garden.

Located just 0.6 miles from Twickenham town centre, Church Street cafes and restaurants and Thames Riverside with a towpath walk past Marble Hill Park to Richmond.
EPC Rating C

The smart accommodation provides an open plan living room/kitchen, a double bedroom, an en-suite bathroom and direct access to a private rear garden. The property is only 3 years old and still benefits from an NHBC guarantee.

Chudleigh Road is ideally located to take advantage of all that Twickenham has to offer, from the range of boutique shops in Church Street, to the ambient restaurants and delightful riverside pubs and walks. Situated within a pleasant walk to Marble Hill Gardens along the riverside and within easy access of both Richmond and Kingston with comprehensive amenities. Commuter links are excellent with Twickenham station providing direct services to London Waterloo, frequent bus routes and easy access to the M3 and M25 motorways and Heathrow Airport.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming two double bedroom Victorian cottage, full of character, with independent upstairs bathroom and a lovely sunny rear garden, situated in a highly desirable conservation area on the Teddington / Hampton Wick border.

School House Lane Teddington has an individual charm all on its own with a wonderful architectural street scene featuring 'pastel-coloured' facades to the cottage rows. Similar to The Alberts in Richmond and Little Chelsea in Barnes. Local residents are rather proud of the community spirit here; highlighted by the success of the little orchard at the end of the Lane - an area for locals that hosts an annual summer party, Christmas carols, and a great space for children to play in.

Internally this house enjoys a nice balance between a modern interior with recent improvements, yet also displaying many character features to include two working fireplaces (one with classic cast-iron surround), original wide-plank floor boards and stripped-wood panel doors. The kitchen is a good size, laid with quality engineered-oak flooring, and caters for both dinning and sitting space, with double doors to the garden. Fitted appliances include five burner gas hob, double-oven with grill, dishwasher, dual washer/dryer and space for a tall fridge/freezer. There is also a useful built-in larder cupboard.

Upstairs is wider than neighbouring houses due to the 'flying-freehold' arrangement to create larger bedrooms as well as an upstairs bathroom. Of particular note is the lovely main bedroom enjoying a twin-vaulted ceiling giving a nice open feeling of light and space.

Externally the rear garden has a South Westerly aspect and is hard landscaped extending to approx. 30ft in depth with decking, railway sleeper raised borders, timber storage shed, lighting, power and water tap. There is also secure side access for bikes. EPC D.

Location: A popular residential area in an enviable location, south east of central Teddington. Hampton Wick mainline station is under half a mile away (0.42m) and both Kingston and Teddington are within easy walking distance. Royal Bushy Park is very close (0.2m) and can be reached via footbridge in nearby Bushy Park Road. For those with children the property falls within the catchment area of Collis and Sacred Heart Primary Schools, Hampton Wick junior and infants, and also Teddington senior School.

detailedDescription:
Magnificent Manor house currently undergoing a restoration programme affording a wealth of family accommodation of gracious proportions over three floors plus cellarage.

This stunning Grade II listed period house, we understand, originally dates back to the 14th century and was rebuilt in the early 1700s. Wonderful Georgian detail is still in existence including fireplaces, box window shutters, fine panelling and pine floorboards whilst the residence benefits from excellent natural light, provision for off street parking and extensive lawned gardens. The proposed accommodation comprises briefly; 5/6 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, 2/3 reception rooms, kitchen/dining room, receiving hall and cellarage. Situated within easy reach of Kew Gardens underground station, local shopping amenities in the Kew Retail Park and the walkways and vistas along the River Thames tow path.

address: Kingswood Court, Marchmont Road, Richmond, Surrey TW10
detailedDescription:
This stunning four-bedroom home with additional study offers spacious and flexible accommodation over four floors. Recently redecorated throughout, this modern home offers living space on the ground and lower ground floors, including a separate office, a large reception room and a stunning open-plan kitchen/living/dining room with a large kitchen island.

On the upper-floors there are four double bedrooms and three bathrooms including two bedrooms both with ensuites and built-in storage.

To the rear of the property is a private west-facing garden with two terraces.

The property also benefits from secure covered parking for two cars.

This property is located on the lower slopes of Richmond Hill between Richmond town centre and Richmond Hill village. Richmond Hill is a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, with the world famous Richmond Park on its doorstep. The village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few.

You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.

Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

detailedDescription:
A spacious 5 bedroom house of over 3,200 sqft situated in this highly desirable location close to the Sheen Gate to Richmond Park.

Location

Clare Lawn Avenue is situated in one of the most desirable areas in East Sheen located close to the Sheen Gate to Richmond Park. The excellent facilities offered by East Sheen are approximately 0.5 miles away where one can find a variety of shops, boutiques and restaurants; the historic town of Richmond is two miles away.

For transport, Mortlake railway station is approximately 0.7 miles away providing a frequent service to Waterloo and Clapham Junction.

There are many excellent schools in the general vicinity including Sheen Mount Primary School, St Paul's, Tower House, Ibstock Place School, The German and Swedish Schools and Colet Court.

The area also boasts numerous leisure and sporting facilities including The Roehampton Club, The Bank of England Sports Ground, Sheen Tennis and Squash Club and a host of golf courses, including The Royal Mid Surrey Golf Club and Richmond Golf Club. The 2,300 acres of Richmond Park also allow many pursuits such as walking, running and riding.

Description

A spacious and beautifully 5 bedroom house of over 3,200 sqft situated in this highly desirable location close Richmond Park.

Laid out over 3 floors, this well proportioned property comprises: 2 large reception rooms, Study/playroom, kitchen, dining room, utility room, w.c. And integrated garage. On the first floor is a principle bedroom with en suite bathroom and sauna, 3 further bedrooms and family bathroom. To the second floor is a large double bedroom with en suite bathroom. There is off-street parking to the front of the property and a secluded 70' garden to the rear.

There is also potential to further extend and enlarge subject to the usual consents.

Square Footage: 3259 sq ft

title: 2 bed cottage for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantial five-bedroom detached house offering over 3,750 sq ft of living space arranged over four floors. Through the entrance at the front of the house you walk into a wide and receiving hallway with access to a large bay fronted reception room and even bigger middle reception room with access onto

a bright and airy fully fitted kitchen/dining room with bi-fold doors onto the Terrace with stairs leading down to the garden. On the first floor there are two double bedrooms, both offering a dressing room and En-suite bathroom, stairs then lead you again to the second floor which offers two further double bedrooms and a separate four-piece bathroom.
The lower ground floor offers ideal accommodation as part of the main house or a completely separate annexed style flat with its own seperate entrance down the side of the property. With a sound proofed cinema room at the front, two utility rooms, double bedroom with fitted warbrodes and a open plan kitchen living area at the rear with doors leading out onto patio area that also allows access to the garden.
Offered to the market in immaculate condition and allowing gated off-street parking for a few cars and being on Fairfax road within catchment of the areas' best schools such as Collis and being within close proximity of some of the areas best private schools this is the ideal family home. Further benefits include being within a few moments walk of the Station, High Street and River.
title: 5 bed detached house for sale

address: Deanhill Court, Upper Richmond Road West, London SW14
detailedDescription:
Summary
An excellent two double bedroom apartment well positioned in a highly esteemed private estate. This flat is particularly light and airy with pleasant outlooks over the communal gardens and comes with the added benefits of a share of freehold and lift access.

Description
This is a spacious and light two double bedroom apartment situated on an upper floor in the highly sought after Deanhill Court private estate. The living accommodation consists of a sizeable lounge that overlooks the communal gardens, a large master bedroom with plentiful built-in wardrobes, a well-designed bathroom and a modern kitchen that leads out to the back of the property. The current owners have tastefully updated the flat with wood flooring in most of the rooms and there is plenty of storage available. The location offers quick access to Richmond and East Sheen and Mortlake station is within walking distance. The outstanding (ofsted-rated) Sheen Mount Primary School is nearby as are the outside spaces of Richmond Park and Sheen Common. Deanhill Court is popular with upsizers, downsizers, first time buyers and investment buyers alike and the flat comes with the added benefits of a share of freehold, residents parking and communal gardens.

We currently hold lease details as displayed above, should you require further information please contact the branch. Please note additional fees could be incurred for items such as leasehold packs.

1. Money laundering regulations: Intending purchasers will be asked to produce identification documentation at a later stage and we would ask for your co-operation in order that there will be no delay in agreeing the sale.
2. General: While we endeavour to make our sales particulars fair, accurate and reliable, they are only a general guide to the property and, accordingly, if there is any point which is of particular importance to you, please contact the office and we will be pleased to check the position for you, especially if you are contemplating travelling some distance to view the property.
3. The measurements indicated are supplied for guidance only and as such must be considered incorrect.
4. Services: Please note we have not tested the services or any of the equipment or appliances in this property, accordingly we strongly advise prospective buyers to commission their own survey or service reports before finalising their offer to purchase.
5. These particulars are issued in good faith but do not constitute representations of fact or form part of any offer or contract. The matters referred to in these particulars should be independently verified by prospective buyers or tenants. Neither sequence (UK) limited nor any of its employees or agents has any authority to make or give any representation or warranty whatever in relation to this property.

detailedDescription:
This spacious purpose-built apartment is situated on the second-floor of this sought after 1930’s Richmond Hill apartment building. The property comprises; a large entrance hall, two good size bedrooms, a bathroom with separate WC, a large separate kitchen and a spacious reception room with feature fireplace.

Richmond Hill Court is ideally located for the amenities of both Richmond Hill and Richmond town centre.

Richmond Hill is a small community with a beautiful village at its heart, with the world famous Richmond Park on its doorstep. The village perfectly balances city and country living thanks to the spacious green spaces and easy London transport links. An ideal location for families, Richmond Hill has outstanding state and private school options, including The Vineyard, King's House, Old Vicarage and Marshgate Primary School to name a few.

You'll find everyday amenities such as dry cleaning, smaller supermarkets and coffee spots on your doorstep alongside a selection of pubs, cafes and restaurants. Local favourites include the Richmond Hill Bakery, The Marlborough pub and La Luna di Luca restaurant. Duck Pond Market, on the scenic riverside, sells ethically-sourced local food, art and crafts every weekend.
Richmond town centre offers a wider range of shops, from independent boutiques in cobbled lanes to leading High Street brands, along with a Whole Foods Market and large Waitrose supermarket.

detailedDescription: Occupying a prime position overlooking the river and the route of the Oxford and Cambridge Boat race, is this outstanding two bedroom waterside house. This architecturally designed building is in a conservation area and forms part of Tapestry Court. It was constructed in 2007, in the grounds of a converted Victorian public house - formerly the Queen's Head Hotel which was built in 1885. In order to take advantage of its stunning river views, the house is laid out in an ‘upside down’ manner. This means the kitchen and living room, with spacious terrace, are at the top of the house and the sleeping quarters, consisting of two bedrooms and the bathroom, are below. The property is ideally located, within walking distance of Barnes Bridge station and Mortlake station with fast train links to London Waterloo. The local amenities of Barnes Village and Sheen, with their shops and cafés, are close by while the wide open spaces of Barnes Common, Richmond Park and Kew Gardens are also within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
Exceptional semi-detached period house with attractive balconied elevation overlooking a residents' private lawned square and forming part of this highly coveted Victorian crescent.

Affording elegant, beautifully proportioned principal rooms with classic high ceilings and a wealth of character detail retained. Lavished with luxury fittings and bespoke cabinetry, the property has been meticulously maintained, producing a magnificent example of one of these most sought after homes. In addition to the sumptuous family accommodation over the 3 original floors, there is a full height basement laundry room. Appointed to an exemplary standard overall, successfully combining customised interior design with integrated modern conveniences including air conditioning and Sonos music system. Outside, the property benefits from immaculately tended landscaped gardens including provision for off street parking at the front and a walled 60' approx. Garden at the rear with south facing aspect, side passageway and a superior and fully equipped garden studio. Located moments from the atmospheric village shops and restaurants whilst Kew Gardens underground station and the Victoria Gate entrance to the Royal Botanic Gardens are within convenient walking distance.

detailedDescription:
A wonderful townhouse, presented in good condition and located on this private crescent with spectacular views over the London Wetlands.

This extended house is approximately 2329 sq ft and comprises an entrance hallway, ground floor w/c and shower, a modern kitchen and conservatory to the rear leading onto a patio / lawned garden.

On the first floor there is a large reception room with two Juliette balconies to the front and a reception / bedroom at the rear. The upper two floors comprise four further double bedrooms all with fitted wardrobes and three modern bathrooms, including a main ensuite. There is an internal garage and off street parking for two cars to the front of the house.

The property is on the popular Barnes Waterside development, located just off Castelnau, offering a balance of village-style living and boasts a parade of amenities and independent eateries, whilst nearby Barnes Village is home to the well-known duck pond and a weekly farmers' market. The Village offers an array of boutiques, cafés and High Street favourites.

There are some excellent schools in the area, including renowned St Paul's Boys & Juniors, The Harrodian and The Swedish School. Local primary schools are Lowther, St Osmund's and Barnes Primary.

Hammersmith Station is the closet transport hub, with four underground lines (Hammersmith Bridge currently closed). Nearby mainline stations, for regular routes into London Waterloo and out of London, are Barnes and Barnes Bridge Stations.

detailedDescription:
Most elegant Victorian residence forming part of a handsome period terrace with balconied elevation fronting historic Kew Green.

Offering beautifully maintained accommodation of classic proportions over 3 levels plus cellar and loft room, with fine character detail in evidence and affording exceptional views over Kew Green to the front and across neighbouring gardens towards Priory Road to the rear. The property features a stunning first floor drawing room with three sets of French windows opening onto the front balcony and an interconnecting ground floor layout incorporating charming front reception room with original bay window, central kitchen/breakfast room, cloakroom and rear family room leading to a study. Opportunity exists to further extend this arrangement if required (stuc). The upper floors consist of 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and a decorated loft room. Outside there is a wonderful landscaped rear garden with timber frame fully equipped studio/summer house and rear pedestrian access. Situated within convenient walking distance to Kew Gardens village/underground station and Kew Bridge mainline station and moments from the restaurants and local shops around the green, the Elizabeth Gate entrance to the Royal Botanic Gardens and the River Thames tow path.

detailedDescription:
A well located two bedroom apartment on the first floor of a purpose built block with parking.

Location

Arundel Terrace is a quiet cul-de-sac in north Barnes. Barnes village, with its pretty duck pond, is nearby offering an eclectic mix of good independent retailers, pubs, coffee shops and highly regarded restaurants, as well as the popular Olympic Cinema and the renowned weekly Barnes Farmers Market.

For those who commute there are good bus services to Richmond and Putney as well as Barnes and Barnes Bridge stations which provide a good service into Waterloo. Hammersmith Underground is also nearby.

Description

This first floor flat opens into a central hallway giving a sense of light and space. The generous reception room is ideal for entertaining and features attractive wood flooring. The ground floor features a unique double height galleried receiving hall, magnificent 30' x 28' bespoke kitchen/family room with full width glazed doors overlooking the garden, separate front reception room, 2 studys, boot room and cloakroom. The first floor boasts a sumptuous principal bedroom suite including walk-in wardrobe/dressing room and luxury en-suite shower room together with 3 further double bedrooms, family bathroom and laundry room. The second floor incorporates an enviable 25' x 20' games/playroom, the 5th and 6th double bedrooms and shower room. Showcasing 'state of the art' contemporary fittings combined successfully with retained period character and attractive far reaching elevated views from all sides. Location

Avenue Lodge is enviably perched on picturesque Ham Common, adjacent to the bridle path that leads to historic Ham House - providing a truly semi rural feel and setting. Furthermore it is within just a few hundred metres of Richmond Park (with its 2300 deer inhabited acres) and a particularly scenic stretch of the River Thames - offering idyllic retreats from the hubbub of daily life.

The sophisticated yet charming shops and restaurants of Richmond are within just 2 miles. Whilst even closer at hand 'The Petersham Nurseries' and 'The Dysart' are held in high gastronomic esteem

Richmond train station provides a direct and rapid service into London Waterloo, as well as the District Line tube and overland line to Stratford, via north London.

There is a good selection of local shops at Ham Parade that cater superbly for day to day requirements, also within just a few hundred metres.

Local schools enjoy an excellent reputation and are amongst the best in the country.

Description

Avenue Lodge was built circa 1734 and is denoted as a building of special architectural and historical interest, by virtue of its Grade II listed status. Approached through double timber gates and set within a generous plot of just under an acre the house occupies a discrete setting, with its delightful walled gardens including a tennis court and indoor swimming pool. Also within the curtilage of Avenue Lodge and included within the sale is Avenue Cottage, an utterly charming two storey Dutch gabled cottage that was built in 1679 and is also Grade II listed. Behind Avenue Cottage there is a sizeable double garage which has a fabulous room above it, providing an ideal space for a teenagers den, gymnasium or games room.

With its stunning white rendered facade and beautifully regimented fenestration Avenue Lodge truly is a Georgian gem and this period integrity is also wonderfully intact inside, with a number of notable features including gorgeous fireplaces and a most elegant staircase. What really sets this house apart from so many of the other landmark period houses in and around Richmond is its lateral configuration. It is extremely rare to find a property of over 8000 square feet (in total) that is arranged over just two levels.

Tastefully refurbished and presented, there is a wonderful homely atmosphere and the beautiful open aspects and large windows afford a superb flow of natural light. The accommodation is practically yet flexibly configured and beautifully balanced, lending the house equally well to both everyday family life and formal entertaining.

Other features of particular note include underfloor heating throughout downstairs, three wired internet positions around the house, high speed internet connection, sky tv and solar heating panels for the swimming pool.

Whilst we can't supply all of the history of the house in this text there is more available upon request and a summary as follows : William Genew was a major local land owner who died in 1730, bequeathing his son, also William, an estate of roughly 30 acres in The Common Fields of Ham. He also owned two cottages set in around three acres, where he built Avenue Lodge and St Michaels Convent next door. In addition to his initial mortgage of £400 Genew took a further mortgage of £200 shortly after the construction of both properties was complete in 1734. However Genew had seemingly overstretched himself as by 1737 he was a 'prisoner in the Fleet for debt' and his estate was assigned to trustees on behalf of his creditors.

By 1892 Avenue Lodge had been purchased by Lord Dysart and was let to a series of short stay tenants (at an initial rent of £75 pa) of which little is known, except for a man by the name of Gilbert `a Beckett Terrell. He wrote a number of letters to Lord Dysart's agent complaining that Lord Dysart's cows got into Ham Walks (the bridle path leading to Ham House) to eat the grass but also munched holes in the hedge along his property, so that village children were able to stare in at them in their garden !

This is an extremely rare opportunity to secure a house of this calibre, history and setting and we are very proud and excited to be representing our clients as the sole selling agents.

Square Footage: 8074 sq ft

A Newly Refurbished Four Bedroom Semi-Detached Family Home In Twickenham

A newly refurbished four bedroom semi-detached family home in Twickenham. Having been tastefully refurbished throughout, the property offers contemporary living and benefits from an incredible integrated kitchen with Quartz worktops and is open plan to a dining/family room complete with two skylights and two separate sets of bi-fold doors opening onto a superb landscaped rear garden. Arranged over two floors, there are four double bedrooms in total with one benefiting from an en-suite shower room as well as an additional modern family bathroom. Additionally the property benefits from oak wooden flooring throughout the ground floor, downstairs W.C, detached garage, off-street parking for multiple cars and electric secure gates to the front.

Latham Close is a quiet cul-de-sac and is ideally situated just moments from Twickenham Station offering a frequent service into London Waterloo. The charms of south-west London are easily explored on foot or by bike include nearby parks such as Marble Hill, The Royal Botanic Gardens in Kew and Richmond Park, the largest of London’s Royal Parks. Twickenham offers a range of amenities including Starbucks, Nandos, Waitrose and Marks & Spencer. Nearby Richmond offers a vibrant mix of high street, boutique, designer and antique shops. A selection of both private and state-run schools are located nearby including St Mary’s Primary and Orleans Park (Ofsted Outstanding)

detailedDescription:
A magnificently proportioned detached Edwardian of over 3800 sq ft

Location

The house is within just a few hundred metres of Twickenham centre, with its superb array of shopping and recreational facilities - including a large representation by many of the major retail outlets, as well as quaint array of more specialist stores and boutiques. The charming village of St Margarets can also be found within just a few hundred metres.

Twickenham train station provides a rapid and direct service into London Waterloo, taking just twenty minutes.

There are many green open spaces nearby (including Moormead Gardens and tennis courts and the fabulous Marble Hill Park), providing an ideal retreat from the hubbub of daily life. Twickenham also houses one of the most picturesque stretches of the River Thames.

Schools in the area enjoy an excellent reputation and are considered amongst the best in the country.

Description

This wonderful family home is a great example of Edwardian architecture, with its handsome facade featuring a distinctive gable, tall casement windows (including a charming oriel one) and a pretty tile hung entrance porch. Internally this period integrity is also apparent with high corniced ceilings, picture rails and beautiful fireplaces. All of which are complimented by the excellent natural light and tasteful decor.

There is a superb flow to the accommodation, providing as well for everyday family life as it does for more formal entertaining, with three reception rooms on the ground floor, in addition to a fabulous kitchen/breakfast room, a large utility room and stunning reception hallway. On the first floor there is a generous principal suite with its own dressing room (possible sixth bedroom) and bathroom, in addition to three further bedrooms and two bathrooms. The second (top) floor is a really lovely space that is currently used as an 'office at home' but would also be ideal as a bedroom or 'teenagers den'.

Other features of particular note include 'reverse cycle' air conditioning (allowing use for both cooling and heating in eight rooms), a good size garage and secure off street parking for up to three cars behind electric gates.

To the rear of the house there is a well established and delightful garden that is predominantly laid to lawn, with a spacious patio providing an ideal area for alfresco dining during the warmer months. The garden faces west south west and thus retains the late afternoon and early evening sunshine.

Fortunately our clients are not in a chain and can therefore offer an uncomplicated sale with flexibility on timescale.

address: Temple Sheen Road, East Sheen, London SW14
detailedDescription:
A unique extended and refurbished 5 bedroom detached house of approximately 3,000 sqft with a walled south facing garden.

Location

The property is situated down a long private driveway at the top end of Temple Sheen Road, a quiet residential street 0.6 miles from historic Richmond Park, and even closer to Sheen Wood and Sheen Common with its cricket club and tennis courts; there are also two highly-rated gastro-pubs located within walking distance from the house.

The centre of Sheen is approximately 0.3 miles in the other direction, where Mortlake railway station provides direct trains to Richmond (District line), Clapham Junction, Vauxhall (Victoria line) and London Waterloo (Bakerloo, Northern and Jubilee lines).

There are many excellent schools in the area including Sheen Mount Primary School (approximately 175 meters from the property), and also private schools St Pauls School, Tower House and Ibstock Place.

Local sporting facilities include the Bank of England Sports Club, the Roehampton Club, Sheen Tennis & Squash club, various golf courses and children's' football at Palewell Park, and the many opportunities (including cycling, walking, running and riding) in Richmond Park.

Description

An exceptional extended and comprehensively refurbished five bedroom detached house finished to the highest of standards situated on this popular parkside road close to Sheen Mount Primary and Sheen Common.

Approached via a long private driveway, this unique house provides extensive laterally configured accommodation and an abundance of natural light.

The ground floor comprises a wide entrance hallway, reception room, a spacious kitchen/dining/family room of approximately 850 sq ft with slimline sliding glass doors overlooking a walled south-facing garden. There is a further playroom/study off the family room, a downstairs cloakroom and a separate utility room with its own outside access.

On the first floor is a fabulous principal bedroom suite with built-in wardrobes and an en suite bathroom. There are three further double bedrooms and a family bathroom.

On the second floor is a large open plan landing with a study area and bedroom five with a shower room.

The house also benefits from off-street parking for a number of cars and a walled south-facing garden.

Square Footage: 3000 sq ft

Benefiting also from a well appointed shower room and wood flooring. Conveniently located within easy reach of Kew Gardens underground station, North Sheen mainline station and the local shopping amenities.

address: Richmond Bridge Estate, East Twickenham TW1
detailedDescription:
A stylish and beautifully refurbished two bedroom, two bathroom apartment situated on the first floor of Turner House, the first phase of this luxurious and impressive riverside development.
This stunning apartment is set on the first floor, enjoys excellent natural light and lovely landscaped communal gardens. There is one secure underground parking space accessible via the direct lift and is situated close to the exit. Other notable benefits include 24 hour security personnel and two communal gymnasiums.

Situation
The Richmond Bridge Estate is a landmark gated development of luxury apartments with underground parking, 24 hr concierge service, residents gym and extensive beautifully kept communal gardens. The development is located on the River Thames, just on the on the west side of Richmond Bridge.

Richmond town centre offers extensive and sophisticated shopping, dining and entertainment options. Many mainstream and independent retailers occupy the high street and pretty lanes that run between George Street and Richmond Green. Richmond station provides fast direct services to London Waterloo, plus District Line Underground and London Overground services.

Additional Information
This property is to be sold with a share of the freehold alongside a lease that was granted on the 25th March 1996 for 999 years. The vendor has advised that the bi-annual service charge is £1880 and there is no ground rent. The bi-annual charge for the car parking space is £83.99.
